title: Not Safe
review: I met a guy from this app when we originally talked and then ended up found each other from one of the dating sites and we decided to meet and we had a good time until he ended up choking and beating me up that night. I made a report to the police however they said the name and address he gave me was fake and the property was someone’s else and they said I should have write his license plate so they could pull up who this person was. He caught so many lies and they recommended me to report all the apps and sites he used and they all banned his account except this app. I submitted the pictures of us before and after what happened to me. Murf and Marcos from support team did nothing to help to protect people like me. I highly do not recommend this app to anyone otherwise you are on your own risk.

title: kinda creepy
review: they’ve recently “improved” the format, so now instead of seeing a range of guys worldwide you’re confronted with guys who viewed you, guys you woofed at or guys who woofed at you - it’s incredibly creepy. why would someone want to be confronted with every guy who approached them, or who they approached who then blew them off, every time - is that supposed to be fun? you can block the real creepers from that list, but it eats up your 200 blocks fast - and sure, yes, you could just ignore that the app leads off with guys who stalked you and guys who blew you off, but they could also add a way to disable this “feature” - they could give guys the option of not opening the app to “guys who never got back to you” and “guys who are stalking you”, maybe just lead off with the “eye candy you can’t have 6000 miles away” section instead. other than dredging up bad memories every time you open it the app is pretty great, and you sure can’t beat the price

title: Suspended Profile
review: After being a paying PRO member for close to 5 years, my profile was suspended yesterday after sending a visitor a website link (I’m guessing that’s what it was - as the reason was vague, said repeated abuse - which there was NONE) who had asked a question about his stay. I’m still not certain what the issue was - filed a report 24 hours ago - ZERO response from Scruff. And my profile is still suspended. Lost several conversations mid stream. If this is how Scruff treats a longtime, paying member, without ANY HISTORY of abuse with nonexistent customer support, I’d hate to see how terrible others could be treated. Of course, Scruff can be a great tool for meeting people, especially traveling, but an issue like this is COMPLETELY unacceptable. Worst customer (non) service I’ve experienced in a long time.

title: Great benefits from Basic to Pro
review: Of the apps that I have used. SCRUFF is by far one of the better ones, up there with Recon. Comparing to the all famous Grindr, SCRUFF offers more features with your free membership, features that you have to pay around $40 a month for on Grindr. Speaking of money, the PRO membership in SCRUFF is by far more reasonable and unlocks quite a bit more. I have found the SCRUFF is less likely to have one time hookups and instead allows you to make friends that you may or may not have repeats with. Overall it’s a great app!

title: Not a great update
review:
Ver 6 
Changing fonts usually means you’re running out of innovation. Apple does this every release now. 

Put the chat and woof buttons back to the right side.  It’s bad and difficult as it is now. 

Probably no one asked for the way too large images sizes. Might want to survey that along with many other “ways things are” in the app. 

Navigation is improved in some places but very much worse in others. 
The buttons at the bottom were better on the side. 
Having the favs button at bottom now means that you have to make effort to get to your top fav favs. Before you just moved slightly into the top of your list. Now you have to move all the way to top of screen. 
In mobile usage, this is extremely bad. 

Been needing a link to see the entire profile for a long time now in Match. 

I don’t think the Global view should default to latest online.  Most people aren’t looking for just whatever has popped up.  Enable most woof’d to be at top. 

Do enough people really use Ventures?  It’s not a well enough populated resource.

The moderator(s) suspended my profile without asking for my side of the story and gave no clear indication as to how long the suspension would last and I got no response when I tried to appeal their nonsense so I deleted my profile and I swore I will never use their app again. Horrible customer service. Zero features inside the app. I never opened the app unless I got a message because everyone I know uses Grindr.

review: I posted a face picture twice. Both times it was rejected with the following message: “This photo is in violation of our profile photo guidelines. Violation reason: No member visible”. title: Definitive App For Manly Men
review:
My first review for this app comes after an update which crashes regularly.  It even manages to take part of iPadOS with it, returning it to the PIN unlock screen.  A real disaster.

The app itself is okay, but the cost to be a paid member is ridiculous for what you get.  I also hate that you can only pay it via the App Store.  I don’t do anything with recurring billing except directly to the developer.  Maybe if they followed that model they could lower the price to something more reasonable/affordable.

The “would you meet” and swipe match system is hokey and doesn’t really do much when a large segment of people do not participate.

review:
There has never been audio alerts when you receive a “WOOF” or when someone unlocks their pics for you. They obviously don’t have the app coded correctly and need to look into the problem instead of ignoring it. I have the same issue on my iPad as I do on my iPhone.  PLEASE ADDRESS THESE ISSUES!!!

title: Need to adjust options
review:
Love the app because it offers a variety of ways to modify and individualize your personal profile and because the majority of users are courteous and friendly.

However, they need to complete certain features. For example, the app lets you state that you are in a polyamorous relationship. However, it does not let you link up to more than one partner... You would think that if the category of polyamorous is available, then someone at Scruff would have thought that enabling more than partner would be a rational profile option to include.

I sent them a message about it but received a general thank you response to my submission... twice now.

I hope that in the future they actually put into action some of the suggestions from users to improve the quality of the interactions one can have using their social platform.  Scruff has been quite innovative. Listening to feedback would only help them improve the product.
developerResponse: {'id': 1792879, 'body': 'Thank you once more for sharing your feedback. We will certainly take your suggestions into consideration for future updates regarding partner linking for members in polyamorous relationships. Thanks for being a member of SCRUFF! WOOF!', 'modified': '2017-11-20T01:43:45Z'}

title: Better user experience than Grindr
review:
Generally a more masc scene than Grindr but that’s not the only reason I prefer it.
The user experience is far better than Grindr. The ads are reasonable, not intrusive, and actually relevant. I have never had a problem with spambots or phishing like Grindr has. 

My only suggestion would be to lift the limit on total blocks, even if you have to limit it per day like Grindr does. I’ve reached my limit because there is no shortage of guys who can’t take a hint or even explicit rejection.

title: Terrible Functionality
review:
I decided to pop back onto my account recently.  As I logged in I discovered that the App blocks any access to profiles, as well as blocking me from disabling/editing my account whatsoever.  I ensured I was on both the app and my phone’s latest versions. As well I tried this off and on a wifi network. 

Upon contacting support I got zero feedback over a few weeks time.  After having been a former pro member this completely dissuaded me from ever utilizing the paid feature set again (as if I could actually access the account to do so).

Furthermore, I tried creating a second account and it didn’t even retain my email address, thus there is another account that’s completely inaccessible.  This app is a technical joke, as is its support base.

Edit:  and now the developer team responds and ignores the fact I already said I contacted support.  A blanket statement reply used multiple times in these reviews that helps no one.  Again, your team is a flat-out disappointment and not worth this time/effort.

title: Needs Improvement
review:
This app is a great idea! I’ve met several cool dudes on here, but encounter the same problems over and over.
The private album feature needs updated. It’s silly to ask users to pay money to see others’ picture which they do not own!
I’ve also encountered too many creeps and predators on this app. Typically I block them and move on. However, the app creators decided it would be a good idea to limit the amount of users that can be blocked? Unfortunately I might have to delete the app as I am not able to protect myself from predators due to this silly money-grabbing limitation. They should be careful.. sounds like a lawsuit waiting to happen.

We’re here for you and appreciate you getting in touch!', 'modified': '2020-11-14T22:12:01Z'}

title: Options and Consent
review: This app allows for the full understanding of options that I think people actually do respond to. The ability to write a comprehensive profile, to let people know of interest, to share social media platforms, and the ease with which to share photos (of any nature) has been streamlined. I do wish certain features were more available in the free version of Scruff, but alas it is a profiteering company, slave to capitalism as many of us are. Kudos, Scruff, for providing the services you do.
developerResponse: {'id': 1567535, 'body': "Thanks for your comments! We're happy to hear that you're enjoying SCRUFF. Thanks for being a valued member of our community. WOOF!", 'modified': '2017-10-23T21:21:42Z'}

title: Discrimination! Possible racism.
review: I have experienced extreme discrimination with regards to the “guidelines and policies” for an appropriate profile picture. My picture was removed because I was in swim shorts. However I have noticed that many other users have not been flagged or asked to remove their more revealing picture. As a test, I screenshot and used a revealing picture (more than mine) of another user, just to see if I was being treated with prejudice. His picture got approved!! I am very disappointed with you all... I need to understand why some can keep their revealing profile pictures and others can’t. Perhaps there’s a some racism behind this??? If so, legal matters may have to take place. I look forward to hearing some kind of response..

title: poor update
review: The global grid was useful, but had different kinds of information. Now we have: guys you have woofed (already in the Woofs section), guys who have woofed you (already in the Woofs section), guys who have unlocked their pics for you (which is already in the Received Albums section) and astrological matches. At least “new guys around you” still comes up occasionally. I think the concept is actually good, but at the expense of the global grid, it’s kind of lame. Otherwise the app is really good and works very well.

title: Seriously lacking sufficient filters
review:
App gives lots of options in setting up profile but
Most importantly you cannot filter by gender. In the begythis app for for men but they added every gener description know to humanity with no way to filter on it. With this I will not renew subscription without a good filter than to manually block everyone who is not the gender types I am interested in. 

Imagine a car search app missing the basic car truck filter, Especially as the crossover types are everywhere. Makes this app difficult. That what this app is.
developerResponse: {'id': 30630111, 'body': 'Thanks for the feedback! We’re lucky to have members like you as a part of the SCRUFF community.', 'modified': '2022-06-29T23:16:31Z'}

title: Going downhill
review:
App used to be so much better. They keep removing features already paid for. Can no longer see who you’ve view or who you’ve woofed. 
Also as a paid pro subscriber (costing a small fortune), I also get adds all the time under the messages section.  Scruff is always trying to sell me some pill of some type.  2-3 advertisements every day and as a paid subscriber I was under the impression there were no ads.  

They have also removed features and filters and the direction of the app is concerning.  I’ve contacted support regarding my concerns so we shall see what they have to say.

title: Scruff vs Grindr
review:
Scruff-
Pro- I noticed with Scruff that the app works VERY well. Smooth, never crashes, and the functionality of the entire app is amazing. I haven’t experienced any issues with it. 

Cons: I don’t like how the majority of the app has “older” guys. I’m 23 years old and I am not interested in 40-50 year olds messaging me. Secondly, I don’t like that you don’t have any flexibility with filtering the “age”of the guys you wanna talk too. You NEED to have the “pro” version compared to Grindr you don’t. I’ve been using Grindr more than Scruff because of those major reasons for me. I wish Scruff will have some flexibility with adding more features for the “free” version. Comparing the two, I would still choose Grindr over Scruff any day.

title: Wrongful suspension
review: This app has contributed to people’s inability to distinguish what is socially appropriate. Men will constantly send you nude pictures without your consent and when it’s reported nothing has been done about it in my experience. A lot of individuals using the app do not know boundaries and will harass you if you don’t provide nudity, provide “meetups”, or if you don’t unlock your photos. I was recently suspended for an advertisement joke on my profile whereas the people who brutally harass you and then block you get away with it because you no longer have access to their profile to report them. Go to a bar instead. Not worth the time you spend on these apps.

WOOF!', 'modified': '2022-04-16T12:11:42Z'}

title: Non paying customers
review: I’m not clear why “non-paying” customers receive less and less services, a “back of the bus treatment” when it is the non- paying customers that are subjected to most adds...ostensibly one of the BIG sources of income for Scruff.  I understand why one wants more paying customers but the imbalance is notable since you need them both as streams of income.  Or do the paying customers receive just as many adds???  If not, then you could show a bit more appreciation and treat all customers equitably. It was not always that way with Scruff.  Just a thought/suggestion.

title: I like Scruff for the most part except
review: There are people that I REALLY do not want to talk to on there for various reasons. I hate that Scruff only allows you to block a certain amount of people unless you upgrade to Pro. Even grindr allows you to block unlimited people, although they have it so that you can only block a certain amount each day (still a significant amount of blocks). I could understand if Scruff controlled the amount of blocks that way, but to not be able to block anyone ever again at all after just a few blocks is setting them up for failure. If there’s one reason that I delete this app that’s why...

title: Please allow copy/paste in order to translate
review: The app does not allow you to copy text you receive from other users. This would be extremely helpful when chatting with men with whom you do not speak a common language because it would allow you to quickly copy their messages, and paste them to a translation app. Instead, you must try and type their messages which is very tedious. Allowing greater ease to translate would make sense on an app which is meant to meet men from all over the world.

title: Latest update = Fail
review:
Woke up to a brand new looking scruff
Somethings good most things bad… The font is ridiculous I need glasses just to read a profile! Prior to the update I was able to go to the Messages area and simply read messages without having to click on someone’s profile. Now I HAVE to go to the profile just to read the message! If you’re trying to avoid communications with someone, and just read their message… You no longer can!

Suggestions of the developer: when doing a major upgrade why don’t you offer a tutorial option for users especially those of us who paid the premium!!

title: Great APP!!
review: I have used 4 other APPs because I am new to dating today.  Everything SCRUFF advertises is true.  The capability to filter, select different cities and countries is just amazing.  The site is as we use it.  I have used it to meet guys and determine if we have chemistry.  Not a hook up, just for sex, but measure compatibility. Again, the site is a tool, how you use it determines its value!  No other site I have used has been as beneficial and accurate!
developerResponse: {'id': 30024156, 'body': 'Thanks for the message. We are very thankful to have you as a valued member of our community!', 'modified': '2022-05-28T18:03:26Z'}

title: Best gay dating app there is!
review:
One idea/suggestion: Can you guys make a feature where two people can link their accounts so that they can talk to all the same people but still have different profiles? Right now my boyfriend and I share one account but it’s hard for people to tell who is talking to them. I want the freedom of my own account but the flexibility to chat in groups.

Besides my above idea, the app is amazing. It’s way more than sex. I have made solid friendships.

We have shared this suggestion with our product team they will take it into consideration as we plan future updates. WOOF!', 'modified': '2017-07-20T22:22:19Z'}

title: Don’t post this. Don’t post that....
review:
There is no consistency when it comes to photos being flagged or not approved. Those in the “Most Woofed” sections seem to get their pictures through unchecked even though there are some questionable/boarder line of breaking the Profile photo guidelines. 

What’s the deal? 

I’ve even been told, while trying to argue a photo of myself, if I see a picture that is questionable then it’s my job to flag it.🤦🏽‍♂️ But, that’s not my job....I’m not getting paid for it. I 

This app was great, and I love the new features of multiple photos in the profile and being able to watch clips....but needs to be more consistent.

UPDATE

And as expected the developers of the app claim to hold the same standard for ALL members. 🤦🏽‍♂️And how it’s the user’s responsibility to monitor other people’s profile pics. 

My new photo was rejected not because it was flagged by someone else....because my picture never made it that far. It was someone behind the scenes and I am aware of the guidelines because I have always followed them.

Submit a ticket to our support team by navigating to Settings in SCRUFF and selecting “Contact SCRUFF Support”. You can also visit support.scruff.com the submit the request. title: Good user interface, good community
review:
The greatest appeal to Scruff for me is it’s community. it can be hard to form relationships on dating apps, but I have managed to make good friendships and relationships on this app. It’s a great tool when traveling to meet new people as well as a means to connect with familiar faces in your home city. 

I find the interface and user experience of the app to be enjoyable (I pay for ScruffPro). 

Scruff is much better than Grindr.

title: Scruff is Rough
review:
EXTREMELY DISAPPOINTED!!  Plain and simple horrible application and horrible people.  The worst thing is that the whole thing is filled with either fake Ai-chatbots, fake profiles of foreign scammers, or hateful people who message racist, antisocial, hurtful, and even violent death threats.  Reporting the users and incidents does nothing and they continue to troll and harass people who do not even post anything about anyone on any social platform.  

It’s disgusting and disrespectful and it is time to go back to the US Consumer Protection Agency, Police, and FBI officials because this is sick and dangerous and unbelievable that Google, Apple, Facebook/Meta even entertain and promote this kind of nonsense and discrimination on their platform or websites.  ABSOLUTELY SHAMEFUL

title: Went downhill after redesigns —
review: What happened here?  No QA, UI or UX testing???  • Functionally has gone downhill!!!  • For example, you dropped the ability to look at the person’s profile before or after looking at a received shared album. • And where’s the filtering to remove numerous profiles with no-picture profiles??   • There’s a ridiculous pop-up that stays in the way wanting me to upgrade. !! No thanks!!  “now I remember why I deleted my ten-year old profile”.  • Not enough for my money.  • No quality.   • Too many incomplete and fake profiles.   You once had it— Not anymore.

title: I don’t recommend
review: The app is easy to use .. but unlike Grindr, Scruff only gives you so much access unless you pay 120$ a year, everything is blocked off unless you pay, you can’t keep a photo album unless you pay, if a guy sends you his photo album you can’t see his pics unless you pay, you can’t look back on conversations unless you pay, they make you fill out a complete profile to get to see more guys unless you pay then you can see unlimited, it’s kinda lame actually.. I was bummed because a friend told me to switch from regular Grindr to Scruff and it was a big disappointment.

title: New discover is lame.
review: One of the great things that distinguished Scruff from its competitors was the global grid and most wooded. The new discover screen is much worse: even though you can bring back the global grid, it doesn’t update as much (you can refresh multiple time and it’s the same guys), the most woofed only comes up occasionally, and instead I get mostly guys I already woofed at or already matched with (what’s “discovery” about that? I can already access that in other parts of the app) or guys that are “new” but are offline so who knows if and when they check the app. This is a significant downgrade.

title: Rich in features and functions for non Pro members???
review: Didn’t renew pro... now I can only see the  first 15 albums shared..wanna message a favorite over500 miles away? Upgrade to Pro....Scruff is basically holding info hostage unless you upgrade to Pro. Want to send a pic you’ve sent before?? Hope it wasn’t more than 2 pics ago... Otherwise you’d better hope you still have it in your photos on phone....but you don’t.  Want to save that photo you don’t have on your phone from a chat you’ve previously had??  Nada...can if you have Pro...otherwise screenshot and crop it....so I’m not sure where rich in features and functions come into play with non Pro members....

title: Bs app
review:
My profile photo was removed for no apparent reason (literally just a picture of my face) when there are dozens of other profiles of men in underwear or violating other reasonable photo guidelines. Only reason given was “other”. As far as the app itself, most features are only available to paid members. You can only see very few nearby profiles and only see the last few messages of your conversation threads. The album feature is nearly unusable unless you’re willing to shell out $15 bucks a month. 

The app is very useful for seeing the 20 closest headless torsos. I won’t be wasting any more of my time on here and would advise you don’t either.

title: I give up
review: I stopped using scruff because 95% of my pictures are somehow inappropriate.  Half the pictures on there are shirtless yet somehow if I take my shirt off I’m viewed as xrated by their algorithm.  I take pictures hiding my underwear, pulling my pants up.  It becomes pointless after a while.  I could walk down the road or go to the beach without my shirt on but some how scruffs algorithm seems to think I’m just way too sexy for other men (or children god forbid) to see my abs.  My pictures upload fine on every single other app with no complaints yet scruff has the “safe for church” algorithm turned on.  No thanks scruff ... I’ll pass

title: Their tech support is the best.
review: I am a legally blind man. And was having trouble using certain buttons on the Scruff app. I sent a inquiry into Scruff tech-support and they fixed it so I could use it. It is making my experience with Scruff so much better. I would suggest this app to anyone. Besides it is the best app. Not only for blind people that use the voiceover program but for anybody that is out there looking for a great community of men.

title: What Happened to This App?
review:
I used to really enjoy this app. Lots of quality guys, useful features, engaging conversations, etc. Overall, it was a good experience compared to most dating apps. 

Now it seems like there are less guys on here. I def don’t get as much exposure in the global grid as I once used to. I’ve also noticed with time features have been taken away. I know if I get a response it’ll be the generic “oh well we took them away because not many people were using them.” But I know that’s not true. Really sad for what’s become of this app.

review: These people have an over inflated idea of what a social dating app should cost per month. Plus they lie during the holiday week they make many of the premium features free but then it’s a lie, the message history was suppose to unlock but it did not. I wanted a chat from someone long ago whom I didn’t favorite and I’m not paying the monthly rate to unlock just to have them keep taking in too much for the junk app that is just a different copy of any other social dating app. You need some real programming improvements that actually pair people but you’re all cowards at suggesting such stuff!

title: Better than Grindr
review:
I was on Grindr for years but they have become an app to advertise silly games and products to gay men, along with other problems.

The guys I met and talked to on Scruff are kind and honest. Actually more respectful. I do have a few concerns, there are mostly white and older guys on here which is fine but I would like to see more men around my age. My biggest complaint is that a shirtless pic gets flagged but I see other profiles with much more scandalous pics. I don’t understand it.

title: I'm sure it's great if you like to be catfished!
review: This thing is full of scammers. I can't even tell you how many times it's happened on this app. Of course, if you report someone for doing this, your account will get suspended for no good reason. They, also, block your conversation after a few sentences if you don't pay a lot of money for their membership. So, that's pretty ridiculous. I'm not even sure how the algorithm works, but I know guys that have this that don't show up when standing right beside me. I get the same guys that I find unattractive on there all the time on the "nearby" feed. It's useless. Don't get it. Don't pay for it! It's a huge scam.

title: Great app, trash diversity
review: Scruff is great if you are a white, hyper masculine gay. Anything else? Good luck! Besides other complaints of racist profile picture screening that I myself experienced, this app does nothing but reinforce the worst parts of the gay community (racism, femme shaming, body shaming, transphobia). I was told this app was more accepting and overall friendlier and safer than Grindr, but after using it I laugh at the comparison. The app itself is easy to use, discreet and well-designed, but until Scruff can diversify and ACTUALLY contribute something to making the LGBTQ community an accepting place, I won’t be using it. 👎🏼

review: When I first started using it, I thought it was cool looking at profiles of other men around the world.   But after you get lots of messages from men 5000 miles away, you realize how worthless it is.   Please allow me to opt out of having my profile on the global page.   And it shouldn’t be the first page to display; nearby should be first, since it is the most relevant.

title: Overpriced and poor selection
review:
Stopped using this app because they are  excessively restrictive with the profile photos they allow. It is also designed to be unusable without a paid subscription, the result of which is that this app will always have fewer users. Grindr works better without a subscription which means means that Grindr has a much larger selection. Grindr moderators and customer support are also far superior to this app. 

If you want a much smaller selection of guys to choose from and moderators that take down every photo you post, then this app is for you.  Big thumbs down.

title: Like the upgrade
review: The new photo options are great. The only thing that’s weird is the photo slide direction changes when viewing the profile or viewing the full image it’s a tad weird. Maybe keep them the same direction? Also, I wish there was an easier way to select multiple messages and delete them if you want to clear your inbox out a bit. Other than that it’s a good app. Functions better than Grindr for sure.

title: Needs Major Refinements
review:
-The font is way too narrow, hard to read
-The font looks italicized 
-The font is squished and too spaced out
-The font is too thin and hard to read
-The font needs to be changed to something more bold and legible to read! 

-the new UI seems like it doesn’t fit the screen at all. I have the XS Max and it looks so squished and in my face. It does not look good. It is not proportioned with the screen ratio. It looks like an overlay that hasn’t been corrected or overlooked by another person. 

-the profile icons are way too large and since they’re so large all the profile pictures are blurry. -The app looks undone and unfinished-I can name a similar app that looks the same exact as this new Scruff App.............

**Scruff has been, hands down the best app out there and with this update it has been ruined. The font is terrible and the UI is so squished. I am so disappointed with this update. I really hope to see an update change right away.

Erasing users chat history and limiting picture sending vastly lowers the overall experience for all users, paid and unpaid. The intrusive ads are more than enough. I’m a paid Grindr user and you don’t will over customers by strong arming them into premium features... there are ten app just like this one and the same users are on those too, I don’t see any reason why I should use this one, all things considered.

title: Major Privacy Issue
review: So I’m chatting with someone in the app chat feature, and he sends me a detailed map showing exactly where my house is.  I was like...WTH!!????  How the heck did he get my location.  Turns out your location is automatically revealed to others.  You can either set it to when you use the app, or all the time.  But your location will he shown to others while you are using the app automatically.  NO THANK YOU.  Huge violation of my privacy.  Wrote the owner of the app and got back a blanket response that didn’t even address my question at all. If you are on the DL, forget about it.

Be very cautious of the people you meet on this app.  My block button doesn’t work and I have contacted scruff three times and it hasn’t been fixed.  If you’re gonna use this app only use the free version because it’s just a playground filled with undercover cops looking to entrap you into illegal drug activity.

title: Just when you think it can’t get any worse...
review:
Since Scruff apparently hires people with no reading comprehension I’ll try to make this simple and use small words to explain my frustration.

-Reported impersonation in the app
-Went through all the verification
-Wrote provided verification number on paper
-Took photo with paper
-Uploaded photo with report detail of impersonation.
-Received response from Scruff 3 days later asking to clarify my request. 
-🙄🤦🏻‍♂️
-Explained yet again
-2 days later, Scruff replies with another request to submit photo with verification number written on paper to prove identity
-Explained I already did that
-Still waiting for reply
-Decided not worth the hassle
-Deleted Scruff
-Developers are free to forward info to whatever department to delete my account permanently as I will not be using it again.
-Realize that it’s unlikely that Scruff staff will use brain and/or be helpful *sigh*

I never got a response back from jack’d support and I ultimately just had to block the account. A friend of mine was also harassed by the same account and nothing was done for him either.

title: “Compatible star signs”
review: Replacing the global grid with a mandatory zodiac-themed grid is an interesting choice. It replaces a feature I’ve liked for years with one that makes me a little embarrassed when scrolling past it. I’d love for it to be more obvious how I can opt out of this new grid option like how you used to choose to avoid other cringey grids like “most woofed”, but I can’t seem to find the option while digging. Can we flip this to an opt-in feature, please?

title: New photo rules killed the app.
review:
Scruff created new photo requirements. They could use some tightening up to stay in app stores but they're too extreme.  My beard covers too much of my face to make me recognizable to their software so I get blocked for using features.  I've submitted help tickets before but it takes too much effort and time waiting for responses.  They're automatic and clearly not personal. 

If you look at their marketing and social media most of their insta pics and Facebook pics, they violate their own photo guidelines.  

I've been paying since 2009 but I'm done with scruff.

review: The free version of the app continually locks MY photo album and messages and photos shared! The developers are obviously focused on ad income and not user experience. I have submitted over 10 comments and receive the same canned response, “We appreciate you experience and will forward your feedback to our support team.” They obviously have the same canned responses to everyone. title: Suits Needs of Many User Types
review:
Friends? Networking? Meeting Similar Interest Types? Old Friends? Dating Possibilities? Just Passing Time?  It accommodates many user types and many purposes.   

SCRUFF name is fun and not inappropriate, not off color.  "Yes, I am on Scruff" isn't embarrassing to say in public. 

Profile creation options are sufficient in number and description as is the custom search feature.

The Pro membership fee, if you choose it, is very reasonable for the additional features it gives to the user.  But, the free version works very well, too.

Each upgrade brings with it new features!  I look forward to seeing this app continue to grow    ⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️

review: I’ve been a huge fan of scruff for years as it has always had the best UI, but now the UI is suffering with recent updates. Moving the woof and messages sections to the bottom without the option to change it back to normal is frustrating. You can no longer see who you woof’d at or viewed, even with Pro. I think these features have cheapened the app.

I just let guys know my preference is dating and I’m finding many guys feel the same way.  Give it a try.  You can set your own rules for its use and meet nice men.

title: The censorship is ridiculous.
review:
I have a paid membership. I posted an artistic photo and although there was no nudity, my hand was down my pants. In compliance, I censored out the image with a generously sized, black censor bar. And now they suspended my account. I'm essentially locked out and stuck paying for their service. This same uncensored image is posted on Instagram without issue.

And now, Scruff will add some lame comment about how I can submit a request for review.

I already did. And I'm still locked out and stuck paying for the service.

After about 3 seconds your post telling me to update comes up AGAIN, so, like an idiot, I click on the advertisement to take me to the update menu and AGAIN, I am back at the app and it only allows me to open... vicious circle that gets me nowhere

Whoever designed this was either a moron or in it for a cash grab, especially considering the number of ads.

title: Greed
review:
You usually have to dismiss not just two full screen ads with the X when you open the app.  Wouldn’t just one be enough?

If you scroll down too far they have a little box that covers some of the thumbnail pics telling you you can see more if you pay.  Greed.  

Plus the app lets you seem to be able to do things like run searches and then only tells you when you try to do them that you have to upgrade.   Want to see muscle guys aged 35 and over? Nope, can’t do it unless you pay up! 

I’m not saying the creators of this app don’t have a right to make money, but they need to do it in a way that doesn’t irritate or annoy the casual users that only look at this app once every few months when they’re on a trip.

Conforming to the arbitrarily enforced guidelines and still fitting an acceptable pic in whatever ratio sized box they use is impossible. Deleted today.

title: Needs customer service. Received double charges for my subscription
review: I’ve been double charged for my scruff account for the last 8 months, I’ve been unable to get help from APPLE or scruff in regards to receiving a refund for the significant amount of money I’ve been charged extra.  I have been a customer for years and feel deceived by these business practices so I’m giving 1 star, hopefully the developers will see this and try to rectify the issue.

title: The new update is s$&@
review: I’ve had scruff for a while and enjoyed seeing the global grid and see who I could talk to outside my local area. Now I have this stupid discover screen that only shows me who has woofed me, who I’ve woofed and who has birthdays this month. I don’t give a crap about any of that. Ruined my whole experience. Bring back the global grid. I can find out that of stuff another way.

The new update also reduced the number of people on the grid by increasing the size of thumbnails. I don’t see an upside to this.  This could drastically reduce my usage of the app, and I was one of the top users two years back.

title: Used to be great in America- but now it’s Instagram
review:
About 10 years ago, this app was really something. 
People actually used the app for dating & meeting up.  
People weren’t trying to become Instagram superstars. 
Now, at least in America, this app has become nothing more than a promotional vehicle for people’s Instagrams/social media, start ups/businesses. The only interesting engagements I get are from people overseas that don’t care about Instagram or this other stupid crap. 
Scruff should not allow people to promote everything under the sun on the profiles. 
The incentive should be to come into this app and date and meet up, not have 5,000 new Instagram followers overnight.

title: Going downhill fast
review:
Don't bother with this app. Every forced "upgrade" leads to fewer free functions and less accurate geopositioning. 
There's plenty of spam advertising though!
Too bad there are so many blank, faceless or fake profiles. 
It was a good idea when it started. Now it's just a revenue stream. The developers got greedy.
And no, I'm not interested in getting into a back-and-forth with the developers who respond to every review. The fact is, the app used to be worthwhile and now it's crap and they're trying to make it look good by appearing to have good customer service. 
If the app was decent they wouldn't have to do all this PR.

title: Scruff isn’t what you think
review:
Scruff was one of the best gay social apps and hookup sites, but they don’t seek to serve that community. They aspire to be something else. 

The latest step?  Banning all profile photos of men in... bathing suits. Boxer shorts. Underwear. Leather jocks. 

You can wear it on Instagram or Folsom Street. Wear it to the beach or poolside. Wear it to one of the parties Scruff ceaselessly promotes. But not on Scruff. 

What are the values they are promoting, exactly?  A culture of shame. We’re all just heteronormative buff guys in sweaters and jeans. Nothing to see here.

Don’t bother. You’ve already got the newly sanitized, anti-male Tumblr and the relatively libertine Instagram.

title: Forced to be beta tester as a subscriber
review:
Absolutely the best way to convince an over priced subscriber to change their minds on subscribing by forcing him to be a beta tester and then telling him there’s no way to turn off that feature. 

Scruff added a new Thirst section where you could add temporary content (still or video), in a TikTok-like fashion, to help users really get themselves out there. 

This new feature cannot be turned off and consumes half of the screen. 

Support told me, in so many words, to bad. For that I won’t renew.

title: It’s a finite clientele
review:
Thought I’d give a new review. Old one is further below. 

Current version works well enough. 
New feature of going straight to chat, I’m not a fan. Would really like to see who sent the message first. Then decide whether to read it. 
I feel this app is missing out on an opportunity, a BFF feature. All this time during the lockdown, people had a difficult time meeting up. It was difficult for making new friends as well. Many felt isolated. How wonderful it would have been to have a social/make new friends section similar to Bumble’s BFF.  That feature for them is all the craze right now. I know I’m enjoying it. 
Anyway my two cents worth. 
Also, how does one become an ambassador? I see this all the time. Not sure what that feature is about. 

……
Even though it’s one of the better apps, it keeps trying to be grindr. Which is a horrible app. The uptake in adds is sad. I get it. You need make money, but it can be done in a less intrusive way. Lose a star The new Beta Bear mode is a why would you want to narrow down your clientele like that. It already mostly swinger bears. Will there be an otter mode, swingers mode, looking for just friends mode etc. and what steep price will you ask for it? It’s the same local people over and over. Yawn. Its also the same people in all the other categories. It’s a finite clientele. I’ve been in this app since it first appeared. And it’s quite pricy. Yikes! Part of me just says ‘why?’. People would actually pay to see the same 100, 200 guys in there feed on a daily basis. Lose a star.

You can navigate to the Settings menu within SCRUFF and select "Contact SCRUFF Support", or submit a ticket to our support team by visiting support.scruff.com. WOOF!', 'modified': '2021-06-23T01:27:02Z'}

title: Poor Customer Support!
review:
First off every time they update the app it becomes less appealing! It is nothing like it use to be and a lot of great features have been taken away. Secondly, if you aren’t in your 20s or have an Adonis body be ready to have your pics scrutinized by their moderators! I submitted a picture that shows barely 2” of underwear fabric just above a mirror frame and it was rejected. When I contested it through there customer support, which is what you’re directed to do if you feel it’s rejected in error, I was dismissed and told never to use support again unless it’s serious. I sent pictures along with my complaint of other approved profiles with guys full body underwear pictures, semi-hard, full outlines and pubic hair showing but of cours about 10 years younger and off the cover of a magazine or clearly packing a monster. I was told to go report them, not the point! I even went as far to reach out to both Eric Silverburg and Johnny Skandros themselves about their customer support and bias handling with their policies, nothing. I’ve never reached out to the CEO and founders of a business and had them act as if they could care less about their paying customers. I’ve been a member since Scruffs infancy and a paying member for most of it. About to lose one more for poor customer service, all for absolutely ridiculous reasons!

***UPDATE***The response to the issue of poor customer support is to contact customer support about customer support. I some how don’t thank Daniel O is going to do anything about his own customer service skills or correct the issue I’ve already contacted him multiple times about. Why should he care to act any different when the CEO and founder seem to not care and this is the kind of response that a bad review gets on the App Store?

***UPDATE 2.0*** Contacted Scruff Support AGAIN because that’s what the Developer said to do, though I’m sure I was probably complaining to Daniel O about Daniel O. My ticket went days being ignored and then was just closed with no response. Can I give negative stars?

title: Latest update is unavailable for older iPhones
review:
Scruff keeps pushing me to update, constantly throwing up ads that force me over to the App Store and even going as far as disabling photo viewing (even though I'm a premium member and therefore paying for the right to view photos). The problem, however, is that Scruff version 6.0 requires you have iOS 11.0 on your phone and that iOS is not available on the iPhone 5 (which I have) or older versions of the iPhone. Therefore, I have to choose between  buying a new phone so I can use all of the premium benefits on Scruff or terminating my premium membership. I'm going to terminate my premium membership. I like Scruff but it's not worth throwing down $600-$900 on a new phone just to keep using it, and if I can't use all of the premium benefits then there is no point in paying for a premium membership.

 I have already contacted support, explained that I kept getting pop up messages demanding I upgrade to Scruff 6.0 and that I couldn't do that because the required iOS is not available for my iPhone. I also mentioned that I could not see any photo galleries. Their only response was "Well you need to update to Scruff 6.0." 

What?!? I just told you I can't update to Scruff 6.0 and your response is to tell me I should update to Scruff 6.0?

This used to be a great app, but this is just messed up. I guess I will terminate my Pro membership and stop using Scruff if this is how it's going to be. I can't afford a new phone right now and I certainly couldn't justify the expense solely to keep using Scruff

title: No integrity
review:
Unfortunately, their new picture decency “policy” makes them very big hypocrites. I was flagged for having a picture in a pair of boxer brief trunks cut mid-thigh length; very model like, classy and hardly distasteful. They sited this as being in violation of their new underwear “policies” but allow plenty of other guys to post speedo and speedo looking underwear pics - far skimpier; and they are not flagged. They are not removed. If Scruff is going to have such a stringent new bikini briefs and speedo policy they need to triple the enforcement of it - why do some guys get to keep pics up in their briefs while removing others? And who decides? Algorithms? Someone at a desk in India? This is a very troublesome new policy. Let’s not even get started on how slow, robotic and disingenuous their Support structure is. 

Then, I replace the photo with a shirtless bathroom mirror selfie. Nothing hanging “out” and nothing creeping - and they again remove it. No specific reason. No notification. They just take my photo off. Again, who decides who’s picture goes and who’s can stay? Even more troublesome is if it’s a human being behind a desk why does he/she keep some user’s pics while others must go. Completely hypocritical with a biased sense of subjectivity. 

If you are a paid Pro member you get treated like this - Support is not in a hurry to get back to me. Nor would I imagine they really would be. All I got was a canned form letter telling me they’re “on it”.  Sure. 

I cancelled my paid  Pro membership subscription and will remove my profile contents shortly. I’m sorry it has to end this way; but if this is how they treat paying, subscribing customers then I want no part. My hard earned dollar will go to Bro or Grindr.

title: Works for me; others, not so sure
review: I updated the minute the new versions became available. The new features were a great improvement in my opinion. As I am already a Pro member, I was not aware of all the restrictions that have been placed on non-paying members. I read through the other reviews and think that something needs to be done, but since it doesn't directly apply to me, I hesitate to get on a soap box. It would just be a shame to make a connection on the app, only to discover that I can't use any of the features I already pay for because the other person doesn't pay. As for the interface, I think it's fine. It's familiar. The only feature I still think needs to be added is an indicator on a member's profile (like coloring the button orange like the unlock icon) showing that you have woofed at a person before. If you decide to woof at then again, it would also be nice if the confirmation dialog could tell you when you last woofed. It is impossible to go through your list if "Woof'd At"s to check this out. Still think this app is moving in the right direction; maybe just needs to work out a few kinks.

title: Upgrade
review:
Scruff seems to just be getting better and better! The new additions are great! "Most woofed in the last hour" a great way to meet good looking guys all over the world. That's just one of the new items added, so many new little short cuts that make this app so much better than any of the competition. The attitude of the guys seem to be getting better and a little more likely to respond than other apps even if not interested. Important to have in a really successful app for it to do its best in getting guys to meet each other. It's not always about a hook up. It can be a conversation that leads to a friendship or something of interest with that person, that then leads you to a hook up or date with someone else you find attractive that only would have happened thru that initial person. Isn't that where the best connections happen, those hard to find guys.
Does everyone have too many friends to meet any others? Having a beer with someone that you wouldn't normally have, will probably make more of a change in your prospective hook ups or dates, then the guys you see all the time. You never know who they know that may be of interest to you and vice versus.
Put yourself out there! It may change your life. It definitely won't hurt it.

title: New v2 is too expensive!
review:
In the new version, you have the option to send regular resolution pics or retina quality resolution pics for 75 "credits" which is .10 cents.  The person sending the pic is charged, and if the person receiving it wants to save the pic to his camera roll, it costs another 75 credits!  Is Scruff turning into another wireless carrier? I'm all for Scruff making $$ for this app, but .20 per picture being paid between sender & receiver? Bandwidth is not that expensive!  You should only charge the person saving the received retina pic, not the person sending it! 

Also why try to play games with credits? Just make it simple to understand... 10 credits for .99 cents... Why try and hide the cost by saying 750 credits for .99 and then charge 75 credits to send a pic?  Also the extra "plus" features for $4.99 & $3.99 are too much.. I would pay a max of $2.50 each for those features.  I'm not paying $8.98 a month AND then also pay .10 to send a retina pic and .10 cents to save a received retina pic.. You will get more subscribers if you dropped each of those to $2.50/mo max, and if you subscribe to both, give maybe enough credits to send & receive 50 pics per month... Otherwise, I'm not paying for any of the extra features.

title: Good app but WAY overpriced (not really free)
review: The older version of scruff was pretty good and much better than other apps such as Grindr. This latest version has some needed improvements made but apparently the people at Scruff got inflated egos and WAY WAY WAY overpriced the added features that you can purchase on monthly subscription basis that make the app usable. For example if you want to see more than a few handful of subscribers pay $3.99. If you want to see a history of your conversation with someone more than the last few texts to him, pay for an additional $3.99 - really?  Two separate subscription fees - Nearly $10 per month when said and done just to make the app usable?  One flat $3.99 fee is steep but doable for most. Two subscription fees is just ridiculous!  Then on top of the fees you have to put up with advertisements - come on guys stop the money grab. Johnny Scruff's original statement about why he created the app for simply wanting connect like-minded guys has been brushed aside for corporate greed. $$$

title: Who cares
review: If you need laid bad enough you'll get it with this app. The same lame losers cruise this app amongst others looking for a glimmer of a chance of getting lucky. Maybe some fat college kid will go down on you but if your looking for love move on. Your chances of finding a match here is unlikely, while some of you may jerk off to the pretty pictures you realize those guys are too far away. The site needs work and a way to let users know they will bang anything that moves. If your looking for a quickie you can probably get that at your local adult bookstore. Hell it might be easier. I say save the time and put an ad on Craigslist for all the trolls to see. The truth is that your hand may not be sore tonight but the guy bring home with leave something behind and I am not talking about his underwear. You could only dream about taking him home to mommy... Oh mom I meant him on scruff... Oh what is Scruff? Mommy it a site for hook ups.... Please if you take this seriously then you need to go somewhere else like a public bathroom

title: Way better than Grindr
review: This app is more reliable, uses less battery, has a better profile format and actually informs you when you've received a message without requiring you to go pro. Grindr has very minimal  space in their profiles and only tells you when you've got a message if you have the app open, even then it only does that maybe 75% of the time. End result, with Scruff you get to socialize more and check you phone less. Grindr seems to be more popular because it came first and it gives the illusion of having more users on the screen. If you have nothing better to do than constantly check and refresh some app for slow paced chatting/trying to meet some dude who's phone might die any minute or enjoy looking flakey and rude because you've got better things to do with your time and battery life, choose Grindr. Otherwise, choose Scruff and socialize reliably without sacrificing time and battery life and maybe meet some dandy men.

title: The Little Gay Web App that 'Woofed'
review:
Scruff is hands down one of the best social networking architectures out there supporting a niche community.  This category is full of wannabes and Scruff isn't the first of its kind to be sure.  It is quite simply the best app all-around for its membership. The service is a bit pricey, I think at almost $20/month.  (I mean does that include a gym membership or what, right?  Ah, nope.) But believe it or not, that's a competitive price.  

Interestingly, I feel this category of social networking experiences may be the vanguard for how social networks evolve for the Internet as a whole.  It's worth paying attention to these niche communities and how brands like Scruff play to essentially tribal affiliations to produce both ad-sales revenue, and evergreen membership fees, that are to a great extent inoculated against encroachment by Facebook.  In the Internet echo system , this service has found a niche that may have it competing against (or being eaten up by) some much bigger players.

title: History Lesson
review: I just downloaded the latest update for Scruff. Overall I'm a fan of this app, and the new "Grids" feature is a nice improvement. But I wonder if anyone on the programming or management staff remembers that "GRID" was one of the names initially given to the disease that would eventually be known as AIDS.  It was called Gay Related Immune Deficiency, and that name reflected, in part, the ugly stigma that is still attached to that terrible plague: that gay people were somehow to blame or deserving of the suffering caused by AIDS/HIV. Now I'm not saying they should change the app or this feature, but in future upgrades and features the staff may want to consider their audience. There are, no doubt, some of our more mature scruffy brothers on the sight who lost friends to AIDS.  I know our community tends to focus on fashion in the here-and-now, but I think we could afford to reflect on our history more often, lest we forget and end up back where we were when GRID was just appearing.

title: The best app to find get men worldwide.
review:
I've been using scruff about 4 years now, and it's hands down the best app to find other guys. It's got fantastic features and really good add value for pro members, the app is always reliable and there are never bots. Once you use Scruff it seems amazing Grindr has an user base at all. In addition to great features and reliability, the app tends to attract articulate, educated men which is another way it trumps the competition. I suppose it's a self fulfilling prophecy --scruff never limits your to 140 characters and because of that you get it all from hookups to dates. Big fan!

The new app update took some getting used to and there are some features that are now buried or hard to find at all. But they've already released an update with marked improvements and it seems like they are taking user feedback into account. Worth taking the free account for a spin and staying around for the pro features.

title: Love Scruff
review:
The support U receive matters! Here in my culture we rely on our chakras to tell us honestly what people think and feel and say of us to our face and behind and i know cuz Celt/Native 1690 Salem Old soul here~~~ SCRUFF well they have my back, this I know This Old Native American Great found me made me a Shaman 
Scruff seems to know that Her pie ( Check giant rolling pin (( Tori Amos my fairie god mother )) ) well at recent past i might have helped bake ( in a dream ) that pie or cookie which wills out the truth with love ~~~ That pie or cookie my grandmothers ensured From above that Mary would shine through me That JC said " gay is not a sin " BC i been to heaven and back again and he just loves us if and when we are our best selves ( Us gays ) i dont believe in a disorder some say i have i believe in High Magick I work it and bc i know the true from the false this app this app is true (( if this is lengthy its cuz i liked that when i showed interest in myself scruff wanted to meet me ☺️😋😏)

title: Perfect Update! Most Advanced Gay App
review:
Scruff 5, IMO, is the best of the gay apps. They went from a really outdated version 4 (which didn't support iPhone 6 for over a year, but yet they had Apple Watch support?) to this amazing refresh which has way more functionality. Most impressive is the ability to use the app in landscape mode. The new views (who's online, most woof'd) look great. Tap and hold to instantly start a chat, ingenious!! Let's compare:

Grindr: requires a premium subscription to get basic features such as notifications, loaded with spam users, the app crashes constantly. 

Growlr: when it first arrived it was simple and fast, and at one time I was a Pro user. Now it's plagued by obtrusive ads/videos and the developers have done little to make it better. The more you use it, the more the creators are making money off you from the ads, and it's obvious. Worse, the quality of picture uploads is poor, making your first impression lacking.

Hornet: Ad placement is poor making your experience less enjoyable. You'll receive lots of annoying messages from the 'support team'. The app itself is clunky in some areas, and photo resolution changes after viewing others in the same profile.

Jack'd: Way too many complaints from users, not worth your time.

In short, Scruff has a great app and works flawlessly. I highly recommend it!

title: Best gay app, update has problems
review: I've always thought Scruff was the best gay social networking app on the market, and I've tried them all. The interface, profile options, and easy communication have always been the best of any app out there. Most recent update is ok -- the new interface is more cluttered than I would like, it's less seamless to navigate between albums and profiles, and a lot of features were changed that didn't need changing, like the use of icons instead of words for some buttons. I'm disappointed with the new censorship of profiles: my profile was flagged for inappropriate context because is said NO PNP (flagged the word "PNP"). The censorship script should be more intelligent than that. And the profile text is scrunched too narrowly -- an otherwise short profile now requires lots of scrolling, and those with lots of descriptive text now have to severely cut down if anyone is going to read what they have to say. Overall still the best gay app, but not sure this update was thought out enough.

title: I actually love this one the most
review: I don't understand how everyone else has a super negative thing to say about Scruff?? Of all the gay apps I've tried (& I've tried quite a few), this one always seems to come thru as the best working one out there. Super easy interface & very user-friendly. Loads of hot men on here & internationally (the Venture feature is such a wonderful idea). I've met some really awesome dudes on here, a few of which I've become really good friends with! I should mention that I am a PRO user & this is the only gay app I'd ever consider paying for because it's so worth it. I'll admit, the free version can be annoying AF with the whole not being able to see all photos in an album or not being able to scroll up the message history, etc. (Took off a star for that) But @ least these guys don't play you for your money like most other popular gay apps out there do...they know very well who they are (Grindr/Jack'd/VGL/etc.)

title: Poorly conceived
review:
I am a professional iOS developer. This update is like a parody of what I do: rather than reading and absorbing the Human Interface Guidelines, the app authors seem to have taken the stance that an app has the look and feel of the OS simply because it uses vibrancy effects and custom view controller transitions. Most of which are poorly executed with jerky frame updates in the completion block. The navigation structure is senseless; instead of proper stacking of view controllers, there are unnecessary modals with Done buttons. These are the least of its sins: the main screens for browsing have simply gone haywire with clutter and irrelevance. Icons have replaced text for no good reason in many places. The only real improvement I see is more seamless pagination.

Sadly, I suspect the following: most likely, the owner was led to believe his app required a top-down makeover and rewrite. This exercise was likely very expensive. Most of the old UI tropes could have been elegantly updated and modernized for the new OS features without so much rework. And the users (myself included) would be much happier for it.

title: Fun app, easy to use
review:
The interface is easy to use, and the free version offers a wide variety of options. It doesn't seem to have the issues Grindr has (delayed message notifications, etc), and unlike some apps it gives an option to interact with guys workd-wide, not just ones within a few miles of you.

 Although it's aimed at a more muscle-bear/meat and potatoes kind of guy, it doesn't come across as "exclusive". I like the option to "woof" at guys; it's a nice way to compliment a guy without being pushy or having to have a conversation. Another nice feature is the "would you meet" button. If both of you choose "maybe" or "yes", it suggests that you both initiate a conversation. It doesn't alert them if you choose "no", so both parties are spared negative perceptions.

All around, it's a great app to interact with guys who share similar interests, and potentially meet a playmate or partner.

title: Good app, overpriced
review:
Scruff is definitely my favorite of the various gay "dating" apps, based both on the types of guys that use it (the name is appropriate) and the functionality of the app itself.  That said, the monthly $9 "subscription" is highway robbery for unlocking features that are, by and large, standard functionalities in Scruff's competitors.  I mean, having to pay to block more than 80 profiles? Or being able to see your full message history with another user?  If you're going to charge a whopping $100+ per year for a subscription, the extras you get for it oughta be AMAZING.  Conversely, if I'm paying a monthly charge for enabling a feature set that brings Scruff up to (and perhaps even a bit above) the functionality level of its competition, then the charge ought to be on par with that of the competition.

Bottom line: great app, great guys, cruddy pricing.

title: Does what it says.
review:
Tried most of the others, Scruff is the only one I ever bought up on. Def like all the options that brings you, filters n such.  
Also like to kind of men that navigate to the scruff way of thinking, my opinion, but I find them more masculine, mature, furry, easy on the eyes.
I've not met the man yet, but have met and chatted with some really nice men, and had some fun along the way.  Yeh, there've been some douche bags too, but I address them in my profile and can easily weed them out.  
I keep the 'G' as back up, but its more hassle, less intuitive, players, youngins and even minors.  But the 'G' seems to be the 1st app everyone gets.  I gotta cabin upstate, seems there are more men up there using the 'G', but thats fine with me.  
These apps are in business to up sale you, I'd def recommend upgrading to the Scruff Pro if your gonna upgrade at all.  Have fun, be safe....peace

title: Request for Review I Couldn't Refuse
review: I used to love this app.  Now I tolerate it.  It's dated, has ridiculously overpriced "premium" features, just took away the global "likes you" setting for a tinder ripoff that is close to useless and completely inefficient.  You are continuously hounded about pro version even if you have a year long subscription.   Once, I fat fingered the dismiss menu and the app recorded two accept clicks and I now had concurrently running overpriced memberships- $160 total signed up for in three days.  Scruff was rude or nonresponsive even though I have had a pro membership since the time when they had a write and a look pro memberships... Eventually Apple sorted it out.  Meanwhile, scruff still kept hawking the pro version and displaying other ads in my "ad free" pro version.   The latest, today, is I was in a "rate this app screen" and the only button that worked was "rate us 5 stars". The cool guys gets you two, though deserve 6.  Scruff on the other hand deserves a negative digit.

title: Nice app
review:
Is a pretty decent app.  One of the better ones out of all the others like it.  I do miss the feature where you were able to save the picture to either your private album or your phone/device.  The new version removed that ability.  I can understand the need for it as these are individuals pictures.  Still.  
What really sets Scruff aside from the other apps (like A4A and Grindr) is that Scruff has incorporated the 'would you be interested in meeting this person' and the extension of 'the Stack' where Scruff randomly selects profiles from the thousands around the world and you say if you would be interested or not.  If there's an indicated interest from both parties, you are alerted and it's then up to you to make contact.  

The other new features for this version of the Scruff app is the 'who's online, New Members, Who got Woofed the Most; Most Woofed New Member and Who's Online Now Globally/Locally.  Previously it was just who was online now gloves and local.  These new sections allows you to see more guys' profile than before. 

I'm still disappointed on what they're asking for the subscription amount and the limits given to those who don't subscribe.  But I'm not running the app so it's not up to me.

title: This is an Okay App
review:
I reviewed this app yesterday as a 1 star app. Today I learned that Scruff had server issues the bulk of yesterday... So I am upping my review to 3 stars. 

This app can be fun and yes filled with lots of eye-candy but I feel that there are still way to many issues with it. 

The connectivity issues do seem to be a bit to constant for my taste. 

There also seems to be way to many steps to have to go through to see: images, messages, woofs, viewers....

This is a mobile app so I would think the idea of getting to what you needed would be a little more streamlined.

I haven't upgraded to any of the extra features and have been happy I haven't due to yesterday's outage and the constant connectivity issues. From the other reviews I am also getting the idea that they charge a bit more then any other gay social apps, how does that bode for competition? I don't understand why they are charging a fee to see your back log of chats, so maybe the other negative reviewers are correct in saying someone got greedy... Maybe they are just trying to cover their costs or maybe it's all about the Benjamins.. 

I will continue to use the free elements of this app and wait to see if the app improves or continues it's slippery slope.

If you are looking to meet, friend or whatever some men via your device this one can be fun, just don't rely on this everyday...

title: Annoying App
review:
This app appears to offer so much but its more trouble than its worth. Searches for the same area will give results varying from 1 person to100s of guys immediately after. When filling out settings you never know if the response should be what you are or what you are looking for. User profile does not keep even though you filled out all questions, icked save and received a message that the profile was uoloaded and saved. The next time you go on the app may remember your settings or it may not. It cant even seem to remember your user nsme correctly. 
The worst part of the app is the size of the individual thumbnails. They are so tiny that even with 20/20 vision cannot see them. You have to open the entire profile to see any pics. 
The user interface on grindr is so much easier to use and is much more sophisticated than this one. 
In addition the gugs who use scruff are just that-scruffy and in some cases dirty looking. If you like guys whose faces are a tossup between dirty and forgot to shave, you'll love this one.

title: Works great for me!
review: I've enjoyed using Scruff. Guys here seem to be a little more interested in getting to know someone rather than just a quick hookup. The profile and other options such as a private album allow for a better personal description and more visuals which makes the process much easier. I prefer the paid version for sure. It's a little pricey, but overall it is much better than the free one. My only complaint would be that they have categorize that you can choose of "types" and I don't seem to fit any of them. And there isn't even an option for "other" or a unique type that you can personalize.  Overall I find it effective, and I've met many great people through Scruff. Some have become friends, some relationships, some flings.

title: SCRUFF
review: What would truly make this app better is a way to scale the font in the chat screen, for me the current font iOS Too small .  I have to cut and paste my incoming messages in an app that allows me to scale the font iOS zoom feature is clunky and too difficult to use they need to remember that there are gay guys with visual impairments,  and we do socialize and use pick up apps like this sand we even get hookups.   The. Have no area for feedback on their website or on the app.  That is a bad thing it tells me that they have no interest in what their customers have to say. I hope that is not the case and hopefully just an oversight.  Please make your app easier for those who have visual impairments font size scalability and ability to change the contrast colors very bad too especially if someone is color blind. If you are going to make an app for a community make sure it accommodates all in the community.

title: Simply the best of the gay social apps
review: GREAT JOB SCRUFF!  I like the update. I haven't found a gay chat/hook up app yet,that has everything,but Scruff comes the closest to it. Most important, it's seams like all the profiles are real,unlike that  other popular app, that grinds your patience to the limit because it has more fake(bot)profiles than real ones.  It's easy to navigate, and you can check out profiles of nearby guys as well as guys from around the globe. Also,you can view unlimited profiles, send woofs(hellos),upload your private photo albums, tag your friends, have instant chat, and upload any photo you want instantly and privately message it to anyone. It's great. It many more features than I'm stating,and is actually fun to use. This is the must have app. It puts all the others to shame.

title: A Little Disappointed.
review:
I have to agree with alot of the reviews on here of late. When I first get Scruff, I was impressed with it, and went ahead for the option of "Going Pro" and bought a subscription.  Everything was fine, until, some extra financial difficulties forced me to relinquish my "Pro" status and stop automatic withdrawals from my bank acct. I was never contacted and asked for a reason for my status change, and suddenly, I am reduced to only seeing 2 pictures, no matter how many a person has, I can't open my private pics anymore, and there are many other cants that make this site now NOT one of my favorites. Growr is infinitely better. I will probably cancel Scruff soon. It's become obvious to me that they are much more concerned with making a buck, than being good to the guys that are still loyal. There are way too many other options now. I hope they will read this, but, I'm probably just spitting in the wind.
A Once Loyal Scruff User.

title: Secretary, event coordinator protect and defend
review: Dear scruff, you app is my favorite app, and I appreciate all what you do for the lgbt community. My issue of disappointment is similair to other apps, is the circuit party scene and pride scene is more important than the community partnership. I have tried for the last year now to contact anyone from scruff and there is no possible friendly way to do so.  Our group which represents police fire and military members all over the globe and we wanted to form a partnership. There's a push and communication with other apps, and that wasnt what I had wanted. I am glad you promote and value community outreach, it would be nice for groups like ours to at least meet and see how we can work together since we do have scruff users and we are going towards the same goal. Thanks

title: No Longer Best in Show
review:
All of my previous reviews championed Scruff as an all around superior app, I wish that didn't need to change. 

I've been a paid member for going on two years now. I pay because it makes it easier to communicate with non-pro members as well as pro members. When a social app like this begins to segregate the paid members it devalues the paid feature set. Increasing the difficultly for any member to interact with a non paid member is a tactic for increasing sales that alludes to a lack of new ideas on the developers end. Paying for scruff allows me to have larger private albums -- I am not interested in this feature if not everyone can view the albums I create. 

Hopefully the folks at Scruff value user retention enough to focus and act on the current set of deplorable reviews.  I will be actively looking for alternatives. Should Scruff fail to acknowledge these issues relatively soon, they will likely lose my business going forward.

title: Works, but developers are greedy.
review:
Pros: Much more stable than grindr (which doesn't even work on the most basic level nowadays)

Cons: an absolutely ludicrous amount of basic features are locked behind "Scruff Pro", most of which are available on grindr at no extra cost. Examples: You can't see entire photo albums people share, you can't filter by age, you're only limited to seeing the last 10-15 messages or so of each thread... the list goes on.

I understand the need for incentive to get the premium subscription but these developers need to get real - the subscription is way too expensive, they're probably making PLENTY off advertising revenue from the free users, and so many features are locked behind the pay wall that many users (myself included) are just gonna flat-out stop using the app if this isn't fixed. I wanna like the app, but seriously, stop being cheapskates and give some basic features back.

title: Love scruff
review:
Scruff is way better than Grindr or Growlr. The layout makes it really easy to nab agate between profiles, nearby, woofs, etc.

The guys on there are also just generally the right combination between nice, interesting, hot, and sleezy, and I'm much more likely to be actual friends with someone from there.

Profiles have a bit more space and direction to talk about both dating/hookup interests and less sleezy stuff, and are easier to narrow down than the other gay apps.

A few things that big me though:
You can't scroll back in message histories. I get that you can pay money for that, but as someone who is young/conventionally hot enough not to need to pay for hookup apps, it puts me in situations where I forget a guy's name because I can't scroll back. I get that saving a backlog of pics maybe is too expensive, but saving the text part would be nice.

I also wish they sent push notifications for woofs, not just messages, because I often miss woofs guys send me for several days. The push notifications have been messed up lately anyway, they will not show a banner saying I have messages so I won't check and then will find I missed someone hot who wanted to hook

title: Awesome but w/ huge caveat
review: This is actually (kinda) the best among all the gay men's dating/hook-up sites but it comes with one major fault: you can only display one pic publicly at a time. That's mindless because someone might see a guy they're somewhat interested in but they only have one pic to decide to pursue it further or not. Jack'd let's one put up 3 pics PLUS the option of 2 private pics if one chooses to. I would give that one 4 stars if it weren't for the fact that so few men join it and it feels like Groundhog Day every time you look at the selections. Can't understand why more men wouldn't be flocking to Jack'd. But, Scruff has much going for it except that big Achile's heel. Maybe some out there is actually paying attention and will implement the simple feature of letting the guys know the full portrait of their prospective date. Sorta makes sense, huh?

title: Love the new features
review:
Very pleased with the rate of improvements to this app. It's currently the only one of its kind I use (ditched Grindr).
