I love filtering on community (though too many people are delusional about which communities they actually belong in--filter on "Muscle" and see what I mean), I love being able to organize albums and favorites better than before. I love the way it notifies you of new woofs and album unlockings.

I've met a lot of people in the real world by meeting first online, and how do you put a price on friendships? Yes, I will keep in touch with many of them for a long time to come. So this app has paid for itself repeatedly.

Update: the program has, after recent updates, been positively harassing me to rate it, and pestering me with notifications. I lowered my rating. Happy now, jerks?

title: Alright and slipping...
review:
The app is continually freezing on my 6+, and taking inordinate amounts of time to load.  My WiFi signal is great, and my 5S has had little difficulty loading SCRUFF and images; much faster than my 6+.  Perhaps an update?!  

SCRUFF is pricy, and for the quality of guys who are generally found, I have remained a basic user because the app has not demonstrated the worth of purchasing.  Also, I have noticed that more and more basic features are being taken away (over the last year or so) so that users, who want those very features to remain, will have to succumb to a forced purchase.

Chiseled bodies (there's only so many 'good body genes' out there, and they're not the majority), "top", "bottom", "hung" and "cross fit" (or "xxfit") have been well demonstrated to perpetuate the divisiveness of the homo subculture through SCRUFF.  Realizing that we all have preferences, but we're also in the same canoe with paddles, and if we're not paddling in unison, we're not going to get far.

title: When good apps go bad...
review:
Scruff was a phenomenal app when it was first released. Good support of the community and a decent, if not great, interface.  Over time the interface improved, more guys started using the app, and Scruff started sponsoring community events. Things looked promising for the future.

Somewhere, though, the developers made some bad decisions. Deciding to charge out-of-touch high prices for piecemeal functionality is one such decision. Attempting to force such changes on the user base is another. Refusing to acknowledge just how disappointed that user base has become is yet another bad decision. 

Scruff has an opportunity to change course, but it will take some re-evaluation on their part. If they really want to support and embrace the communities the app was made popular by, Scruff needs to prove it. Otherwise, the developers simply come across as more concerned with milking money from their user base than actually improving their app's functionality and appeal.

title: Used to be just ok...
review:
You know that nearby mall that at one point was pretty cool, but now it's 75% vacant and the only patrons are scary people, and a few normal ones that wandered in accidentally because they thought it would be much better?  Scruff is like that mall. 

The interface is awful... Clunky, claustrophobic, ugly, hard to figure out. 
The majority of the guys on there seem just as bad. If you want to get bombarded with lame, one-word openers ("hey", "grr", "stud", "sup?") by guys who aren't smart enough or don't care enough to scroll down & read a few lines of text in a profile (and of course have either no profile pic, or a shot of their nipple, eye, or other random body part), then this is the app for you!
Oh, and to fully appreciate the true magic of the experience, be sure to pay by the month for it, so you can feel extra duped for wasting your time downloading the app and trying to figure out basic functions within the plethora of icons & buttons everywhere on the screen. 

Oh, and if you DO pay, please notice that the subscription renews automatically. It does notify you of that with one of the MANY pop-up windows that randomly appear, but the method of unsubscribing isn't in the settings menu as the window says (it's not a button you turn on/off)... It's a link to the iTunes Store that's buried in the terms of service that you have to hunt for.

title: Dominated by partnered guys
review: This is a great app but I've noticed that many of the guys list their status as partnered, in a relationship, married, etc. No judgment but it's a bit frustrating if you're a single guy and you're trying to meet other single guys. I feel like I'm at a couples retreat or something.  It would be nice if the app allowed you to only see or be seen by single people. Half of the messages I receive are from guys in relationships. My profile says I'm not into partnered guys but I guess they don't bother to read the text. Other than all that, this app has the best design and best features of any gay dating app I've used. It handily beats Grindr, Growlr, Hornet, and Mr X; those apps all pale in comparison to Scruff when it comes to features, reliability, visual design, etc.

title: For mature audiences only
review: There are several things about Scruff that I like. To begin with I'll state that I was using Grindr before and I had just about lost faith in gay people over it. Then I discovered Scruff and I have restored hope. For whatever reason, this app draws in more mature men (not just in age, but mentality). On top of this huge upgrade from Grindr, it has great features: woofs let guys know you think they're hot and helps ease into conversation rather than sending that arbitrary "hey." The "I'm interested" feature is great for deciding whether you should pursue further relations with someone or if you're howling at the wind. And notifications are great so you don't leave potential prospects hanging for days only to find they've moved on. Love it.

title: Best functionality...
review: I love that my profile is synced automatically among all devices. Also, being able to see viewers and share albums without paying extra is very nice. Overall, scruff has the best coverage and usage across north america by a kinder class of users, and ease of functionality among all the gay social-networking apps, from my experience. Friendlier group of users, especially compared to Grindr(all attitude) and manhunt(judge not lest ye be judged...). Growlr still has the most respectful and friendly cross-section of men, but not as wide a selection, and doesn't sync well between devices. My biggest wish is that Scruff would have a website that non-app users could use and participate in the fun, like Adam4Adam.

title: Dropping the ball
review: This app was a Godsend when I first downloaded it. I was over the Grindr gays and wanted some real guys to talk to. Flirt with. What have you. But every update seems to not only increase the price for a membership, but decrease the accessibility and features of the app itself. It's getting way too complicated. There are so many gratuitous features, and you now have to pay to use the basic features that made this app so great in the first place (private albums without restrictions, more profile loads, etc.). This app really helped me find great guys to talk to and it had a great sense of community. And instead of continuing to stand apart, Scruff has chosen to conform to the norm and care more about making money than providing a service to gay men. Based on the Facebook page, it seems the money from this app is only going toward funding the party lifestyle of the app creators. It's sad.

title: Better than most gay apps
review: I like the many different features of this app, mainly the amount of space per profile. With others like Grindr & etc, you only have a limited amount of space to write what defines yourself and what you're looking for. I also like the insights into their profiles; how frequent guys are to responding, what their sexual safety preferences are and what kind of men they go after, as well as the locations searches and pretty much most of the app. The only reason I'm not giving it 5 stars is because to access the entire app, it's pretty expensive per month, which I get that's how they make money but overall that doesn't deter me from giving them a low score, so yes 4 stars is pretty great for an app like this!

title: Very very slow with tons bugs so far!
review: The 3 stars is because I love all the cool guys on here. It's a million times better than the guys on Grindr but the program has so many bugs and is so slow! The keyboard is so slow I spend half my time fixing typing errors because half the letters don't show up and you have to type SO SLOW! I wish there were sounds when you receive a message instead of just a silent notification. I find myself hitting refresh on the message screen so much because it loads so slow, doesn't always save guys in favorites and sometimes says guys who live in my neighborhood are 5k miles away. Le sigh. Worth the price tag tho. Who can really complain when it's free but I'd pay a small amount for all these things to be fixed permanently.

title: Horrible Decision!
review: What was once a great service, has now become a huge rip-off! While I understand the need to charge, I don't agree with the ridiculous $8.98 per month fee, to use features that cost far less on other apps. This boils down to greed! I subscribed for one month to try it out, and it already has glitches. As for their claim that "Everything that was free before is still free" claim, I call bull. I could block people for free before, and now you have to pay to do so. Even then, the block feature doesn't work!! Rather than paying $5 for this, $4 for that & "credits", they should have ONE fee for everything and not exceed $5!!!   Back to Jack'd & Grindr for me.

title: Works great but I think pro is too expensive
review: I like the larger size grids with the latest release. I think that's the only thing I really do like about the newest version. I preferred the more specific indication of how long ago a user viewed your profile rather than a range like less the 2 hours, past day, past two days, etc.  And why are you gouging the gay community so much for the pro version?  I've been paying for it for some time it's twice as much as growlers pro version and I am considering downgrading. The additional features do not justify the additional cost in y opinion. People like to feel like they're getting their money's worth and I'm not really sure that I am with the pro version.

title: pretty good
review:
I'd like to see a pay-subscription that's ad free. I'd also like to see the nav buttons easier to hit, and locked in a frame at the top instead of floating/scrolling. it'd be nice to have the refresh button at the top. also, a full photo gallery would be a nice addition for the paid subscription members. the chat input is clunky and slow, and often words become misspelled. it's difficult to double-tap into the chat screen. also there's no quick way to get right to the pic. that's what I want to see. 

outside of that, this app runs pretty well. I find a lot of the chats get lost, and your session expires after an hour. and the profile views expire after a day. if you don't fav people, you're liable to lose contact with them permanently.

title: decent, could use a few improvements
review: better than grindr, that's for sure (especially in the battery drain department).  getting to messages is a bit of a messy 3 step process.  no real notification system if guys mutually are interested or if you get 'woofed' at.  you've got to somehow figure that out for yourself, I guess.  somewhat slow to refresh at times.  and the in app keyboard is slow and doesn't seem to auto correct properly.  DESPITE all this, it's a great app and I like it more than the more fleshed out grindr.  this app isn't a battery sucker and seems to just close when you exit.  GREAT!  i'd like to see a few improvements.  but it's pretty decent as is.

title: Features galore but freemium just-the-tip
review: No other dating app that's worth your while has as many features — global top/new members, global search options with filters, Nearby/online view (think Grindr), detailed profile info options, public & private photo/video albums, Match feature (think Tinder), etc etc etc. Although the casual user may rarely notice this, some features or components of features require a monthly subscription. The, say, weekly BUY SCRUFF PRO pop up is largely nothing more than a minor nuisance. But I strongly suggest that you buy it because I don't want to but I still want the app to be great and their coders need to eat and stuff.

title: AT LAST
review: This version is the best so far. Previous versions have been frustrating with lost favorites and messages freezing. Seems to be better so far. Love the new interface. Nice to be able to tell if a guy is online. I hope they come up with a pay version with more filters such as age, location, friend, hook-up, and LTR. It would be nice if they had a "cut or uncut" option. Everyone says this Is a hook-up app but I think it's for whatever you want it to be. So many guys get angry about what this app is for. It is the best app and man tool available. Thanks guys for making such an amazing app possible for all of us to enjoy. I'm truly grateful!!!

title: Love this app!! Best app out there for men!
review:
Only two things I wish they would add..  Would really like to be able to add a note to the profiles of guys I chat with so that I can remember their names since so many guys only put a single letter as their name or use some really off the wall profile name. 
Also would be great if I could rate the guys I chat with..  Maybe a five star system or something like that. 
Other than that I have absolutely no complaints. They are constantly providing updates for speed and stability!  The Scuff team is awesome and are very active in the community as well. Love me some Johnny Scruff!!

title: New version to reset bad reviews
review: I used to like Scruff. But it seems as if they are issuing ‘bug fixes’ to push a new version into the store and to get rid of bad reviews. What has really gotten me is somehow they’ve gotten the app through the App Developer rules with making the ability to use TouchID to unlock the app a paid, in-app purchase. How can a developer make money off a hardware feature they had no input into creating. I’ve lodged a complaint with Apple. Developers should not be allowed to make money off hardware. They are free to restrict their own content to in-app purchases. If you allow Scruff and others to start making money off Apple’s hardware features then where does it stop? Maybe a streaming music app will start charging more money to allow you to control the volume button on your device. This is the road Scruff is going down.

title: Has always worked well for me
review: Not sure what all the recent complaints are about. I've had the app since shortly after it updated to v5. Has always worked great. Nice interface. Easy to use and read. I've never had issues with crashes. Notifications for chatting and other things are included in the free version, which is a big deal. It beats Grindr in every way, except there aren't quite as many guys on it. Probably because it's a little more "upscale" in its quality and seems more geared toward guys that want to actually get to know each other, with more extensive profiles, pics, and chatting.

title: Good App
review: I use the Scruff Pro version and have found that I like it much more than Grindr, especially when talking with people locally. Overall, the app design is better and more responsive, which is why I don't mind paying for it. It has its quirks, but what software doesn't? Interestingly, I have found members of Scruff to be more responsive than on Grindr and I have spoken with people both near and far (something Grindr was not designed to do, so comparing the two in some sense is not apples to apples). Overall, it's a good app, and though a little pricey, it's worth paying a monthly fee to get the features found in the Pro version.

title: Best Designed of This Type of App
review:
As a former software products manager, I know what goes into the design, implementation, and support of a world-wide, heavily-used application. 
Scruff has a simple, well-designed user interface; for the most common use, scanning of profiles and communicating quickly, (the "Woof"), it rates an A. But behind this simple task, there are many segments with usage stats for the members, again straight-forward, easy-to-use. 
Another sign of solid design and fully-staffed support; Scruff rarely crashes and is one of the most reliable apps I have used. 
This 'picky' user gives Scruff, its developers and support staff Five Stars. 
Great men, too! <g>.

title: Not a bad design
review:
I have to admit I don't pay for the app, and hearing how expensive it is I'm not sure i ever will! However, from a design perspective I have to applaud scruff for making some changes. The simple color change when activity happens (whether you've been viewed, woof'd, etc) is great user experience. The set up of the app itself is pretty intuitive. HOWEVER, I am confused by the little side bar that opens to the left of the app when you launch it, then I can't seem to access it again? What's the point? 
I've got to give props where they're due though, and scruff does seem to care about their users.

title: By far the best social gay app!
review: This app is much better than any other ones like grindr or boy ahoy. It blows them out of the water. Johnny is a great guy, he actually has conversation with those who follow the people who use scruff and are able to enjoy scruff brings to the table. I've met more genuine people on here from not just the city I live but all around the world than I have in person and I'm a pretty outgoing guy who can break the ice. Scruff attracts great guys who know who they are and what they want, thus making scruff a great place to make friends, go on dates, and even find a relationship!! Thanks Johnny!!

title: Excellent app!
review: This application is a fantastic way to meet guys whether local or when you're traveling.  The profile section allows you to put a significant amount of content which helps a conversation get started. The "would you meet feature " is great. An application like this could never replace interpersonal communication but it's a great way to meet guys initially and then meet them out on the town.  From a software development standpoint, the application works flawlessly which gives it a technical edge over similar social applications.  I've also met Johnny Scruff and think he's awesomely hot so that kinda helps.

title: Delicious app. 🌈😎😍
review: I've always managed to keep this app around because I find more men around my personal preference whom are bearded, more fit, tattooed and more of a masculinized type crowd where I know I'll meet some sexy men and I have. The only problem I have with this app is that I would like to delete all of my messages by using a multiple delete option or a "fresh start" button where I ca either start all over again and/ or keep the messages I want around just so I don't have 99+ messages hanging around that I will probably never further engage in conversations with. I just need a fresh start again and there's no way to do that.

title: MAJOR PHONE CRASH!!!
review:
I downloaded it while laying in bed this morning and was only on it for about 20min!...  The app kept asking me to confirm my "Location" and it also asked to send me "Push Notifications" and I said yes to all of those!...  

I then got bored with the App and went to go and delete it!... While deleting it, the Scruf app was busy attaching itself to other areas of my phone, without my permission.   When I finally got the app deleted, it took all that information with it!...  Causing me to lose a huge amount of data and contact info from my iPhone 4S!...

I've now spent half the day fixing the damage that was done and also working closely with my cell phone provider to reset my service and recover lost data, because I couldn't even do a hard reset or turn my iPhone off!...  I DO NOT RECOMMEND THIS APP TO ANYONE!...  Download it at your OWN RISK!....

title: Scruff Searches
review:
Love this app.  I wish your favorites and message list were not limited.  It would REALLY be nice if you could do a search by logon name, not just city.

The one thing that is a problem is that you are stuck with the same group of guys on your near list.  You don't get a complete list for your area.  You do a search for a particular city, you only get some of the guys not all of them.  I am trying to find someone in my city that I know for sure is on Scruff but I can never see him???  What is up with that???  Please work on the searches

Thanks for this site

title: Good stuff
review: Scruff is a good app. I like the global feature but it is also a drawback because I rarely meet guys in the global part that are okay with just chatting with someone thousands of miles away. However it is great to see the hot guys from all over the world. It does eat my battery really quick too. I like that profile pics don't take forever to be approved. Not sure I like having to go online to read messages or do anything with my profile. Just seems like an extra unnecessary step every time. It's free and a way to meet guys and see whos out there. The quality of guys on this site is higher than that which you are most likely to find on Grindr. So I do really like this app but there are some minor setbacks.

title: A Woof for Scruff
review: I give the latest version of the Scruff chat and dating app a woof and a thumbs up! I've liked previous versions also, but this version has the best features and is really easy to use. I pay for Pro, so I don't have to endure ads and I get all the features the app has to offer. When compared to other gay dating apps, Scruff has the best features: the ability to woof, private albums, match, upcoming events, venture, and more. All of these things put the Scruff app far ahead of the others. The free version is okay, but Pro is the way to go. Get the app and starting woofing today.

title: Crash/Freeze
review:
The app was simpler and more reliable in earlier versions. The two latest updates are unstable. I installed the latest update in the hope of resolving the bugs in the prior one, but it only got worse. This is not an improvement. 
The app FREEZES regularly, sometimes in the midst of a chat, then it needs to be closed and reopened to continue; the text may or may NOT be saved.
There have been several occasions when the app completely CRASHES, and then I'm looking at a blank screen or the scruff startup logo, depending exactly on what, who knows?
Finally, the badge notifications do not always clear after opening profiles and reading messages. They used to, but not anymore, and the speed with which past messages scroll into Scruff's inaccessible junkyard is a cheap ploy to get more Pro subscribers.

title: Don't go Pro
review: I really like the basic free app, have had a lot of great chats and fun with it. Because I liked it so much, I decided to give the "Pro" version a go, and it was a complete waste. Really expensive considering what you get (the only thing I found helpful was being able to re-visit older chats). Once I upgraded, I stopped getting my notifications regularly, and the swipe feature (where you can swipe through profiles without returning to the main screen) didn't always work smoothly. So my review of 4 stars is for the basic free app, which I enjoy, but SCRUFF is getting really greedy, and I will not be renewing the pay version.

title: A reliable product, lots of guys
review:
It ALWAYS locks on GPS, always keeps my messages and history, and I always send and receive messages without any headache. The paid version gives you access to all sorts of nifty archiving picture utilities, but isn't necessary to have a good time. Essentially, this product does what it promises reliably an effectively. This by itself for me is enough for 5 stars. 

The community is also really great. I know that's going to vary by location, but I've largely only had good experiences, and I've met a lot of hot, fun guys on here. I LOVE that you can sort by community, like jock or student or leather.

title: Review from CT
review:
I like scruff because it is an avenue to meet and chat with other guys out-of-state and other countries.. In my state, this is going to sound cliche, but it is really hard to meet quality guys and get to know, and on a level deeper then just SEX.. I have been on other sites and I think this is the easiest one to find the kind of guy that you want physically.. But such as life not always on an emotional level.. Guys say on here, well it's a sex site... That's just not true.. You make the site out for what you want it to be!! Not everyone is looking for an instant hook up..I have found love on a website before and we were married.. I am now single and keeping my eyes opened for something real!!
Thank you😋

title: An App for the Gay Community.
review:
Simply fantastic, a responsive App is not only well designed but also brings together the best of a mobile world to our fingertips, networking! Having the ability to filter worldwide and connect with other guys is a truly fantastic experience as it opens the opportunity to establish great friendships.

The UI is easy to navigate though Woofs could be highlighted a little more as well as the "Would you Meet?" tool which to this day have to see working.

I highly recommend the App to anyone looking to connect with the gay community locally. Well worth the membership fee to go PRO.

title: I love using ScruffPro!
review: There isn't anything I don't love about ScruffPro.  The features are all great, especially the "recent" archives that remembers all the pics you ever sent and makes them super easy to access when sending pics to other users!  I also love that you can have dozens and dozens of locked pics.  I only wish it had two things that Growlr has: a place where you can blog, and the ability to send out mass messages to all the men in a defined geography ... those additions would be great.  I really have no complaints about Scruff.  I meet men constantly off this great app!

title: Pro is a must -- But Scale Back Please!
review:
Honestly not worth using without Pro -- but a solid app none the less. 

First the good -- guys near you grids, ability to search in pro for charecteristics that - um -- some feel are very important for compatibility shall we say. Also I applaud their use of PrEP and TAsP as safer options. OK -- the bad, Most Woofed? Annoying. Most Woofed New? Catfish central.  

Ultimately they may be trying to do too much. Already head and shoulders above similar apps, I don't need it to make a soufle for me (places to stay, city guides, ambassadors) - I need it to locate the folks I wanna -- locate. Well worth $9-12 a month for Pro. They've done a very good ob -- they deserve it.

title: Reliable
review: I use this app and another similar app. Scruff is much more reliable than the other one, which is full of bugs and quirks and service interruptions. I often have problems sending messages on the other app I use - it tends to have "message failed" situations on a regular basis. Not with Scruff! The only feature the other app offers that I wish were available on Scruff is the ability to save commonly used phrases so you don't have to type the same thing time & again to different guys. Otherwise, Scruff beats the other app hands-down!

title: Best Gay Social App!
review: I love Scruff, and even pay to have Scruff Pro.  It is the best gay social/dating app I have found, very easy to use, smooth design and layout, mostly free of tech issues(way better than Grindr), accepting of diversity of men using the app, and allows plenty of space to share about yourself and create a genuine profile including pictures.  I have talked with many very friendly people around the country via Scruff, as well as met guys that have become some of my closest friends and partners.  It is an excellent app for travelers!  I highly recommend Scruff over any of the other "gay men" apps.

title: Just missing One function:
review: Great app BUT could be nearly perfect If You Added a way user can jot short notes for their own eyes only, for guys' profiles - much as you can on standard online "social" apps, e.g., Manhunt -- even if just a sentence or a few key words for reference - it would solve more than one issue and put this app, over-the-top... I'm sure it's not so simple or the function would exist, but these days, everything is do-able if willing to find a solution, even if it does not presently exist... Still kicks Grindr's lame first try tho... Good job so far - don't get bloated and lazy like they have... Bring us Notes Please.

title: Feb Update
review: idk what these old men are cryin about. The new Match feature is awesome. It's one of the few features other apps had that Scruff did not. Now Scruff is better than all of the rest imho, as it was already pre-update. It got rid of the 'maybe' option which was basically useless anyway. Now with Match integrated into the yes/no options for 'Would you like to meet', I'm guessing a lot more ppl would use the WYLTM now that they're tied. You can also filter on who would like to meet you. Everything they've done makes sense. If it's not for you then move on!!

title: Used to be better
review:
I loved this app when it first came out.  There have been a lot of changes for the better, but it's just not the quality it was before, and I don't like being told to pay for something I can get for free somewhere else (i.e. Grindr, Growlr, etc.). 

Something I would like to see is a filter option.  I'm sure we would be asked to pay for that too.  It just gets old sorting through age groups.  I also get really annoyed at all the "partnered" guys on it.  It would be much better if I could filter out all the "happily" partnered guys so I could actually get to converse with someone available.  

A search option would be nice too.  Sadly, right now the only way there is to search is by city.  

I've also had problems with messages not showing up, and taking forever to come through.  Perhaps less time spend on celebrity PR and more time providing a quality product would be good for this app's image.  It's a great app, but still lacking quite a bit, and sadly losing ground.

title: Great way to meet the non-stereotyped guys
review:
What's on Scruff: fur, beards, bears, men, daddies, boys, slim, chub, muscle -- all the scruffy things the original gay scene put down or devalued. Plus anyone of ANY description who likes any of the above.

What's common on Scruff: brains, conversation, raw sex, nonkink, light kink, heavy kink, tops, bottoms, versatiles, private nude pix, hot hot HOT private conversations, self-respect. 

What's NOT on Scruff: guys who are looking to put guys down ("go to the gym, dude!" "wax your back, man!"), femmetalk ("look at HER, Mary"), profiles that say "no fats or femmes", "generous" men or cuties who hint about money... Scruffers have their preferences and state them, but are respectful of guys whose preferences are different.

title: Good, but still needs some features..
review: First of all, I must admit I've never used Grindr, so I can't compare Scruff with it. But I'm impressed by Scruff already. Though it still needs some basic features like browsing through profiles and searching with different criteria (handle/age), etc, but I'm sure it is coming in the updated versions.. I've been using it a few hours and I love this one already.. Plenty of eye candy, and will be even better when more guys get to know of this app, and start using it.. Thank you, Eric!

title: App with comprehensive features
review: I am reviewing the free version of this app. All though many nice features are reserved for the premium version, the free version already contains several convenient features that other dating apps lack. Location search is a nice one. The best aspect is the extra anonymity of your choice -- you are given the option of staying offline, or even deactivate your account (but not instantaneous delete it and can recover). Chat tool is very good. One biggest critique is that the app crashes more often than others.

title: Having good experience with this app
review: The Scruff app is loaded with features and easy to use. They seem to be always striving to make it better too. The chat is handy and its alert tone is recognizably distinct. Profile area gives plenty opportunity to share as much or little as you want. When I have usage questions, usually I can find answer in the Help or doing a web-search. One improvement that I could wish is same for any app: to have more folks on it and Scruff is doing better than some others. I hope they keep broadening their reach to broader, more diverse community.

title: Fun f...ing app
review:
This app has been so much fun... I've meet guys from all over the world. The kind words of strangers speaks volumes. Our global village seems more connected by our ability to reach out and speak to men close by and across the ocean. I've has been a pleasure to connect both in realtime and virtual for great verbal banter......I the updates have progressively improved and made it more user friend. I do pay for the arms consider it worth it for the added perks..........no ads, and expanded searches. 

I have gotten lost many more nights than I care to mention talk to men on this app. Thank you guys

title: Great if you aren't picky!
review: While I do agree with some of the complaints in other reviews, I must say they pale in comparison to what I like about Scruff. I've had numerous good hookups, met some really hot men, and I can't complain about being a free user and not receiving all the extra features because what do you expect? Only real complaint is not being able to see a guy's full album even after he unlocks it for you. If I still have to pay, what's the point? Only main complaint. Other than that, I don't depend on Scruff for a real relationship because it's a dating app, not a miracle worker.

title: Good app, greedy creators
review:
I like the app but I've been contemplating whether or not to keep it especially after the some of the features were removed and now I have to pay for them. I don't mind having to pay a monthly subscription but these rate are steep.   I already pay for some of my other apps like Grindr ($30 for one year) and made a "donation" to Jack'd ($13 for one year) and gained full access for both after doing so.  I feel that having to pay $9 a month a total $108 a year is absolutely ridiculous.  I understand that programmers and hosting servers need to be paid but lets not be greedy.  The app is good, not great and I like meeting and chatting with guys around the world, but again not at the new rates.

I hope Johnny scruff gets his act together soon and reconsiders the rates.

title: Overall, App functions well
review:
Overall this app functions well.  

The only problem I've encountered is I have stopped showing up on the Global feed despite my settings being enabled to do so.  Scruff Support indicated that there was no apparent defect and the Global feed is simply a random selection of enabled users.  Why I would repeatedly appear on the global feed and then all of a sudden stop permanently is somewhat odd.  I frequently made the most woofed in the last hour list, which abruptly stopped when I was permanently left off the global feed, so perhaps I should just pick up the pieces of my fractured ego and move on with my life...but I figured I'd vent in this review first :-P

title: Don't waste your money
review:
This started out as a great concept and fun app. I guess that as it become more popular, good ole American style corporate greed took over. If you refuse to pay the nearly $9/month for a texting service (which, basically, is what this is), you are down to the most basic features. Any other feature that might remotely make this a more interesting app is a PRO feature - but don't be rolled by the word though, unless they mean pro scammers.

Tried to view who woofed at me? PRO feature. What's the point??
Tried to look at more profiles of guys in my area? PRO feature
Tried to read previous exchanges with people on here? PRO feature.

Sorry, I'd rather use my money on something that actually provides value and enjoyment for my money!

PS - reading through the reviews, your rating seems to have taken a nose dive from previously 4+ stars to just 1 now - probably because 0 is not given as an option. Occasionally there's the overly eager or overly chipper 5 star review with no info - useful or otherwise - for the rating. One can only assume those reviews are from Scruff's own people trying to keep it afloat. Sad!

title: It's still the king of its kind
review:
I read a 1 star review I have to respond to. He says he's a pro iOS dev. Well so am I. And I completely agree, the UI update is over the top and falls short of a really elegant experience. If this update was expensive I hope it's a learning lesson for all involved.

But does this app deserve one star? NO. It's still the best at what it is. Best community. Best messaging features. The Instagram links in profiles actually work now. The app prompts for feedback when it never did before. It's the same scruff but a little nicer looking. Sad we lost basic filtering options but oh well.

title: Superior user experience
review: I've been using Scruff for at least two years now and have found it to be head and shoulders above any competing apps. It's rich in features, intuitive in design, powerful in search, and seamless in operation. Of course, the main appeal is its audience; it tends towards the no-nonsense, masculine, and, of coarse, scruffy. But my hat goes off to the developers who have succeeded in building a tight, streamlined, elegant, and robust app that makes it all the more pleasurable to use for connecting with other guys. This is the app that should set the benchmark for usability. Bravo!

title: Time to start looking...
review: ...for another service that can deliver what I'm looking for at a mo reasonable price.  Factoring in reliability -- that push notifications only seem to work about 75% of the time at BEST and regularly less than 50% of the time...this is (a bit generously) a 3-star app. With the new expensive (relative to the market) and complicated pricing structure that 1) does not remove ads and (more importantly) 2) locks out a good 1/3 of the app's functionality (including features that were previously free) it is now a generous 2 stars.  I'm willing to pay for apps and even app subscriptions when I feel that they are highly reliable and fairly priced.  Right now, as sad as it makes me to say it, Scruff is neither.  =(

title: Fun, but...
review: It's a fun app, don't get me wrong, but could really use a few updates.  First of all, when guys leave an area they remain in the search result for weeks if not months thus reducing the number of real guys in the area that you can see.  Also, a search filter would be an excellent addition.  Messages take a very long time to be received and at times, no notification appears so you could have received one and not known about it.  Finally, it shows guys as being online, when in fact they are not.  All in all, it's good for some fun, but other apps such as Grindr are better for now.

title: I like the update (am I in the minority?)
review: The latest update brings bigger thumbnails, which is actually quite useful. Nice having a TouchID lock for the app to. Having noticed any major bugs - still works pretty well. Generally a better clientele than THAT other app which has a limited space to write information and equally as vacuous patrons. I've had a few decent conversations on Scruff and even met people who were NOT after a hook-up - surprise, surprise. I find it most useful when visiting an unfamiliar city, chatting with the locals in a non-threatening environment and even meeting for brunch!

title: Scruff review your own guidelines
review: I don't have any problems with the functionality of this app. However the monthly subscription is way too much so I only purchase it maybe once a year. Also I've been flagged more than once for the same profile pic I put up of me in my underwear....no crotch shots or bare buttocks visible. Yet I can continue to see several other profile pics with racier pics than mine. Scruff if you are going to have guidelines you must have every scruff member adhere to them this is why I would never give your app five stars. Also they took away the "guys who want to meet you" feature come on seriously Scruff????

title: Major Improvements
review:
It is obvious to me that the developers have put a lot of effort under the hood. With the latest version, speed has increase significantly on many aspects: sending messages, loading profile photos, navigation, etc. 

The addition of the check marks next to sent messages to confirm they were sent to Scruffs servers is a welcomed feature. 

I am really pleased with the improvements this app had made over the last couple months, and this newest version is by far the best Scruff app so far.

title: Easy to navigate and great looking men
review: I really love scruff, less pop ups and no pushy sales ads like several of the other hook up sites.  Each of the sites has specific people the one starting with a g is for LTR.  The one starting with A has fake guys to chat with you to promote their site.  I have more flake outs and stand ups on it, plus photo collectors. Scruff is real guys looking to hook up in ten emails or less usually.  I have extremely fortunate with my results from Scruff's site, jive people I would not mind having back in my home!

title: Better than others, but could still improve
review:
Scruff seems better than ManHunt and daddyhunt... But it does have things that annoy me.  I like filtering by what guys want (like daddy chaser vs daddy) but wish I could filter on other attributes (like top vs bottom). 

Haven't been able to figure out if some filters are used with 'and' or 'or' logic. Seems kind of random. 

The only sort is by 'vicinity' ... And since guys who show up at the top of all my lists are near, but don't appeal to me or don't  respond ... But they  never seem to log off so they're always 'at front of the line'..   Sigh.

title: Ready for Real guys??
review: Love seeing how far away all the guys are. Set filters to show the type of guys you are most interested in. You can simply indicate you like someone or even send a woof without being offensive. If they are interested, they can respond. The ability to have a larger number of pics in a private gallery that you can lock or unlock at will. Saves previous conversations also, so it is easy to start talking to someone you might not have seen in a while. Great app. GO PRO, it's worth it!!

title: McScrufflicious
review: I guess I just don't understand all the complaints. I have flawless use of Scruff. Despite the massive amount of time I spend Scruffing I have never experienced an issue. I've met AMAZING men and I absolutely love how fun and easygoing the 3 Scruff founders are in person.  Pay features are worth every dime in my opinion yet if I was unwilling to part with the money every month the free (stop complaining if your not paying) version is MORE than satisfying. I've been soo busy Scruffing I just don't have the time to grind or growl.   Great app with GREAT users. Thanks Guys!!!

title: New update is just okay
review: In the nearby section you can search by city to matter what country it was, and it looks like in the new update you took that feature out, which I like because I have friends in other countries, now if something happens to the app you have no way to find them if you lose history Yeah works just fine functions well and there are a few good friends, But for the most part it's not the fun app with guys that were a lot of fun anymore, Many nasty people blocking you just for saying hi and inquiring of their well-being, Then I find kind of sad, Scruff used to be a friendly app, But not anymore

title: Effective in connecting people
review:
Possible problem. Since the recent update, my phone acts up after opening the App. The phone will now auto close other apps, act like it wants to delete other apps, opens random ones, and won't let me close out any apps.

I deleted only Scruff as a troubleshooting technique and the problems went away. Please fix this as I enjoy the app as I stated in a previous review that can be seen below. 

I've found this app to be effective in connecting me with other like minded guys. I'm now friends with a few guys from around the world. These are ones that I have talked to on the phone, facebooked, etc. It's more than just a hook-up site if used responsibly.

title: SCRUFF engages in disgraceful CENSORSHIP!
review: Scruff engages in censorship and routinely suspends profiles and members whose views do not comport with the ultra permissive gay "community" stances.  Think San Francisco liberals at their most vocal and hating of viewpoints other than their own.  Scruff is full of "open relationship" types, i.e., men who can't or won't commit.  They routinely contact us single guys just for NSA.  Most of these guys aren't attractive (which is the reason why they aren't getting any at home).   Even if they contact you first, if you speak out against open relationships and say "No thanks," the gay couple will report you and Scruff will suspend you!  Also, if your profile says "no partnered or guys with boyfriends," and someone complains, Scruff will suspend you.  So hateful and intolerant!  Scruff is disgusting and un-American in its censorship!

title: One recommendation.....
review: I love this app for chat and other things, but I wish there was one thing it could do. We all have our type of guy, right? Wouldn't it be great if there was a way that Scruff could automatically weed out guys from view based on one's own woofs and chat? I get plenty of woofs from many guys, but a lot of them are from guys I would never talk to. If this could work, we wouldn't have to search for our type manually; guys of our type would just appear. That would be preferred. Other than this one improvement, Scruff is amazing!

title: Great App!
review: I have used Scruff for a while now and I like that you can chat with people all over the world,  put in travel itineraries, and manage your photos in a much easier way (an album) as opposed to other social apps, namely Grindr.  I have stopped using Grindr because of the constant ads and spam messages as well as the crashes and terrible service. Scruff is 100% better and they are continually updating but not whole overhauls that make using the app confusing. Definitely suggest downloading!

title: I hate the new version.
review:
Greed had brought this company to put in the small screen of my iPhone unnecessary features that all they do is to crump my screen. 
Price has gone up. Why change something that was working just fine. One last thing, originally I paid to have commercial banners off my screen, now I still get their banners which bugs the hell out of me. The only good thing is one filter is been moved to the may page (online now). 
If I don't pay I can only see two pictures of each profile. Stop being greedy changing the app to up the price. The original app worked just well. I don't care who's the most woofed guy, that makes room for all those extremely vain dudes who just here to play games.

title: Pretty cool.
review:
I think scruff is actually pretty cool. The updates are pretty neat-o too. As with any other app it has it's moments where maintenance is needed. However, Scruff is one of the classiest gay social apps out there, that I've tried. I've had more "dates" using Scruff vs finding guys who only want to hookup ie: most other apps. Still looking for the right guy but using Scruff to meet friends and potentials along the way. I'm only 20 and I think this app is doing our community justice. 

Thank you Scruff - for raising the standard for our community.

title: Great App!
review: I love the new features on the Scruff app.  But one thing is definitely clear...and that is people feel you have exceeded the price that they are willing to pay to use it.  We don't mind that you become rich and successful from your Scruff business.  We do however mind that you're trying to do it overnight!   I use to use Grindr and a few others, but I enjoy this app the most.  If they get updated and have similar features but are less expensive, I would switch back very easily.

title: Scruff Pro
review: It's great to be able to see the stats for people and know what types of people they respond to, how often they respond and which types they seem more interested in. The woofs are a great way to show a quick interest and if you get one back, knowing you probably won't be wasting your time chatting with them. I've gotten a few dates (legitimate dates) using Scruff. I also don't have to worry about whether people are into hair or not. Scruff is for, well scruffy people and those who like them.

title: Love Scruff
review:
Below was my 1st review of Scruff; however, they've done something Amazing--> they mange to take a great App and RUIN IT!!! 

I liked it so much I paid a few bucks for some extra features.   The additional ads are bad enough & should see the cost to users go down. Instead they require $70 a year to use most of the services that were free or very cheap.  

Sorry guys but no bears or cubs are worth $70 or more year. I think you've let success go to your head???

Your new upgrade lost many of my favorites.  Guess I'll go back to Grindr and the other free apps. Will encourage all Scruff users to do the same!!!!

----------
Best social network app for guys who aren't "Twinks".  I hit it off with over 80% of the guys I meet on here. 
99% of the guys are super friendly even if you are not a perfect match.

Has many great features, including the woof & global. 

Only thing I add is a location button u can use to tell the other person where u are. Also wish the chat log was longer have lost phone numbers & address not knowing it auto erases all but the last 25 messages. 

Overall I really love it.
userName: Walking on the wild side w/Tony

title: Disappointed
review: This used to be the go to app, but when they updated it to include "Messaging Pro" you now have to pay $4.99/month for some of the functions. $4.99/month is a little much to pay for a possible hook up, cause that's what most of the guys on here are looking for. I'm not even sure what messaging pro gives u other than the ability to look at older messages, and possibly save your pictures inside the app rather than your iPhone. I'd rather get "My Secrer Folder" which I only paid $1.99 and I can still keep all those x-rate pictures hidden.

title: By far, my favorite dating app
review: Hot, real, guys and an interface that's easy-to-use is why I love Scruff. Have used it off and on for years, and Scruff is full of guys who aren't afraid of who they are *cough*Grindr*cough* and are willing to get to know you. It also would seem obvious that the developers of this app care deeply about its users health and well-being - there are often service announcements about pertinent events like pride festivals, entertainment, free testing, etc. in the app. 5 out of 5 stars! Can't go any other way.

title: Out of all the gay apps...
review: This is a half decent app, except when u have to be subjected to the dramatic, long-list queens that seem to envision this is a make-a-wish list for Santa. With boring us with what they don't want. Get real, be simple n direct to voice ur opinion ;) sometimes it is a little off with the GPS but overall everything works smoothly. It is a rip-off that you have to be "pro" to even have a full thought or it is not allowed **cough cough** trying to take our $ **cough cough**

title: Here comes that sinking feeling... Again
review: I once liked this app better than Grindr and other similar ones; but, now, it's not much good to me whatsoever.  I once checked Scruff out regularly; but, then, I started losing interest and came online once in a long while.   Then it was rarely ever.  Finally, I just deleted it!  The pattern just got progressively worse.  The same local guys, if listed were seldom online..   How could I blame them?  Maybe, I seem snobby, but frankly it gets tiresome lowering expectations and accepting nonsense and idiocy over time.  Most of these guys are not very interesting, sincere, smart, healthy, or any of the qualities I'd look for in a lover, friend or just a "fling."   Who needs it?  Not me!

title: It's gotten abysmally bad.
review:
Now you pay for things that common sense would dictate should be free. Old chats? Can't see them unless you pay. Viewing all your favorites? Fork over the cash, please. 

Now you have to have a password to log in? Does Johnny Scruff think we're all so irresponsible with our iPhones that we need to have another layer of security?

If Johnny Scruff would focus on fixing this app so it's less of a broken money hog rather than trying to shoehorn his way into crap indie films and promoting his barber's new haircut style...that'd be nice.  (He could also feature more than just the same tired type of guys -- or Little David, whatever his name is. Apparently diversity isn't Johnny Scruff's thing.)

title: Still needs major changes
review:
I'm resending my review of yet another incremental update due to the fact that these guys don't seem to be listening.

I think it's funny how most of the 5-star ratings are touting the hot guys but don't address the actual app functions or pricing... Wonder who wrote those?

The free version is SO annoying with the constant reminders and popups that say you have to pay for other features... If you simply scroll to the end of guy lists or message lists in the free version, you _always_ get a popup screaming for you to upgrade, and the popup either has to be closed manually or you have to sit there and wait for it to disappear.  A huge, annoying time waster. The string of notifications on login for events and stuff no one remotely cares about is ridiculous. The fact that I have to enter my complete email and password every time I log in is absurd.

And paying an obscene amount of money on a monthly basis just to get a few extra perks and line the gilded pockets of the developers? Don't get me started.

title: I just don't know ...
review:
I did just recommend a friend join and have a lot of my friends. I do prefer it in a way over Grindr... But something about Grindr man... The mask? It is great branding... Scruff needs that. It needs a cool, it factor. Something mysterious and alluring, hip but not trying to hard, like The Facebook when it was The Facebook.

Also, it is so expensive. And I never got my discount!?! Which is not cool. I like the match feature. Dare I say I think there should almost be s hot or not rating feature, more like a list of qualities and insights, or info from other users, like how you are perceived...

Very good for giving info and sharing pics. Super easy there. Also like to flirt with woof or just leaving a trail or not.

I think this app looks so much better and seems to work well too. We just need some sort of it factor. Something spooky or surprising or a little deviant and weird, a new feature or and icon with a tag line... Or even like a mascot?!?

title: good but needs work
review:
has the features i want and the community is there using it. in that way it's great.

but the app design is spotty. the 'hints' feature is intrusive, repetitious and apparently cannot be disabled despite promises to the contrary in the Guide. And the only reason 'hints' were added, one guesses, is because the interface features are sometimes hard to find or identify or get to and people were undoubtedly confused. Strange since it's just the usual cruise site deal -- public and private photos, messages, profiles. 

So...hope they're still working on this one....good thing, just feels unfinished.

title: Scruff is reliable and let's me be me
review:
Love that scruff allows people to be who they are. Scruff can be a social network to make friends, a platform to meet your next lover, or your pathway to lustful adventures. you can make your profile represent you, and express as little or as much about yourself as you want. 

Love that scruff has remained reliable! Core functionally is excellent, server side storage has saved me so much hassle over and over, and I have been delighted by good support for new Apple products.

title: Just another grindr.
review:
*update: due to my complaints on my profile about the product and subsequent promoting of competing app, Johnny deleted my profile, so much for no attitude!  

It's an ok app, started out better than it is now. First frustration is that I can't to do anything any more without getting that little pop up saying something like "sorry you cant do that, buy pro for better access!" Sorry Johnny, not gunna buy pro when its been over run by non bears for non bears(or cubs or chubs or daddies). That's the second complaint, it's an app for bears and the like and their admirers but I keep getting msgs from the non bear crowd! 

Honestly am enjoying Growlr better now, sorry Johhny, props for pioneering it but you've gone astray with the upgrade ploy.

title: Great App
review:
I've met lots of great guys on Scruff.  I've met guys for smokin' hot hookups and had conversations and friendships spanning many years.  Thanks to the poly relationship category, I met a couple of great boyfriends on scruff who were open to having a married boyfriend.  

I find the interface easy to use, and I like the filtering tools for searches.  I think the match stack would work better with settings for which types of relationships you're open to, how far away you'd consider, etc.

title: Scruffy Pup Likes the Daddy-Sized Details
review: It's Nice to have both a Grid of Guys in your Area and a "Match Book" to flip through, Combing the best of both Grindr and Tinder. This is the Best Gay Social App I've used. Has the Guys Nearby as well as Options to look in other Areas. The worst part about it are the Profiles with No Pictures or the Profiles with too Many..Creepy HornDogs. Other than that, it's like a Big Hairy Oasis, a Manly Mirage, a PapaBear Paradise... Ok, I'm giving it a little too much Credit but it still deserves a Five Star Rating.

title: Functional but way to pricey
review:
When I fist got the ap it was my fav over grindr, jacked or even a4a.  However, the latest version limits you in every capacity.  I can only unlock for a few people at a time, can only see two of any given members' private photos, and can only see a recent history of the chats!  Reminds me of how cranky manhunt is... But at least manhunt has reasonable membership rates (ESP. When they have their 50% off sales).  

Please take my advice and give users more freedom, or at least give them a reasonable member rate.  I think most guys would be happy to pay about $5 a month or so... Just sayin, I'd hate for scruff to get as unpopular as manhunt.

title: Good, not amazing.
review:
Good for online cruising. They really need to figure out a way to lower the
"Pro" price though. About 1% of people to ever walk this earth will pay $100 a year for an app. I started using this because I read it was transgender inclusive, but there's more to be desired in that department (gay cis guys will be gay cis guys I suppose). The app itself is groundbreaking in that it has a "Community" option for "Transgender" (albeit right next to "Leather" and "Hairy". Overall, nice interface, album features, messaging system, profile layouts, and user filters.

title: Total BS
review: This is nothing more than a troll site for old guys who want to collect pictures of young guys and a ton of young con artist trying to scam money. Within minutes of signing up, I was contacted by half a dozen guys claiming to be thousands of miles away in another state or foreign country and needed money for a plane ticket to meet up and other older guys with no pic or profile. 75% of the profiles are not filled out at all - or are extremely limited and vague on their info. A majority claim to be in a relationship or partnered and only wanting to chat or looking for a serious relationship - on a sex site no less. So if you’re looking for nothing more then chatting and a few pics, then this site is for you.

title: Loads of Features, Stable, Supportrd
review: I have scruff pro. The ability to have multiple favorites lists, to have an album of pictures and to search for names, locations, and filter by interests is great. And the few times I've had to ask for support, scruff support was very responsive. I've met some great guys on the app and am making new friends in our new neighborhood. I'm even pen pals with a guy in Kuwait! Definitely better than the other gay apps I've tried in the past.

title: Scruff
review: Scruff covers men of all ages and backgrounds, but it also facilitates finding men with complimentary interests. Admittedly, the most common complimentary interest is what kind of face and body you each find appealing: a twink looking for a daddy and a daddy looking for a twink can easily set their filters to find each other. This is also very useful in avoiding unwanted sexual advances, making the Scruff experience quite rewarding and pleasant in general. It also means kinky men can find each other, which is the feature I enjoy most.

title: Buggy and way too expensive for that poor performance
review: Scruff turned out to be a huge disaapointment. I am glad I started with a 1-month trial subscription which I will definitely not renew. On iOS 6 the app constantly freezes and I have to restart my devices every time. I updated my profile and a few minutes later only the first line in all sections was there, everything else disappeared. Censored?! There was no reason for that. That occurred over ten times and in the end I contacted the customer support. My inquiry remained unanswered! And I cannot be refunded in case I cancel the subscription. Nice app concept but very poor performance. And the subscription plan is in no way justified.

title: Great App, Great Guys
review: If you grow tired of a never-ending stream of twinkerific pics when scrolling through gay meet-or-hook up iPhone apps (cough Grindr cough), you've found the right app with real men. I've never felt limited by the free version, so if you think subscription prices are too high, you won't truly need to tap your bank account to use the app (so long as you don't mind only seeing a partial history of your messages). All in all nice app.

title: It's the best out there
review: Love this app. Shows great men from all over the world or those who are close by. Pro version is the one to buy as it gives so many more options.  Only beef I have is the filters don't work. If I try to filter for those on line, just does not filter out those who are not.  Plus, I, like most men, am color blind so those little dots indicating on-line or off-line need to be in very clear primary colors.  Orange and green look identical to most of us.

title: It's the TOP one.
review:
Super-hot men are always 3,300 miles away it seems. 
But at least there are still super hot men in the world. 
Upgrade to Pro. It's worth it. I have text chains with friends that go back years. Awesome. Like going back through a diary sometimes. :-)
Good filters, too. Don't like always seeing the guy across the street who just ignores me. So, poof!  He is not in my grid. :)
I have 7 of these kinds of apps. Or at least I used to. This is the one I use. All the others deleted.

title: Almost the best gay app
review: Only thing missing is the one thing we want that every app will not give us that the websites we loathe because they aren't as accessible as the mobile apps are. We want to be able to search for 'preferred sexual position' and 'sexual act likes' and the right to want to have sex bb but only release that to people who do as well. Invisible only to those that confirm they do as well. To those that don't they remain completely in the dark.

title: Wants $ at every turn
review: Not only is the paid version subscription-based, monthly, but even the features that should be standard like being able to scroll back messages from just a few minutes before become unavailable without being forced to pay to view them. I find the app screams for your money at every turn to have features paid for constantly, I find that rude. They are so desperate to have you pay monthly that I have been completely turned off by the application and I will  uninstall it. (Grinder too, has its problems, but there are more people and they tend to be a lot more attractive.)

title: Ok app - priced too high now
review: Scruff started out good, and is still a decent app and certainly better for non-twinks than Grindr.  However, the recent add-on services are priced ridiculously high.  Additionally, there is no profile quality control (other rjan a rodiculois Nazi attorude toward partial nudityty) or review of users, so it is losing its niche amongst the scruffy bears, and becoming just another generic app.  I still will use it, but it becomes seems like it is becoming less and less Scruffy as the owners attempt to market out to a larger paying  non-Bear oriented market.  That's a shame.

title: Good app. Not great yet
review: This is a good app. To be great...needs a few 'enhancements'. 1) messages take too many steps to retrieve. 2) drains battery 3) location takes too long to update. Should be able to request a location refresh 3) would be nice to be able to filter only others online in near tab, 3) should show date/time since last checkin & last online. 4) should be able to clear ALL messages at once.  Enhancements (if any) are coming way too slow. Maybe the developers are getting busy too. 

title: Needs work
review: Come on scruff developers! This was a great app, I've hooked up many times thanks to them! I'm really disappointed the developers allowed their system to be down for so many days especially now that customers are paying for features and are not able to use them! The least they could do was let us know they are working on the problem or give us a discount or something to keep our customer loyalty! I'd hate to see people move on to the other available apps that may not be as comparative but are more reliable...

title: Scruff is the best gay dating app around.
review: Scruff is the best gay dating app around. The techies on the team really took the time to get the functionality right; enhancing the user experience navigating the photos, favorites and profiles. Most importantly it's easy for anyone to communicate and still have the ability to look up old conversations going back 5 years. That's helpful for missed connections. I always recommend Scruff to all my handsome twink, chasers, otters and bear friends.

title: We ❤️ Scruff
review: First, Scruff is available for Windows phone and we are thankful. We use on our iPhone and windows phones to access Scruff. Second, Scruff is real men without spam. We randomly have used grindr, daddy hunt, growlr and others. We add/delete their apps because of the game players and BS, we never delete Scruff. Finally, the ease of use, many free features and ability to properly introduce ourselves in text and photos makes Scruff number one for us. Thanks!

title: Scruff is sexier and more responsive than Grindr
review: I enjoy the selection of guys that scruff attracts more than any other app. The guys are friendlier. Scruff's capacity to browse outside your current area if planning a trip is another plus over other apps. Unlike Grindr, you can track if someone viewed you profile which I especially like because it serves as a way of knowing whether or not someone read your message to them or not.

title: Global tab
review: I do love this app but I had to make a new account recently with no help from support. These past few months I have not been appearing on the global tabs ( my received woofs dropped in frequency first world problems I know....) another user/friend had the same issue only to told that the global feature was working so we both ended up making new accounts. Guess what? The problem went away. To test if it were true I logged back onto old account and the issue was still there. Oh well at least the new account works.
developerResponse: {'id': 490089, 'body': "We apologize. Our product team is currently adjusting the parameters for which profiles are displayed in the Global grid, which may explain your issue. Please navigate to SCRUFF Settings and tap “Contact SCRUFF Support”, or submit a request at support.scruff.com. We’d love to speak with you again and restore your previous profile if you'd like! WOOF!", 'modified': '2017-06-02T17:39:53Z'}

title: Don't pay for "ad-free"
review: Apparently ad-free no longer means ad-free. You can disable the popover ads but apparently Scruff has some vested interest in other companies because there's a banner at the bottom of the page now which is basically the same as Grindr's free app. I appreciate the extra features, but don't advertise the pro version as ad-free when it really means "only the ads we want to show you". The #1 reason people pay subscriptions for apps that have free versions is to get rid of the ads. Everything else is a bonus. Lose the ads and then maybe I'll resume paying you $13 a month. Until then, be thankful you got a couple of years out of me.

title: fools, and monkeys
review:
a guy approached me on scruff telling me that he "only had fun with generous men" - meaning he'd have sex with me for money.  he approached me.  i called him the word for the world's oldest profession several times, he admitted he had sex for money and said he didn't care because it paid the bills and that he was 3rd in his med school class.  i reported him to scruff for soliciting money for sex.  and scruff suspended my account but his is still active.

so don't call anyone what they admittedly are or you'll get your account suspended.  but go ahead and solicit people to have sex for money and you're A-OK in the scruff playbook.

this most recent update was pounded out by 1000 monkeys at 1000 typewriters over 1000 years.

title: A miserable failure!
review:
Scruff keeps issuing minor upgrades to purge the bad reviews. This is NOT a four star app but a one star app.  Go back and read ALL the reviews. It seems to get worse with each "upgrade". 

Scruff got greedy and ruined this app. The pay features are way too expensive. And now some of the previously free features must be paid for e.g., you can't view check ins unless you pay for the browser feature. Scruff lied when they said all the free features would remain free.

Scruff just keeps issuing new updates every couple of weeks to purge the bad reviews. This app Is expensive and offers nothing worthwhile.  I'm now using GROWLr and have already met several friendly (and HOT!) bears.

title: WAY better than Grindr!
review: You can have profile information, see guys who aren't in your area, the "woof" system is nice for those who aren't super assertive (like myself) or just to compliment people you find attractive. Scruff feels like a classier version of Grindr with more features (for free) and better GUI and ease-of-use. 4 out of 5 stars because you can only see (I think it's 50?) people in your area for free and have to pay to see more. That's the only downside I can think of. Otherwise it's great.

title: Rethinking my pro membership
review: So Scruff used to be my favorite cruising app, so much so that I've been a paying member for over a year now (and I hardly EVER pay for apps, especially an expensive monthly membership fee). Over the last couple of months, though, I've become more and more disappointed in its performance. The latest update is likely the nail in the coffin for my pro membership. What little time I've been able to spend checking out the (lousy) new features between crashes leaves me unimpressed. Giving it a couple of weeks to improve, but very skeptical at this point.

title: not worth it
review: I use to really like scruff compared to grindr but now with the new update, I'm thinking they are after cash. use to be if someone unlocked their pics you could view them, now you have to be a paid member to see more than 2 private pics. scruff also use to mean all scruffy men but now it seems you have to be a muscle bear to be scruffy. too bad scruff you had a great thing going. I'm really glad there is still growlr.

title: Just a gay guy
review:
This is pocket GAYDAR.  I love to launch the app in any new locale to see who's on my team.  There is a feature where you can write a profile that is tailored to your specific interests.  If you are the hook-up type or the LTR seeker this app let's you express yourself.  Pics and profiles upload easily and let you put yourself out there in with remarkable ease. 

I found that the profile is very effective at articulating what's on your mind, who you are and what you are looking for.

I check it throughout the day and have far more fun meeting, chatting, exploring or just peeking.  

Nothing and no app is perfect.  This one is truly taking advantage of the shortcomings of other similar apps - it allows you to tailor your message.  I recommend it and have had no problems with it at all.

title: I love scruff
review: I like the app a lot. An easy way to meet people via chat when people are busy to go out. As well as being able to meet people when you travel. I have meet some great people from scruff. The best part is not just a hook up. I like that a lot. Being able to meet people and get to know them from my own city as well as from all over. I'm a fan. I don't like the fact I have pro but I am always having issues and it's not showing up on my phone. Drives me nuts.

title: Thank You
review:
Works very well. I like the user interface and being able to see who's viewed you. Nice set of guys as well. I also appreciate the continuing improvements, such as new and easier-to-use interfaces. 
Finally, I feel that much of the criticism of this application stems from peoples' hatred of both themselves and others in the online dating realms more than from legitimate, major interface issues. Thank you.

title: Are you going to fix it?
review: This is the best app out of all the gay social apps, but you got it wrong with all the bugs and wonkiness with this release.  I can't update my profile because it doesn't save changes and I keep getting a TOS warning that I don't understand. The word "travel" must be too offensive. Don't be Grindr and fix it quickly.  I'm a paying member and my subscription is up in 15 days, don't make me cancel it.

title: Still the best
review: This has always been the best gay App. Puts other apps like Grindr to shame. It very stable, works as designed and is great because you can meet men from all over the world. I have found the quality of guys on here to be better than Grindr also. And with the latest version things got even better with matching of other guys that are interested in meeting you. Check it out, you won't be disappointed!

title: Scruff
review: As a traveling salesmen I'm in different city's around North America. Scruff had helped me connect and stay in contact with friends from around the US and Canada. It's a very reliable app. I would recommend it to anyone looking to expand into the Bear and Leather Community. Scruff has an constantly supporting the community and the causes they represent. Thank you scruff for staying true to the bear and leather community. Thank you for providing a way for men around the world to connect.

title: greedFAIL
review:
So I've given it some time to give an honest opinion. This new update, has completely erased all conversations. Every interesting feature requires a 5-10$ a MONTH fee. If you don't want to pay, it's no better than the other apps...in fact it's worse!
On the other hand, I keep this app for two reasons: the guys are generally hot, and the amazing (always free n been there forever) feature of when you see who's online it organizes by distance. 
In summary, the greed is mind blowing,  and contains some frustrating glitches. 
My recommendation: go get Growlr...it's FREE and has the ability to have two lock/unlockable pics (even nudity) in addition to your profile pic!!

title: Really?
review: Why is it that with every "upgrade" there are more restrictions put on non-paid users? I understand you need to pay your bills too, but at $100 for a year?!  Even $13 a month is crazy.  You don't even have an actual website based service (such as recon or mister.) No other service charges that much. As another review mentioned, you can get Netflix for half the cost and they stream HD movies, not just text and small res photos. --   Will the next "upgrade" restrict how many messages you can send a day?  -- Keep restricting your users and they will find another, more reasonably priced, place to chat. You are not the only gay mobile chat app, just sayin'!

title: Better than that other app
review: If this were the only one of its kind, not sure i would give it 5 stars, but in comparison to that grindng app...well, there is no comparison.  Just the fact that it knows portrait from landscape is a plus, but the ability to view tracks and the light-handed moderation (as far as I know) make it infinitely better.  Admittedly, paying for the Pro version improves it even more; the enjoyment I get is worth the price.

title: Best App ever... Woof 😜
review: I highly recommend Scruff. I prefer this app over other apps out there. I've had both pro and without upgrade and both are much easier to use with great new features. I especially like the type of guys I've met on here. It seems that more mature, professional men choose this site. I've met some great guys and made some great friends along the way. Scruff gets a favorite star from me and a woof to its creators.

title: Really good app
review: Wow, an app that can save someone (and I can relate) is definitely locked in place on my iPhone. Plus the features are really good. I like that I can search other cities in the "near" tab instead of being stuck with my area. But, the fact that this app saved someone is awesome & stands out. Thank you Johnny Scruff for creating an app that is loaded with convenient features to make friends. 

title: Love the App....would love it more with additional clearing functions.
review:
I enjoy the app and how it has progressed over time.  I would like to see a clearing functionality of the profiles viewed/woof'd,  those who have viewed/woof'd my profile, and opened their private photos albums. The private album would lock on that other end.  May be that function could be for paying members only.  

Otherwise I enjoy it.

title: Best gay networking app
review: I have tried Grindr, growlr, jack'd, hornet, all the other bs apps on the market to try and find local guys to connect with. None have come close to giving me the experience that Scruff has. Simple layout that is easy to use and flows well. Very easy to connect with existing friends and meet new ones. Definitely recommend. In addition, I haven't seen ANY fake "bot" profiles like I see clogging up my feed on apps such as Grindr.

title: Good and Bad
review:
I like the overall view for the global and nearby sections, but the information sections on profiles is too narrow. I feel like I'm going to need to cut down my profile information.
