Also the area to edit is too small compared to the disclaimers about no sexual soliciting. It's hard to see what I'm really writing. 

I really dislike the new option to show what my sexual preference is and safety practices. I was happy to know there was ONE app that did not ask this- it made the site feel more like dating and you can overlook the hookup atmosphere.

title: To expensive.
review:
This is still a good App. But the new fee structure is a bummer. And I hate that the services are broken up into separate parcels. Just give us all the features for one low price.
That being said the guys are great of Scruff. Not like the prissy queens on Grindr. I like that most guys have an actual profile and don't pretend to just be looking for "friends".
Wish that you didn't loose the beginnings if your conversations unless you pay. Would be nice if the GPS was a little more accurate.

title: You Can't Beat Having Scruff
review: The app is great and definitely serves it's purpose.  Have been able to meet similar type men and have had the opportunity to develop some strong friendships.  It may be someone who happens to live down the street or across the globe...you never know who you're going to meet and what will come of it...but that's one of the great features of this app and what makes it a pleasure to use.   Thank you!

title: Scruff(ed)
review: To be to the point, it's my fav app. There are so many guys on here. However, being a relatively young looking 41 seems to have its curses. There should be functionality to search for guys within a certain age or "friendship" level. And why is it that when you search for guys in an area (nearby/city), they seem to run out. This does not make sense to me, as I am still interested in guys who live further than 2 mi/3 km from me. Still, I love the app.

title: Finally Revamped!
review:
Brings Scruff into iOS9 and iPhone + sizes brilliantly. 
*************************
Newest version fixes the few bugs I noticed after the 5.x release (namely the photo recall feature). Might I recommend a brief startup tutorial to show new users (and old) the settings menu? It would help with some of the complaints, especially the performance improvements when you turn off transitions and modify image download sizes. I feel many don't know those settings are there.

title: Best Gay App
review: Scruff has shown that they know how to build a quality app that is stable and feature rich. The catch? Quality costs. While all users will benefit from their dedication to making an app that doesn't crash or lose messages, like Grindr, and still have more free features (like free push notifications) than competing apps, the best features will cost you. And they don't come cheap, but they are worth it.

title: Love this app
review:
I really do love this app. It has great features and it seems to run a lot smoother than grinder. I love that it notifies you when you have messages, you don't need to be on the app for it to do so. Th features are great on it, very good for traveling and making new friends. 

I do have to say the one down fall I the price for some of the features is a little steep. I would like to see them drop a little so that they will be affordable for everyone.

title: Better than Grindr
review: Much more user-friendly experience. And it's actually worth doing their upgrade options. You can let them run out any time and your account/profile remains the same, whereas with Grindr, the free one and Xtra are two entirely different apps and your messages, faces, blocks etc don't switch over. Plus no ridiculous pop up ads. And the guys are hot!

title: Regretting updating...
review: Scruff has been one of my favorite apps for quite a while. I was excited for an update and even planned on purchasing a premium app. But almost $10 dollars a month?! Sorry scruff, but he'll no! I was willing to pay a one time fee, or even perhaps a low subscription fee. Your monthly fee is way too pricey and the cost if sending pics is a joke now. I'm saddened that I upgraded at all. My Fave app just fell from grace. I hope you realize that you are expecting people to pay too much when there are other apps and websites that have the same features for free. As someone who loves scruff I hope changes are made. Sad face indeed... :-(

title: New Version, Big Mess
review: You really, really need someone who understands user experience to do a top to bottom review of this app and give you a list of things that need to be fixed--because there are a lot. Black backgrounds with small red text can be really hard to read. You can't tap and hold on a message anymore to clear the conversation. These are just a few of the many problems. And I don't need a global grid throwing the fact that the most woof'd guys are muscular white guys who look like porn stars--I'd already guessed that. And on top of that you're jacking up the monthly rate? Yeah, no. I'm canceling, this is too much, and none of it is good.

title: Scruff Rocks!
review: I've been on Scruff for a little over 7 months now. As a technical guy, I have to give the APP 5 Stars for concept, execution and design. Like all technology roll-outs, from time-to-time there will be a bump in the road just from the complexity of perpetual progressive design enhancements and coordination with many variables. That said, despite Scruff's recent bump in the road from the last upgrade, I still gave the APP and service 5 stars.

title: Scruff
review: This is very user friendly app. The features are well thought out and provide important functionality. My only gripe is the availability of the private albums. I wish individual albums were linked to the corresponding message thread and profile. As it is now, one has to back out to the main screen to see albums and may have to scroll through many to find one sent in the past. Overall this is an awesome app.

title: Making straight guys envious
review:
I recently showed this app to a straight colleague and we briefly compared it to his apps for straight folk. He was blown away and a bit envious. 

The breadth of options for description in a profile, and the multiple search options were particularly impressive. (I'm not familiar with other apps, so I didn't know there was such a difference.) Also, I find the app to be quite reliable.

title: Good app
review: I've used this app for a couple of years. I like a few of the updates in this version; Placement of settings and color schemes / search features. Also like the venture although not all cities pop up even though I know some blokes there :)  it's been stable for me and I get my alerts. Using iPhone SE. I just use the annual plan. I feel I get more value out of using that than just the free version.  Thanks!

title: All those updates still not formated for iPhone 6 plus
review: 100k's to a few million people paying 60-99 a year. Half a dozen updates since iPhone 6 plus and u cant bother to update to support the graphics and the keyboard takes up half the screen. Oh and now you show hiv pill ads even though I pay to not show ads supposedly  It's so trashy I can't deal.  If I could give half a star I would.  So much you have right but it's that kind of thing that shows you could care less. Apple is a 760 billion company now.  If you think they will miss u if they ban this crap along with grindr and tindr ur so wrong. Glorified GPS disease spreading. Ur the Marlboro of the 2010s

title: Don't update to 4.0!
review:
I'm getting so mad at app developers who extoll the virtues of their updates,  only to find they've taken away key features I've come to love!  Scruff, sadly, is no different.  I used to have access to all pics in a guy's private album.  Now I'm restricted to only 3.  Kind of silly & petty guys since even non-paying members can share an unlimited number of pics via Scruff chat!
So I decided to write this negative review.  But then I encountered another surprise--this review page was pre-populated with a 5-star, positive review!    So I had to delete it before starting this one.  Really Scruff?
Don't update to 4.0.  You'll lose features you love.

title: Great app, many features
review: Grids load fast, I like being able to have more than 1 picture (in my private album), and the push notifications are a bonus. But the best feature by far is the Scruff Insights rating, where the app keeps track of how often you respond to others or how “stuck-up” you are. Saves me from wasting my time with guys who don’t know how to communicate.

title: Skip going to Bars ! Use Scruff!!
review: Great way to meet local men in your area without needing to leave your house ! Weed thru the hundreds of men quickly and safely. No need to waste time on guys that you have zero interest. Allows you to focus on men that spark your interest. Once I've gotten to know someone via chatting I decide when to meet them in person. It's been working out great now for a few years ! Thanks Scruff !!!

title: Cool App
review: Overall great app. I would rate it at 5 stars, but the upgrade prices are seriously way too high; especially for the overall nature of the app (guys it's not that serious) Not only are the prices ridiculous but notice it's pricES and not price). Features are broken down into individually priced upgrades so that the user is paying too much money for basic features that should be included with a one-time reasonable priced upgrade fee (yes I hate to compare the two, but just like grindr does). Like I said cool app probably better than grindr.

title: Decent but not great
review:
I can say it's better than Grindr but that's not saying much. Free vs. paid version features are horrible. I've been flagged for inappropriate profile content on a blank profile and techs claimed it was for an email to an account I don't have. It made no sense!! It will suffice until the next better thing surfaces. 

P.S. It's is RIDICULOUS that you waste time deleting one message at a time. With the other amount of garbage on this app you think that could at least be one feature that was available (although it probably would cost you as well).

title: Used to be great! 😒
review: I used to have this app. when it first came out and it was AMAZING. Unfortunitly like most apps they want more money so now you have to pay a rediculous monthly fee to use SIMPLE features like scrolling back through a conversation. Also the server is always down so half the time it doesn't work correctly. The developers might want to have a solid working app. before they charge us for basic features. I mainly use Grindr Xtra now. At least their fee is much less and I feel like its worth it. It also works all the time.

title: Community First
review: Of all the dating apps, I like Scruff the best for its design and features, especially for free users.   The success of such App's depends on the number of people who use it, so paid or not, the more active users, the more chances of meeting a match. BI also really like and have to commend Scruff for its community mindedness for offering lgbt orgs free space to advertise.  This further helps build community and awareness on important topics of concern to to its users.

title: Great app, great people.
review: This app is fantastic I love it! On a technical basis, I think it could be slightly better in so far as being able to send your location in a map like the competition, and saving saved phrases. Both of those features are distinctively missing from the website. Other than that this site trumps all of the other apps for hook up anywhere online. Kudos

title: Here today gone tomorrow!
review: When I first started using scruff I thought what a great app that would bring everyone together in the bear community. However it seems as the popularity grew the original intent was flushed down the toilet. I am usually quick to buy apps but would rather give the money to a homeless person. I mean really at $9 a month that's just over $100 a year sounds pretty crazy. However as another person put it when you see the creators of this app at all the bear events that must cost money. Its also clear that Mr Johnny Scruff who isn't even a bear knows nothing about the bear community and should just stick with the twinks.

title: Great app for the more scruffy crowd.
review: I actually prefer this app over grindr. The profiles are more detailed which is nice. You can save multiple photos on your profile without paying. It sends push notifications and you don't have to pay extra. Yes this app or for scruffy guys and the guys that like them, but anyone can go on here. I also like the woof and "would you meet" features. You can also see who viewed your profile recently.

title: The best Gay Dating app!
review:
Of the many apps I've installed and uninstalled over the years, Scruff is by far the best and not just because of facial hair...
It is stable, looks great, offers lots of tools and in Scruff Pro, even more tools like Insights which displays the persons telematics of the demographic they respond to most by age, level of body hair, community preferences, etc, so you don't waste your time chasing what will likely never be. It's awesome. Thanks Scruff!

title: Scruff is so much better than Grindr
review: I have to say that Scruff is superior to Grindr is every way.  The design and features are cleaner and more advances.  The programming and server capacity lead to a faster loading and much less buggy experience. And the guys are nicer and more interested in actually meeting than just posing.  Gay and want a mobile "social" app?  Then forget Big Brother Grindr And join me on Scruff.

title: Thanks Scruff!
review: I have multiple sclerosis and In March I was in the hospital for a week. I was over 100 miles from home and pretty lonely. I opened scruff to chat with fellow bears and met a wonderful bear in the process. We went on a date once I was out and things took off from there. Now we are looking forward to spending the rest of our lives together. Thank you Scruff!

title: The Ads are Sad
review:
I get that you need to make money, but seriously, this app has only been out for a couple weeks and now it has ads blazing across the top where it is really easy to accidentally select the ad instead of the navigation buttons. Maybe this is intentional so that the developers get more money from clicks? In any case, it's quite sad. In addition, the ads change with a flip-like animation that screams "look, look, I'm an ad, here to annoy you and ruin your experience..." Again more sadness.

It WAS a cool app. Now it's just sad.

title: More is less...
review:
More functionality and features than all other apps of its ilk! And that's just tip!!! After you go for the full package, it's over, done, no need to look or try elsewhere! You can scour the entire planet and plan your orgies, hook up, dinner plans, parties and more more more! Scruff just doesn't stop with how much more it has in its pants. All men need to use this app. Even straight guys! For a plethora of reasons. 

*woof* 
*WOOF*

title: Great App
review: I'm surprised by all of the negative reviews...I surmise that many of such reviews come from those with phones the equivalent of fossils that can't keep up with the updates. Wayyy better than grindr and love the swipe/match feature! I do think the price is leaning towards absurd and programmers should realize that by limiting features and user friendliness for non-pro users they are shrinking their client base and therefore the amount of hotties I can chat with 😞

title: Best community
review: Yes, we are all looking for sex and excitement with these apps. But I like this one for the normal ness, here I am born this way attitude of the guys using it. Either you click with someone or not and that seems to be the accepted truth on Scruff. Other apps come with attitude and baggage associated with the apps demographic or target market which tends to foster that unworthiness low self-esteem feeling that I thought most of us had finally gotten over.

title: Great For Checking Out Locals But Could Use Some TouchUps
review:
Fun thing about this app is there are plenty of cute neighborhood guys to chat with - and the interface is great. Would love to see a better control of active messages - perhaps the ability to sort them into folders based on global guy locations. Also would love a keyword search to have conversations with guys based off common interests. Love love love this app in that it doesn't feel too flesh based and it's nice to have real conversations with guys every now and then.

DXdLM

title: Question
review: I have loved this app and have a great international network of friends. Unfortunately, the recent upgrade causes it to crash and I have not been able to launch this app for several days. Come on Scruff, fix this immediately. You should be asshamed that your technical people allowed this to happen. Look at the recent reviews! There's a problem!

title: Hate the new version
review: I didn't have any problem at all with the original version. I can't stand a single thing about the new version. The text is so large that you have to keep scrolling just to read a few sentences. When I go to sign off I have to confirm that I want to sign off with two pop-up windows. Is this necessary? It's confusing. Not user-friendly. And I like that the black screen before was discreet. All the flashing red on the street is like a big advertisement that I'm on scruff no matter where I am. I could keep going but it's probably pointless cause I doubt they'll change it back

title: Ruined a good thing
review:
Scruff was the best gay connection app out there. Intuitive, easy to use and to navigate. And it seemed to attract the nicest guys. 

The nice guys are still there, I'm sure but finding them has become a confounding, frustrating experience in the new version. You used to easily be able to search in other locations.  No more. It is possible, but not at all intuitive. 

Messages and woofs are partitioned by days and weeks rather than simply displayed in a chronologically ordered grid. 

If you add a filter, one aspect of that filter (e.g., jocks) is displayed adjacent at the top so it reads "global, nearby, jocks" so you cannot tell if all or part of your filter is being applied. 

I could go on but to suffice it to say the user experience is now almost unbearable (hehe). 

Never thought they could make Grindr look good, but they did. This is the IOS9 of Scruff updates. Horrendous. All the more horrendous because Scruff worked so well before.

title: Not great for dating but excellent for friends and pen pals
review: I live in a smallish city so the dating pool is very stable and small. I've made some great friends, had a few fun dates through Scruff but the greatest value is meeting all kinds of men around the nation and globe. The app's features are always improving and make it easy to connect without anything being clunky or unnecessary. The new stats feature is really cool for nerds like me.

title: Great app!
review: Finally! An app that is targeted towards my demographic! Bears and leather community. Yes, it is extra work to have to go through a person's profile in order to get to their message they sent to you. I am confident that they will fine tune this app with all of us suggesting the same inprovement. A friend of mine told me about this app. I was tired of seeing all the twinks that are in abundance on Grindr! I'm happy that this app was recommended to me!

title: Wish it could be more specific to the U.S.
review: I am a paying member and prefer this app over all others available. However, I find the global aspect to be fairly pointless. Being able to see guys from 9000 plus miles away really worthless. Having the "most" woofed is a great feature if it weren't filled with fake Adonis like profiles. I used to love this app and even as a fully paid member am finding less interest in using it. If it continues in this direction I won't be re-subscribing.

title: The last app standing
review: Despite the apps leaning toward the hairy, stocky guys, or bears,etc, I still have this one after deleting all the others. I am open to all kinds of guys. I can find a lot of different guys despite the "Scruff" characterization of the app. A bad experience with unstable guys and general dissatisfaction eliminated all other apps. Scruff is the last app standing. It serves it purpose more than adequate . Thanks

title: Snotty, snarky, unhelpful tech support / customer service
review: When something goes wrong technically (as it often does), try to ask other members for help, or look it up online. To e-mail tech support is to embark on a misadventure in rudeness. It's amazing the snark they get away with when you try to politely ask for assistance in fixing a problem (as a paying customer!) The tech support agent most recently refused to answer my question about renewing my paid subscription, which had been terminated due to a glitch (on Scruff's end). As a result, I think I just won't renew. I can't stomach paying his salary and the salaries of those like him.

title: Entertaining.....
review: I have chatted with done really nice guys all over the world. However, the local population shown for those of us who can't and won't pay for this service is not only curious but questionable at best. There is no follow up on reporting people and from what I can tell no need to do with the ease of creating a different profile and getting back online. To bad there is no way to have a freak/flake folder so we can help each other out when trying to make new friends or otherwise.

title: Great App!
review: I love the app and I love the community! Everybody is so friendly and welcoming. The only thing I dislike about the app is that there are too many features that are "membership only." If you have a long chat with somebody, it is all lost because you can only see the last 20 messages or so.  However, that is a small detail - this app is great! Compared with the rest of the gay dating/hookup apps, this one is definitely the best!

title: Not thrilled
review: Haven't met a guy from here yet. Too many guys on here take too long to respond. I haven't got all day. It's like sitting in back of a bus in traffic. You want to move on. Seconds feel like minutes. It's the same here only minutes seem like hours. Also the guys that are close by and on scruff are scattered within all the guys close and away from scruff. Like it really matters no ones going to respond very quickly anyway. Overall I give it 2 1/2 stars. Guys are guys and the best web site is not going to change the way they behave.

title: Good app but needs more versatility
review: This is a good app, but needs to be able to scroll from profile to profile instead of having to go back to the main page between each profile. Also, it won't hold my pics I use regularly...it might as well remove that heading because it meet has in the last four or five updates. It used to a long time ago.

title: The best!
review:
I like Internet sites the best but for cell apps"Scruff" is the best out of them all!   I have used a site that gets more hits but I've met more men off Scruff. 
I also believe Scruff is more user friendly and yeah I'm one of those guys who like the woof feature!  I have also met two guys in person who used the woof feature before the chat feature.

title: Changed for the worse
review:
I can't complain too loudly about a (mostly) free app and service, and I don't begrudge the developers for wanting to make money, but…

The new "feature" that makes me retype my email and password every time I want to log on is really annoying. I'm guessing they either want you to stay logged on all the time, or this was an oversight that will be fixed in the next update. I hope it's the latter.

The paid upgrades cost more than they are worth.

title: Better than Grindr!!
review: Love this app.  It seems as of late that grinder Which is supposed to be a gay male hookup site,  Has more and more people on there that just  want to talk.   With scruff at least you have more available areas for your profile and your desires So it's easier to find out if someone wants to hook up or not.   Not to mention the men on scruff are just more manly.  One of my favorite apps.

title: Best of the bunch
review: The five star rating is in comparison to its peer group and that I live in DC. Compared to Grindr and Jack'd this is the superior app. It's more reliable than Jack'd and doesn't nickel and dime you like Grindr does. You get more features for free than Grindr. And while you'll see many of the same guys using all three apps there does seem to be more guys that use this overall. At least in the DC area.

title: Great app - well developed
review:
The best gay chat app out there, in my opinion. Very stable, no major or obvious bugs, and let's you do quite a bit with the free version. Also very impressed with the statistics feature for user interests. Requires hook up, but that's the fun part :P. 

Only downside is the limitation for free version users, but think I'll upgrade since the developers definitely deserve the money.

title: Best Site yet!
review:
The quality of the men on the site is impeccable.  The selection is also much greater in number in all areas (I travel throughout four states). 

The profile descriptions on Scruff are thorough enough that, if you read them, you can easily determine how good of a match the member might be.  

The site is dynamic as you can send "Woofs" to other members to let them know that you are out there and interested.  And I'm surprised that most respond with at least a thank you.  

Private gallery allows for video upload and even offers categories for your public pics.  

Whether a hookup or something more serious, Scruff will have what you are looking for

title: The S Latino
review: This app is good, I love using it and I know many guys rating it less starts likes it too, just some black out once in a while when texting but all apps have some issues. I like how you can have your album and save xxx pics there so don't need to have them on your phone if you are discreet like me. You'll like it the app, is addictive sometimes, hehe

title: Great app, great people!
review: I love being able to meet people from all over the world, just when you think everyone is just alike and that you know all the gays in your community, you can always branch out and meet new ones from all over, and it's wonderfully surprising how great many of them are! The app works terrific as well, and the Pro features are worth it.

title: Nah
review: So I'm purely writing this and rating the app (again) because it's the only way to get back into the app. (I say again cuz I just wrote this and got kicked out because my name had already been taken.) The "give us 5 stars" box is there when I try to open the app and will NOT go away, even when I tap the corner "X out" button (which is non responsive) or I try the "no thanks" option (which also doesn't respond). So I'm forced in here against my will.  I could usually get into that sort of thing, but not right now. Makes me wanna delete the app altogether. There you go scruff. You're welcome.

title: Woof!
review: By far the best gay social app out. Especially since Grindr did their "upgrade" that kinda messed up the app. I like that there are tons of options from woofing to let a guy know u r interested, to checking out who viewed u. Also u have a lot more space and options to talk about yourself and your interests. Def recommend it, u don't have to have a scruffy face, but it helps ;)

title: Woof!
review: Love the app! Lots of guys to talk with. I just don't understand though why in the message section, in order to erase a person from it you have to block them. Just because I don't talk with them at this time doesn't mean that I might not want to again. There should be an option to just delete them from messages instead of blocking.

title: It is a new world out there
review: The thing that puts this app above grindr is the woof and the ability to see who has checked you out. Woof is a cool quick way to express interest or attraction. And knowing who has view me lets me know they at least have me a thought. Thanks guys for making my life just a little more interesting.

title: latest update was a poor move
review:
I like scruff until this latest update. The features you pay for are way too expensive. I get the same thing from Grindr. Plus you have to pay even more to send retina images. $10+ a month is not a fair price. Plus they took features away that were previously free (i've not blocked too many people). I even wondering if paying for a feature gets rid of the ads? 

I would no longer recommend this app for this reason. Scruff gets one star today.

Additionally, this app is far too complicated! I like simplicity of Grindr.

title: Love it
review: Works well, don't mind fees since nothing in this world is free, would love to pay to get rid of ads too. Also like that it is ONLY for iPhone now. Keeps guys who cannot make good phone choices from being online. Really makes a difference. Had other app full of lousy flakes because it is now on lots if devices. Plus only stuff attracts lower quality guys

title: I love it!
review: The program works great, and the support team is on top of things. I kinda wish you could search individual people, but I can see why they'd keep that feature out. Overall it seems reliable and I was even able to smoothly retrieve my old profile when switching iPods

title: Awful update!
review: This app WAS light years better than Grindr.  The guys are hotter that has not changed. However the NEWEST update layout and the fact that the app keeps crashing are Signs for its future! I am hoping that there will be an update that will fix these things. But if it follows in the footsteps of Grindr... Or keeps going this route the app is done!

title: Want guys who amount to something more than just a headless naked torso?
review: ...then Scruff is the app for you! Scruff guys are sexier, more interesting, and have far more substance than the vapid, vacant, superficial guys on Grindr. I am, of course, spouting unfair generalizations about those Grindr boys and their collective love for all things Gaga, but I quite enjoy wading through the selection of men on Scruff who amount to far more than just a pretty face.

title: Gross
review: I created a profile and was able to chat with a few nice guys but my account was eventually deleted because a gun was visible in my picture - even though there is nothing against this in their guidelines. I am proud of my military service and it upsets me that I can't show myself in uniform because there is a gun by my side while there are countless headless profile pics of men with their hands down their briefs. Being a responsible gun owner defending our country? Bad. Anonymous men with deadly STD virus looking for a "pig" to top him while his "partner" watches? Well, that's just harmless fun. Pretty disgusting app anyways, I'll stick with OKCupid.

title: Best Social Network!!!
review: So I really don't understand the bad reviews. This is by far the beat social app with most free features. The community is amazing and Scruff has literally tapped into a community that no one else has before. I'm sticking my loyalty to Scruff and all of it's wonderful scruffers. All the scruffy masculine men and great conversations to have. Thank you Scruff team for such an amazing app and keep up the great work!

title: So far, so good.
review:
UPDATE: had problem getting app to start as well. Worked for few hours. Solution was to delete and install again. All my profile settings remained. Things working great again!

I see this is a new app and off to a great start. As others mention, a few refinements will be nice for future releases. Otherwise an excellent alternative to Grindr for my needs. Love it.

title: Update is a failure
review: I used to like this app - I've made a ton of friends across North America as a result of it. Like others have said, greed has taken over and now it's basically forced you to subscribe to pro. I have better things to spend $15 a month on than this app just to be able to have the functionality I once had when it was free. Wished I hadn't updated. The layout is good but if greed is what you're after... You won't have users before long. If people can't see the value in the non paid version, what's to get them to buy the pro version?

title: Perfect
review: I very rarely can give a true five star rating. I honestly have no complaints about this app. I do find that the guys are very high-quality for the most part on here. A lot of people you can tell are actually people you would want to be just friends with. Of course if you're looking for something else, there is that too.

title: Good app with some clear flaws
review: First let it be said that Scruff is among the best gay apps out there for meeting other gay guys. It has remedied its worst flaws but even if you set the filters to show those online right now, it still shows guys who aren't online for up to an hour. This messes up who you are really able to chat with. Other than that, it's a great app.

title: An app with no artitude
review: I never thought I could say an application could have no attitude but that's how I see it.    Besises than that, I really enjoy the 'Viewers" section and the On line side where I can get to chat with guys from all over the world; giving me a break from the same people who are always on line in my area. Thanks guys!

title: Make friends worldwide!!!
review: I travel often, and this app has allowed me to make friends all over the world. It's fun to chat with someone in a different country and then later actually meet them. A great way to expand your circle of friends if you travel often or you are not into the club or bar scene.

title: Best Of Gay Apps
review:
This app has always been under rated yet it's one of the greatest the App Store has to offer.

Scruff lacks the attitude, obtrusive ads & the bots on Grindr yet offers more free features & reasonable upgrade features. Although the upgrade price is a bit... pricy.

Unlike Grindr being one of the oldest in the gay app game has given the maker of Scruff the experience to continually make a Gr8 app better with every incarnation leaving little to be desired.

title: Cool but global is stupid
review: It's better than all other apps of this nature but the one dumb thing is that it gives you this global grid. Why do I care about the porn stars in NYC and San Fran? Well I do care actually but not in the context of a hookup app. That's really my only complaint that the grid should default to local because that's the whole point of the app. Don't try and trick me with distant strange! Either way it's the app to have.

title: Amazing
review: This is the only site that I will pay for a membership to see all of everything. The extras are totally worth the $$$. I love the app and how much better it is than all the others!  The guys are so much make my type here and are really down to earth. I also love the "insights and match" features. It makes finding the right WOOF in such a thick forest.

title: Great app comparatively
review: Compared to other social networking apps, this one is by far the best. While there has been some Twink and muscle jock creep into the app locally, most of the guys are still scruffy, bearish, masculine man. Using the pro version, and have no problems with speed, access, crashes, etc.  Would definitely recommend this app to guys who are into scruffy man.

title: Still not impressed
review:
The paid options are still overpriced. I'd really liked to have supported the guys behind this app but I felt like the first paid offerings were a little greedy. If there was a combo pack at around 5 a month for the lot, I'd probably pay it but as it stands, almost 10 a month plus extra for credits for sending hi res pics is outrageous. So for now I'll keep using the app, but they won't see a dime. Sad. 

Also enough trying to make Jonny Scruff a celebrity already.

title: Matching Feature
review: Each profile allows you to indicate whether you're interested or not. It says they'll let you know if there's a mutual interest. But unless you go to the Match feature routinely, there's no way for you to know whether a match has been made. Would be nice if they send you an alert when that happens. Maybe it's a Pro feature; if that's the case then happy endings are only meant for people who can afford their rates.

title: 10x Better than Grindr
review: Scruff is way better than all the other gay apps. I used to like the cheaper price better back in the day... But I understand that with all the features it has, it justifies the price. You get way more info, more customizable options, and so many photo options. And I actually met the love of my life on scruff. 😍

title: Great app
review:
Ignore the fact it says scruff if you're considering not getting this app because you're not a bear. This apps
Interface and stability are far superior to that of similar applications, and its community will transcend your preconceived notions, I assure you. Simply put, it's fantastic, especially if you subscribe to the paid version. At least give it a shot.

title: Always trying to get you to pay for pro version
review: This app is okay, but they are constantly limiting functions in order to get you to pay for the rather overpriced pro version. In the last update, they now automatically clear conversations from a few days ago, so now there is no way to keep track of what has been said. It's so annoying to install an update when all the update is going to do is limit functionality and not improve performance.

title: Great Features, Better People
review: This app blows the competition away! And by sponsoring social events in many cities, it has created a community of guys who are really fun in the real world. One request: a 'you woofed at this guy X days ago' feature. Sometimes guys change their photos and then get back to you. Please?

title: Awesome
review: So much better than Grindr. Love that you can do searches according to filters, including location.  Love the travel feature.  Love the private album feature, though don't like the limits on it- doesn't make sense since you can just send pics in messages. Great app overall. Makes it easy and fun to meet new people.

title: John in DC's Review of Scruff
review: I enjoy Scruff more than other apps. I've tried traditional dating sites but I realized that it's the same guys everywhere.  Scruff has more features and a more diverse selection of guys. I've met up with a few, some for play and some to date. I've actually made a couple of good friends on Scruff. I'm very pleased with the app more than others.

title: The online gay social sexualizing app for grown ups
review: Let's face it, online hookup apps are transactional, juvenile, demeaning, soul-sucking, unimaginative, alienating, self-defeating, and banal. They are also ruthlessly efficient, and occasionally yield mindblowingly intense real-world exchanges. This app has a solid UI, stable build, reliable UX, and a fairly cohesive offering of premium features at a modest price. Moreover, the guys are hot, and bless them, they seem to fancy me.  Woof.

title: App loosing functionality
review: This used to be a great app but little by little features were downgraded or eliminated. The chat record gets shorter and the record of woofs and people you have chatted with shrinks. Pretty soon Grindr will be the better option. I would be willing to pay a readable amount for the app, but since they are selling advertising against a rather deep amount of demographic data, we should not have to pay and give away data. But given network effects if Anouilh people rebel they have no more market. At this point they are beginning to kill the golden goose...

title: Loooove this app
review: This app is amazing, I've been chatting with almost thirty guys, even though I only met two guys. I can't believe my luck as to how many guys I've gotten to know. Scruff is not just a gay chat site, it's some kind of community as well but I have not been able to since up for the other opportunities and events it offers, I enjoy all of the hot guys I get to look at too.

title: Used to be a great app
review:
Now they charge you for everything.  And, I mean EVERYTHING.  Want to see yesterday's messages?  Have to pay.  Want to see guys closeby?  Have to pay.  And it isn't a one-time fee, no, no, it's a monthly subscription--FOR EACH FEATURE. 

Vote with your dollars, and don't waste your money on this app.  It isn't worth it.  Get Jacked, it's way better and still FREE.

title: Not as good as it used to be
review: A lot of "alternative" type guys use Scruff but now that you have to pay to get certain basic features back it has lost its appeal. It doesn't even block guys right anymore. I've hit block on several profiles but they're still visible. Even if the features were fantastic and worked properly, the pricing structure is baffling. How disappointing.

title: Finally an app for edgier men
review: Scruff features some of the hottest men around as opposed to the fully shaven boys of Grindr.  It's far hotter to see and interact with real men with body hair and less than perfect bodies, than shallow gymrats who spend every minute trying to look like a porn star.   Though, sometimes I wish you could search based on characteristics rather than only who's 'x' feet away.

title: 👎 not good
review:
Even if there are some new nice features available u only get them when you pay full!! Think of that - you have to pay of you want to change the Age filter (or search). Very bad move. Almost every change is now only available for PRO paying members. I switch back to the yellow if they don't change a few things in 5.1. Guys don't do that! You earn enough money with ads!!!

Unglaublich Überlegt euch gut das Update zu installieren! Ab sofort musst du für fast jede Änderung einer Einstellung PRO Mitglied sein, selbst die Alters Suche: jetzt nur noch für PRO Mitglieder, du kannst die Altersgruppe nicht mehr ändern - ohne zu bezahlen! Total beschränkte Idee Leute ändert das!

title: Even more features hidden behind paywall
review: This is getting really annoying: now more and more features are getting pushed behind a paywall and no longer available to the rest of us (ex: saving pics sent to me). I understand you want to make some $, but you're making the app unusable unless we pay. I'd rather you charge a $10 flat fee and give me a bunch of basic features you won't take away in the future because I refuse to sign up for your exorbitant recurring payment.

title: WAY better than Grindr
review:
Thanks for the regular updates and new features! Much appreciated, I opted for the Pro upgrades to support the developers. Highly recommended, though not at all necessary.

A bug in the latest version: tool tips for the various parts of the app continue to show up again and again, even for features that have already been explained. Please fix!

title: Awesome app!!! What would I do without it???
review: Fan-tastic. Fun for the hole family. Cept. Now I feel like I'm bribing people to hook up. The apps pro features have swelled to ridiculous prices. Soon this app will have to fall under laws that govern brothels out of Las Vegas. Seriously guys, I love ya but your going to lose my financial support soon if it keeps going up in price. If you haven't seen a loss yet, be careful.

title: Much better than Grindr
review: Nicer and better quality guys. They'd get 5 stars if they set the bar more friends in the free so u don't lose chat trails so quickly and had the ability to browse past conversations further back. I don't mind them charging but to get these fairly simple features u have to pay two monthly fees that total $9/month

title: Great, but always room for Improvement.
review: I enjoy this app more than any other of its kind. To make favorites more organized and searches more specific would improve the flow. Additionally, perhaps eliminating certain types of people/relationships from your default finds such as eliminating me out of searches for people who don't like couples.

title: Horrible update!!!
review: Get a good user base and then ruin it with greed! The new interface if terrible and the whole app in general is just bloated. No one wants an "Scruff store" and events and all the extra garbage that is being added. And then charging insane amounts to browse and have message history is absurd, thats the whole purpose of the app. One time charge is understandable but a monthly fee???  LOL Just say no to monthly fees! One time fee, sure. But this is a app for a phone, it's not that serious. The reason why the app became popular is because of what it USED to be. It is no longer the same app.

title: Highway robbery
review:
$4.99/month to enhance the messaging capabilities of Scruff. $3.99/month to improve the ability to browse for guys.

Really? You expect us to pay $8.98 a MONTH just for the extra features? It would have been okay if it was a one-time payment, but forget it. Grindr is a bargain compared to this. Also, I'm seriously put off by the constant messages nagging me to purchase the premium features. Maybe other people are more willing to pay such a premium, but I can get everything Scruff offers for free with Growlr which is gaining popularity.

Sorry, I'm not taking the bait.

title: Grrr8 App
review: I've been using this app for the past 6 years and it has always been my favorite.  The app is well designed, which results in a clean user interface, ease of use, and good, reliable performance.  Then there are the hot friendly men.  I can always expect at least one friendly man to chat with whenever I login.

title: User
review: It's an amazing app, it lets you search by city and zip codes which is an option not available in other popular apps. I find that men are normally more mature which means less beating about the bush when arranging a hook up. At least it's been my experience and other members I've talked to agree.

title: Slow, overpriced and its a shame
review: Still a good selection of "real" guys but there's been an influx of twinks and sugar-babies. Hopefully they're temporary. Scruff's "premiums" are overpriced for what addl content is delivered; I'll be discontinuing my subscription when it expires. If they were $3 or so I'd likely continue, they are nice features to have, but not at 3 times that price. And the update doesn't work as well - in fact, its slower and less stable than ever. It's still better than Grindr- but that's damned faint praise. Jackd is the best of the gay social apps.

title: Get over it soon but..
review:
Locked picture sharing was an awesome idea before however it's become more of a hassle now that you've blocks pictures from being scene. I get I can resend the pictures instead of the album but really don't have an album for non paid users if we have limits. If we choose to share then that's our choice. That feature is lame. 

Other than that I enjoy this app and it works pretty well for me.

title: About middle of the road...
review: It's an average app. Definitely not battery efficient. Also, after upgrading from Version 2.something to Version 3.something, the subscription kept on being billed at the PREVIOUS message pro rate, yet the app was not receiving/acknowledging the latest (combined browsing and messaging) "pro" subsciption or features. That specific detail was not mentioned on the latest "update available" documentation. Upgraders AND subscribers BEWARE.

title: Extremely limited free functionality
review:
1) lots of cute scruffy men, but unless you are bears they probably won't be interested in talking to you. The guys seems to only attracted to the same type of men. They are pretty to look at nonetheless. 
2) I love how they show random people from around the world where I ended up chatting with instead of the locals. It is also sad in a way that people who interested in talking to you live at least 200 mi away. 
3) Event pane show only paid advertisement instead of all social event.

title: Great for shallow hookups
review: This app honestly is one of the better ones functionally.  It has a lot of cool features.  But more than half are partnered guys and most of the rest just want to hookup.  Don't bother saying you want to "Date" cuz it'll be ignored and when you turn down "Looking?" messages you get nasty replies. Most don't even reply to a hello or compliment.  Easy for gay scene shallowness.  And the Match feature is a sham showing partnered guys and guys from 5000 miles away. "Match"?  Really?  Not worth subscribing to so don't waste your money.

title: Plenty of other options
review: Scruff was once a great app but now without paying a subscription you can only see your 16 most recent conversations, there are limits to the number of people you can block, which combined with the limit on how many people you can see and no filtering means you will be stuck with the same people in your nearby view. Like others have said, I don't mind paying for a good app, but requiring two monthly subscriptions for basic functionality is a bit much. Growlr and other apps that aren't as restrictive are the way to go.

title: You'll use it for fun
review: It's 2016 & you know these apps exist. I'll wager all of us do. So if you wanna use the net to hunt for hotties, why not use one created by some of the brightest and sexiest techies who love men like you do? It's a tight rope, if your prone to compulsive sex-seeking, so just take it slow to start. All and all, you can find yourself a connection you never dreamed of. Just ask that guy who snagged the Adonis in the nearby section with an emoji.

title: You're App, act like one
review: This is an App, not a full hook-up site and so has none of the functionality of sites like Recon and is severely restricted with regards to sexual content yet the Premium features are priced comparably to those other sites. The Scruff guys should own their 'App-ness' and price the Premium features at $0.99 - what ever monies they'd loose in loweing the price, they'd more than make up with in the volumne of guys signed up for those features

title: Two different paid options?
review:
I don't understand why they charge separately for two separate sets of features. I have not problem paying one low price for added features if it's for good features for a good app, but the two different subscription options for separate features with no overlap is garbage. 

There are other apps with more features that aren't seemingly greedy.

title: It's a good app but..
review:
There is a big bug!
When I added some person to favorite, It actually not added anymore. Even if I pressed the REFRESH burton 'NOTHING CHANGED' (It absolutely not working at all!!!). But I can cancel a favorite and I can see it disappeared in the favorite list. So that means I only can erase someone in my favorite list, I can add someone favorite list, BUT i can't see and check that guy in the favorite list!!!! What a big bug!!!

title: Stumbled across this app
review: I stumbled across this app searching for apps I saw it and downloaded it immediately... I am in love our community has been waiting so long for an app like this and I can't wait to tell my friends about it!  It's seems to be growing really fast for just being released!

title: Low quality
review: This seems to be an app where the heavy and less attractive congregate. I have also had multiple encounters where the terms in their user agreement are defined by the ignorant, rather than a standard dictionary (such as Webster's or Black's Legal) definition. The only way to find out about their inconsistent definitions, is to use the app until, eventually your account will be frozen, and only after multiple emails are you able to find out that its a non-conventional definition of a word in their EUA that has made all the trouble for you.

title: Good!
review:
Has been a long time since I found and app I play with *too* much, this is one such one!

Some contol buttons could use different positioning, but it's fun. Latest fix made more stable but took away browsing for new people, that was my favorite part--snare 'em when they first come in. 

Thanks for making it a little easier to be a dirty old man. ^_*

title: Getting better and better
review: Scruff is on an upward climb towards being great. The app could do better in the match stacks department especially when it's gives you options for guys based on your previous matches. Compared to Grindr scruff is still more dependable and all around more user friendly.

title: Update is not good
review: The new update is not user friendly anymore, you'll get lost in the app and have to just start over... Worst thing is you can't "clear conversation" without a user knowing.. So they think you are looking at them and all you want to do is clear the convo... Scruff please go back to the old version

title: Scruff is Awesome! Best app ever!
review: Scruff is soooo much better than Grindr! I love the woof feature and the fact that you can see who viewed you. The app is so easy to use and I get more messages on scruff that I ever do on grindr. And hey... Scruff's push feature actually works unlike grindr's unreliable one. Total scruff guy here and you should be too!

title: Crashes in IOS6 upon open
review: I love this app. It is much better than other apps out there, with many features absent in other apps. However since I updated my iPhone to IOS6, it crashes randomly, now instantly upon open. Before that it lost my pro subscription and started displaying ads. It's unusable at this point. I'm sure there is an update in the near future?

title: Extremely overpriced
review: This app is a prime example of how businesses take advantage of the gay community. They know there are not a ton of viable options, so they gouge your pocketbooks. Do they care that the far majority of the gay community lives below the poverty line? No. The app keeps updating and with every update, they hike the price and limit more and more access. They can only do this because people still support them. Im will not pay for this app and its an absolute ripoff. All the features and what the app essentially does, is crap that has been around for 10 years. Its a ripoff

title: Simply the best.
review:
When it comes to meeting bears, Cubs, wolves and other furry woodland gays- Scruff is simply the only choice. With Growlr's poor selection of men and underwhelming graphics and Grindr being filled with robots, creeps, and jerks: this is the only gay app for me. 

Personally I love this app so much I subscribed. I'm never one to pay for an app like this, but this app was 10,000% worth it. Happy hunting gentlemen!

title: Scruff Has The Stuff !!
review: Who wouldn't like this app?  I'm serious, it has everything I want - plenty of eye candy, great layout and functionality, diverse global membership and an easy to use local interface.  I've never had an issue nor can I think of anything I would want to change.  Scruff DOES have all the right stuff.  Adam P - Dallas TX

title: It's alright
review: Its nice to have but in an effort to be better than the competitors, it should allow you minimal access to the other menus. Example; checking in. You have to buy the app to check in or see where people checked in. You should be allowed a couple a day. I'm not gonna spend money on the app if I don't get to try it.

title: Wonderful App
review: I give this App 5 stars because I haven't had too many problems with it. I have been on scruff for about 6 months and the only technical glitch I have had on the scruff App not being able to send messages. Other than that the scruff App has a great design, better messaging, and pic upload.

title: Action packed 😈
review: I am a premium member with them . I like this AP a lot and use it regularly. I never have any issues the other queens are Biatching about 😈. I get quite a lot of real people who I connect with . Yes there are lots of talkers too but it's not the AP s fault. One GREAT thing about them is almost there is no Spam which is infested on the other gay chat aps .

title: Decent app, but separate pricing excessive.
review: It's too bad, it's not a bad app, but they ruin it by excessive pop ups trying to get you to upgrade, and then to upgrade, it's two different prices for two different things. Also more expensive then other comparable services. I really hope the developers listen to the comments, because it's not a bad app. I also WOULD be willing to pay something more realistic, and more streamlined into one, single charge.

title: Cool app but needs improvement
review: App is cool but is sometimes unstable. GPS location is sometimes WAY OFF - saying someone is much closer than they are (and never were that close). App crashes more than it should and messaging can be slow or delayed which is frustrating when ur trying to "close the deal".  But, compared to it's competition, it ranks much better than Grindr, Radar, Manhunt.

title: Best gay social app
review: This program has a nice interface and everything works 99.9% of the time. They're constantly improving it. And, unlike Grindr, this syncs seamlessly with my iPad (from my iPhone) so all the chats and settings etc flow back and forth between the two devices. Grindr will NOT sync chats. I highly recommend this app for your mainstay gay social app.

title: Just finding way
review: I have not used scruff much yet as it was difficult to figure out who had looked atmy profile for one example. I think it could be a great way to meet local guys....if there are any using this.  Now that I have used scruff for a while...it works better in some areas of the country, mostly because guys are not using in my home town area.

title: Scruff Review
review:
Dudes are Hott, never any problems with Scruffs server, messages received instantly, I have yet to experience any problem "receiving messages" on either the sender or receiver parties end like another gay social app I use.  Scruff has been great in every state I find a potential mate without debate.  

Scruff keeps my attention just enough to free my mind of the grind.  

Guy R.

title: Better
review: This app is well built, glitches every once and a while but technology does that and we all know and expect it from time to time.  Better caliber of guys on here than several other programs, especially computer based programs. Still they are just guys and guys will be guys.

title: Good App
review: Scruff is a very good app.  Not great but good.  My problem with it is the same as Grindr and Growlr; they don't require a picture.  Come on guys.  If you're using the app, you're most likely using a device with a camera!  There is no reason to not have a picture of you!   You need to be discrete?  So what!   Only other Gay men will see you so if your boss finds your profile, he's GAY too!

title: Good App Overall
review: Scruff is a good app overall and has enough member to make it worthwhile. The only complaint I have is the members show up as being online initially but when you access their profile you find out they've been offline for as long as a couple of hours. What a waste of my time and a great way to inflate the stats! This needs to be addressed.

title: Awesome
review: I enjoy SCRUFF cause it gives me that kid in a candy shop feeling!! The boys are usually friendly and will entertaining! :) No matter what your type is, if you're patient enough you will find it! The app is free unless you're willing to donate some $, but the free site is still good enough for everyone to have fun!!

title: Review
review:
My only dislike is that the chat history. There isn't one. You can't go back and review or look at previous comments or pictures sent.

Allow the user to go to Messages without having to pull up the profile first.

title: Pay for every feature!
review:
Not only is this app inundated with bland stuck up bear clones looking for a mirror to hook up with they purse you on every detail. I'm sure they have had meeting after meeting to find out what the best level of price point is to get the most out of their users.
     Throw in enough black to make a funeral home look bright and cheery as well as enough name dropping "SCRUFF SCRUFF SCRUFF" all over this product so you think a street artiest had a taggasm and ya it pay dirt! 
     Sad, uninspired and spreading the worse of gay culture! Great way to know who in the area to avoid!

title: What happened to scruff?!
review: Scruff was once my go to app. Loved the way it worked and the type of guys on their. Now though with the new update I think it's gotten really bad. It's slower, clunkier and in quite a few places less useful. Beyond that the global grids are kinda getting ridiculous. You've got guys straight up grabbing their crotch on there that scruff advertises but if you have your hand remotely near your crotch in your own photo and the person who reviews it doesn't like it it gets removed and your profile gets disabled. Yeah this is the new scruff

title: Great Connections
review: Great connections are possible with Scruff because people can share enough to assure oneself that the person is real and not a stalker. I feel that this app does justice to networking and making new friendships. It is by far the best app compared to others I have used and no longer use. I only use Scruff now.
developerResponse: {'id': 214311, 'body': "Thanks for your comments! We're happy to hear that you're enjoying SCRUFF. Valued members like you make the SCRUFF community as great as it is. WOOF!", 'modified': '2017-04-25T16:53:06Z'}

title: Mixed....
review: Have met a few "quality" guys on this...   But, premium version is too darn expensive.   The most recent service update has made a better ratio of features to price.  I signed for a month of "scruff pro" but will cancel...   Its not like the extra $$$ gets me anything more, considering what we use this app for.  Lastly, please stop telling us what Johnny Scruff is up to ... And stop reminding us what your income gets you .... To travel.   Am not impressed.

title: Great app, no bots.
review: Compared to other apps in this category, none are as well featured as Scruff. It seems actual people are working on this app to make it better, unlike Grindr. The new version did take a little getting used to, but I like it. It's cleanly put together and can be used discreetly, even in a low light environment.

title: Not to bad
review: Scruff has been improving their app. Much easier to guide and short-cuts are nice. Long Tap onto user's profile to go directly to conversation is much needed and bonus feature. One thing they should stop locking down on some features. It's frustrating to only view so many people in your area and the rest locked. Unlock some of the added features, not willing to pay for the app.

title: Love this app
review: I love this app and have had it for years.  The one thing they could add to it to make it better is to have a distance search added in.  Something like 1mi-250mi.  And when that is on it only shows people within that distance.  That'd make this app 100 times better.

title: Fantastic
review: It's true that Scruff Pro (a software-as-service scheme, i.e. Subscription-based) is much too expensive and has most of the useful tools, and it's true that the global grid is useless, but...the free version is still amazing. After trying Grindr, which was a total disaster, I'm sold. The guys here really are much higher quality.

title: From first to worst
review:
Lucky my subscription was almost up. I won't be renewing. Easily one of the more tone-deaf software updates I've seen. That's what happens when you listen to consultants over customers. Took away features that worked well and replaced with a bunch of stuff no one wanted. I mean, does anyone care about most-woofed aside from the most-woofed? And all of those arbitrary screen dividers for time and distance? Terrible and disappointing. 

From the reviews it looks like you're losing a lot of users. Was it worth it?

title: Malfunction
review: I downloaded this app early June of last year, however my profile was shortly revoked because (even though the pic was mine and I was 18 at the time, now 19) I was accused of uploading a picture of a minor. So I got to experience talking to local hunks for just about a week. Stupidity from both our ends. From what I remember, the app wasn't bad- Id tell you what I think of it now, but my device is completely abandoned from Scruff.

title: Love it
review: I just got my first smartphone and wanted to try out the dating apps my buddies talk about. Of the ones I added this one is my favorite because it has such a great set up with bios and information on the guys your looking at not just a weirdly cropped photo and a saying. Definitely a winner plus I've chatted with some really cool guys major plus!!!!

title: Not liking the new update
review: I was very fond of the app before the newer update in fact I had given it 5 stars and an amazing review but now unless you pay (and I did buy the upgrade for 3 months and as long as your paying it's still a great app)now when you get unlocked photos you can't see them all and you can only view a very limited number of local guys there are a few nice things about the upgrade but the negatives are more I'd rather have not upgraded

title: It never gets better
review: I don't know why they keep updating this app when it's the same old garbage.  It still crashes a lot.  It continues to be self promoting for the owners ego and FULL of popups that just tell you where Johnny is going to be.  If you care then this would be the app for you, but you can just add him to Find Friends and that would work better anyway.  If you like bears, then growlr is for you.  This app keeps putting out upgrades to dodge the bad feedback and hide that fact that it's seriously loosing market share to true bear apps.

title: E-Cruising made simple
review:
I don't like the navigation changes after some use. Harder. Needs streamlining. And the constant popup messages on launch are very annoying. 

It's simple and still potent. It isn't overloaded with too many controls as if that would make the app better. This is the place to find men who like fur and facial hair.

title: Scruff is a bit bristly
review: While I appreciate the photos, Scruff has several disadvantages. There is very limited profile and too many in app purchases.  If I want to see an entire conversation held over several days, I need to pay to see that.  If I want to see more than a prescribed number of men's photos at one time, I need to pay to see that.  The only advantage I see over similar apps is searching by specific city and country.

title: A great app... Just one cpmplaint
review:
My only complaint is that it's a little cumbersome when you're chatting with multiple people at once... You have to switch to that profile and then hit the chat log, and then go back through to respond to another message.
Otherwise tho it's a great app.

title: Awesome
review: Hands down, one of the better apps available. Guys on here are real, the "woof" feature is great, and I've actually made friends on it. Like, actual friends. I've also had quite a few really enjoyable dates out of it, and a few have turned into relationships. Definitely a great investment, time wise.

title: The best of the man apps
review: I love that Scruff requires a profile picture and the next step is to require men to verify that it's them making the account. Unfortunately the app could make a lot more popularily if the monthly/yearly fee for pro was less money. Until then, scruff pro will just have to wait until it's more affordable with better "Match" potential.

title: Scruff
review: This app is great! I've met countless friends from here and had hours of entertainment from this app. The best part about it is it goes where I go and shows me who is close enough to reach out and touch. Lol, even at the bars anymore everyone is on their mobile device seeing who is close.  It's all thumbs up from me!

title: Fix the Interface
review: This could be a good app -- I certainly love the idea of a Grindr for Bears! -- but the interface is terrible!  Photos take forever to download, half the time that I try to read a message the App bombs, and several messages have been lost in the process, never to be retrieved again (I'm sure the guys who sent them think I'm ignoring them too), and sometimes the App bombs even when just trying to look at a profile.

title: My 1st app review!
review: This is the first time I've commented on an app, but I've got to say, this one is awesome!!  Love the interface, and how it sorts by location.  Only been using it for a few minutes, and it's already moved to being at the top of my must use first list!  Can't recommend enough!

title: Finally--a geo-smart app for the rest of us.
review: Totally bored with apps like Grindr and Radar, I found Scruff at a friend's recommendation.  And I'm glad I did.  Now when I'm thinking about trip planning or just want to see who's in my area, I can just tap the app button to check out regular guys nearby.  Thanks for creating an app that welcomes all types of guys.

title: Declining Features
review: Scruff has been systematically removing features little by little for years to the point the unpaid app is just nearly worthless. The paid app is too much money for the average guy and in an area where I live with limited guys it makes it hard to justify the expense. I used to enjoy this app and its features until Johnny Scruff got greedy and wanted to bleed paid subscriptions out of everyone and diminished and penalized the ones that couldn't pay for it.

title: Pricey but worth it
review: It's a brave new world that has such scruffers in it. If you're going to adopt or be adopted by a mobile online community, then Scruff beats the competitors in functionality and camaraderie. Whether you're a social butterfly or a caterpillar waiting on your wings, you can easily handle it at your own pace. Friendlier folk are to be found on scruff than, oh say, some skull-faced apps missing their lower palate.

title: Use to be the best app for normal guys.
review: I loved this app when it was completely free. I'm of the opinion that the services you are charging for are overpriced. Limiting us in this way after making scruff such a cool place and then asking almost 20$ a month for full access to the app is ridiculous. Maybe if you had left all the old policies in place and charged for extra abilities at a reasonable price this review would have been better. I'll use other, free apps from this point on. Anyone who agrees with me should delete the app like I'm about to.

title: The Real Deal
review: Easy to use for local connections or global exploration. Premium features well worth it (photo albums, search by city, filters, chat history). Mostly, the site attracts great guys and profile detail allows you to see who they are (if they bother to tell you). We've met great people here, and had hot fun.

title: Just a bad hookup
review: Scruff is an app that you have to pay for everything.  People say the app is what you make it and while I'd like it to be a app to meet guys for a date, the first thing guys want is sex, sex, sex. Also, if you're looking for other poz guys then good luck because if you're not a paid member then you can't list more than one group you're a part of. Me, I list as poz but seems everyone else would rather put bear, otter, ect. as their primary group. If you're looking for an app that's just for anonymous sex then this is the app for you.

title: Good but could be better
review: It's better than Grindr, plus you can meet guys from all over the world (which could be a good thing or a bad thing). However, there are some problems. The new version sometimes has a tendency to go completely dark - I can only fix it by removing it from memory and restarting. Also, they really need to add pic validation. I keep meeting fake guys whose pics were ripped off of porn sites.

title: It's better than most.
review: Be better if the took off the guys who are no longer online or at least change the color of their dot. Instructions say the dot stays green up to an hour after logging off but I've seen it up to 4 hrs. It looks like a lot of guys are online but they aren't.

title: Simply the best
review: This app is THE BEST of any of the gay dating apps in the App Store. Great interface, and messages are never delayed (unlike Grindr). Especially useful if you travel a lot, since you are able to view and chat with guys in any city in the world from your current location. This app is a must have.

title: Worth your time
review: The only issue I find with this app is it either needs to make mass deleting easier or extend the amount of messages users can see. When you are getting messages from all over the world, it can clog up the people closer who you actually talk to on a more regular basis than the faceless user from Siberia who says "Hi" 20 times.

title: New Features: All Locked Behind Pro Account!!
review:
This app released an update that boasted quite a few new things do to, but failed to elaborate who would actually get to use them! 

Video messaging seemed like a godsend for those of us that might want to see a bit more of a person in their day to day before a meet up, but after trimming up a video you're hit with: Please subscribe to a Pro account to view videos. What gives?! Why only give the facade of a feature rather than the actual feature?

Apparently private photos have been restricted to two, but I've yet to encounter this blockade. 

Seems like Scruff is going under if these endless cries for subscriptions is anything to go by.

title: Alright
review: There are some hot guys that come online, unfortunately I ran into a 14 year old kid on here. His profile had a picture of his actual face; so profiles can't be that well filtered. The GPS function is also faulty. It constantly tells me that it's +/- 1500 feet accuracy, yet at the same time it says that guys are 2 miles away, when they're actually 45 miles away.

title: Good 2 Meet Scruffy
review: It opens door to a different subset of people. Of course the smooth grindr users take a 5 o'clock shadow pick and throw it on here too. I like that if you want to update your photo then it displays immediately. App does crash, but not too frequently. Wish you could zoom and crop a photo before sending it out. Enjoy!

title: Great app for meeting great guys
review:
Love this app. Able to talk to guys around the corner or across the world. 

Love that you can pick a new city to chat and look at guys. Makes traveling easier as there is someone there you know before you get there. 

Much better than similar apps.

title: Connection Errors
review: I was happy until recently when it seems you are unable to connect more than you are able to connect. As for the extras, if you really want them you pay for them. I can do without them and now possibly with the entire app

title: New Version Improving
review: Scruff has great features that make it preferable to other similar sites. However, the newer version is a significant change that makes things a little more complicated.  They are improving though.  The quality of users is generally better on this site than others.

title: Excellent app!!
review: Scruff far exceeds the other social apps for guys!  Scruff is much more useful/functional then others I've tried. In addition to it's ease of use there are great guys on the app. Have met many great folks and I feel like I am part of a worldwide community of hot men! Definitely download this app!

title: OMG!!!!!!! ONE OF THE BEST APPS!!!!!
review: Real talk!!! .... Better than adam, bgc, even biggercity!!!! I've meet sooo many sexy guys! Exchanged over 300 pics ... One of the best Fam!! Please believe!!! If u got a belly, a kegg, or even a washboard ... This app Is for you!!! Turn up UR swagg! Make a hot profile and start just showin love!!! And when u begin to show love u'll start over-flowingly receiving love in return!!!

title: Great for international and across border connections
review: The only thing that's frustrating is the online and available feature.  It says I'm online about 5 hours after no use on the app.  Wish that could be timed better versus me automatically saying I'm offline.

title: More improvement
review: A excellent after working around Grindr but I believe it needs a little more work. And now Grindr is not a user friendly and better in some things I love this App better than Grindr. If you haven't download it don't waste more time reading download it and enjoy it fun and somewhat easier to use.

title: Onward and upward
review: This app has come a long way from a few years ago when I first downloaded it. Very easy to use and constantly improving. Lots of features and ways to connect with guys. It worth getting. If only bc it never crashes as much as "other" hookup apps.

title: No problems, awesome people
review: I use this app for not only it's infamous purposes, but I've also had great success meeting awesome people that have turned into genuine friends and I've even employed a few of them who needed it. Be kind, be polite, BE UPFRONT AND HONEST.  Don't leave a detailed, four page essay on how to get into your pants... it's boring.

title: Collected
review: Enjoyable app. I especially like the no-risk 'like' button. You can go crazy and hit like for as many people as you want, without anyone besides you and Scruff knowing (some services will let the liked person know which I hate), unless they 'like' you back. What can I say? It is very face-saving.

title: Good alternative to Grindr
review: I like this better than Grindr because it's easier to use, the pics of other users are clearer, and it gives you push notifications without having to sign up for the paid version.

title: Puts Grindr to shame
review:
Its refreshing to find Scruff after a year on Grindr. I'm happy to say the guys behind this app (unlike Grindr) are gay, so they understand their customers. 
I was tired of the Gestapo treatment over at Grindr ( "the top of your underwear is showing! We are removing your pic!" ) and the guys on Scruff are sexy, friendly and kind.
For a GPS based, guy-finding app, this is it.

title: This is my Social Network
review: This is my Facebook, my Twitter and my Instagram. I'm really only interested in socializing with like-minded men and this is what Scruff is. Chat with who you want when you want based upon mutual selections. You are bound to find similarly interested people that you may or may not be sexually attracted to. It's a great way to make friends and get laid in a new place!! Thanks Scruff!

title: Bad unsend feature
review: I like this app but the only things I don't like is that people who are not scruff members can just download the app and look at people profiles without having to create an account I like to have my privacy and not have to worry. Another small thing is the unsend feature is really nice except that it shows on chat that you unsent something. Would be better not to have that but to just have the message disappear.

title: Much improved :)
review: I used to use this app 2-3 years ago and I have just downloaded the app recently. The app still offers the same great variety of men. I used to have site crash issues all the time in the past, I have not had these issues. Much improved.

title: No better app!
