review: This app beats all the other "dating" apps on every dimension: layout, ease of use, functionality, value. Only thing I would say is it would be great if it could have more Facebook features: sharing content, likes, friends network, visible check ins, etc.

title: Live the app
review:
Great app. Lots of features that are all very useful (no annoying features). 

Only complaint is that a few of the settings that can be toggled on/off could be worded more clearly (eg. the "hints" toggle) which I've had to explain to friends who wish to disable those features.

title: Real Men Use SCRUFF
review:
My boyfriend and I share a SCRUFF profile and we've been surprised to meet a lot of solid guys from around the world (who aren't afraid to talk about pursuits both in and out of the bedroom.) Hands down the best app for all-around handsome fellas who want to meet guys with no agendas.
Big thanks to Jason and the guys at SCRUFF.

title: Extra and complicated.
review: No easy way to turn off push notifications- like i want to be notified at work/ or when with someone that I have a message on scruff- thought it would be a cool alternate but still does not compare to Grindr; too many tools for people you keep and store and black male with photos; especially if you are on here out of curiosity or trying to be discreet. After reading these reviews I am almost convinced that the makers of this app are writing them.

title: Good and Bad
review: Not sure how I feel about this application and site. Often times the app does not work. It won't load. And yes I have plenty of space on my phone. The people are aloof at best. I think most of the people are not my type and vice versa. On a positive not. I like the GPS part of it. To look and try to connect with people around you is very cool feature.

title: Great app! Great guys on here!
review: Scruff offers more features than Grindr, is cheaper than any of websites out there by far, and still offers a free version that is the very same set of features people were using before. Everyone out there needs to take a deep breath and expend their energy meeting guys versus writing snarky, ill-informed reviews.

title: Great when traveling!
review: Have used this app to get lots of information from the locals about places in their city while traveling! Also, useful when wanting to hang out with someone and you don't know anyone in the city. Doesn't hurt when you're cute and have a great personality! ;)

title: Great site
review: Scruff is easy to navigate and use.. I had other applications that I have deleted because they were difficult to use.  Scruff gives great support and they pay attention to their customers..  Met some hot guys. I prefer clean cut but sometimes you just want a little scruff.

title: Text box
review: Things seem to be fine with the text box until I upload a new photo.  After I perform this simple task, the app is unusable.  I have to uninstall and re-up.  Really?  I left Grindr for Scruff because it had more options and better performance.  Now I am not too sure.

title: Too many playing the game
review: Three other apps like this one and the same guys are on those as well saying pretty much the same thing. All flakes and all want to see private pictures. There is one guy on these apps that's really attractive, if he's on all those, what chance do I have at finding anyone? All you can is look at the pictures, the worked out and pretty ones have slept with each other. They just waiting for the new guy to get!

title: Gone Commercial...
review: This was a great app and great network, and it's still ok, but the most recent version has gone "crippleware" pushing not one, but two individual rip-off monthly subscriptions, denying you app-critical features like managing individuals to block or unblock, or limiting how many people you can see in the free tier. Might be time to move on to a more social-friendly app/network...

title: THE Best of them all!
review: Easiest to use, easiest to transfer to another or an additional device!  Others make you reregister and start from scratch.  This is about the only Stand alone app I use now other than sites w/a mobile log-in.

title: Was a good app but now
review:
It had gotten to be a problem... The email sign on, sometimes it will not accept attachment pics, sometimes it now takes 3 to 5 times to respond to an email.

They have advertised for programers in NYC.. Let's hope a few talented ones take the job!!

title: Greediness Has It's Price, Literally
review:
From free to paying $1-$10 per month to have features once free, and now the server even has issues (nice job, wonder how those paying feel now).

Scruff was once a place to meet bears, then accepted as a place for anyone with "scruff". Once a place with a healthy community sample, now a place to reap benefits if you have the money in this economy.

Sorry, Johnny, as a person who was around from the beginning and a good example of what made Scruff what it is today, you've officially pushed me to Growlr as my favorite app

title: Social Apps like these need Filters
review:
Would have got a better rating except for the lack of filters.
Not just for whose online or age but for single, married, partnered, etc. 
Scruff has a large community of men that are partnered or married and it needs a filter so you can see just the type of people one wants to see. I'd pay money for that feature!

title: Great app, just a battery drainer right now
review: This app is great! The one issue I have is that it really drains your battery when you use it. I'm sure that will be improved with future versions. I look forward to seeing what developes on this app! I just wish more guys closer to me would join in. ;)

title: Great hybrid app
review: Scruff is a hybrid dating site where you can both quickly find guys based on attraction, and view more detailed profile of guys to see if you are compatible. Whether you're looking to do long term dating or just a hookup, it's the place for every gay male looking for other guys.
developerResponse: {'id': 444278, 'body': 'Thank you for the feedback! Members like you make the SCRUFF community as great as it is. We hope you find your perfect Match! WOOF!', 'modified': '2017-05-26T21:16:44Z'}

title: Where Men Truly Find Men
review: Scruff hasn't lost its edge epitomizing and encapsulating the very essence and hotness of men. In its release of version 5, navigation is intuitive,  smooth, and the pics pop off the page revealing even hair, sinewy muscle, and glistening sweet just begging for you to take just one taste - as if we could take just one taste.

title: Nice app
review: It's pretty easy to use to see which guys are around. I wish it had a search feature so you could sort guys by your interests. I agree that the Pro upgrade is overpriced for what you get, but I also agree that I might not be able to go back either

title: Awesome App!
review: I just got an iPhone a short while ago and decided to download Scruff right away because one of my friends was talking about it. Not disappointed at all. Easy to use and haven't had any technical issues at all. Have actually met a few cool dudes as well. Thank you Scruff.

title: Would be a great app if.....
review: it would load! Grindr pops open on my iPhone and iPad asap, as do other apps.  Scruff is slow to load, and sometimes doesn't load at all.  Too bad I'm going to have to abandon so many friends and connections I've made on it.  Save yourself the grief and don't download!

title: Scruff gets more lame~
review:
My scruff GPS is totally off~ I'm visiting SF and it won't pick up any other local scruff members near by. It says I am 7,800 miles away from Portland, Oregon~
 ...and what's this crap where you have to pay extra for every little feature~?
 The scruff app rapes you Dollar by dollar for The most basic features whereas other apps don't charge you for the very same things~
 The scruff program doesn't seem to hold onto my currently used pix~ I have to keep downloading them from my camera~
 Very not user friendly~

title: Perfect?
review: This app is virtually perfect, especially in contrast to Grindr. Works as it should, simply flawlessly. However, if I was to make one criticism, it would be those annoying pop-up ads/messages when you launch the app.

title: Italcub
review: I love this app. The designers are constantly aware of issues that arise and fix them promptly, explaining each fix, not just 'bug fix'. I have really enjoyed meeting guys on here. If I could change one thing it would be free version message length.

title: Good but needs polishing
review: The app works ok most of the time. Crashes if you send a pic and write something before the upload finishes. The distance doesn't update as it should. Also the check in feature works when it is in the mood. Other than that is pretty good. Tip: to update the distance better, close and open the app.

title: Scruff = Ssucks
review: This is the Worst App Ever!! After Creating an Account, I tried getting acquainted and due to the Pop-us, wasn't able to.  I then purchased whatever "Pro" membership they had TWICE and have been trying to access ONE message from a user for like one week to no avail.  Verdict: Not Easy To Use, Not Clear and definitely NOT Worthy!!!  I wish I could give you 1/32 of a  star but that's not an option.  Thanks Scruff... Thanks for nothing. I'm sticking to other Apps like.....

title: Sad about new updates. App is much less rewarding.
review: This App crashes for long periods of time. Leaving the connection option Extra features are ridiculously expensive & not that special. Completely unreliable lately! Not a great app. Quality is mediocre at best right now.

title: Force closing?
review: Overall I've been extremely satisfied with scruff, each update being better than the last and offering features that seem logical and yet are nonexistent on grindr. However, the past few days scruff has been force closing on me within a minute or so of me opening it. Not sure why.

title: It crashes all the time :-(
review: If this app didn't crash all the time it would be so great. I also find that when I want to use the "take picture" option as opposed to the "choose existing" the app will not do what you want it to do but will instead go back to the message screen. Please fix it Scruff, you've got a great thing otherwise!

title: Good app
review: I like the events feature. It seems to take a while for profiles to show up after logging-on. It would be nice to be able to search by partial user name and other attributes. A filter feature would be nice. The last check in feature does not show my last check in for some reason.

title: Bad reviews on here seem false
review: I'm not sure I believe the discrimination or censorship-related views on here, as I've never experienced or heard of anything like this.  I'm thinking its more likely that these people were cut off (by a piece of software) after they received some large number of complaints.

title: Best gay app!
review: I've used a lot of them, this by far is the best, because it rarely if ever crashes, allows you to talk to guys all over the world. Also the woof feature is so much better to see if the other guys interested or speaks to you rather than always starting with the initial lane, hi or hey, how are you?

title: Prolly the best man 4 man app...
review:
I have been using gay social apps for a couple years now and have never really had guys want to meet in person, until this one. It's rewarding to meet and make new friends, after being betrayed and abandoned by a 20 yr spouse. I don't know what it is about this app that works so well, since the profiles are the same as other apps but it just 
does. 
There are about 700 gay soc net apps, right? It's interesting to see how they're 
Shaking out. This is one of my two favs.

Update; I still love this app, especially because of the technology available in it.

title: Stable, Excellent Features
review: This is by far the best written of its ilk: stable, reliably delivers notifications, is not a huge memory hog, and it has the best set of features in its class. It also has plenty of users and its users are by far the friendliest. I find someone with whom to chat anywhere I try.

title: Hating the "up"dated price and app
review: Terrible. I used to love Scruff. Was so much more enjoyable than the experience on Grindr. With this new update and layout, the user interface is slow and clunky. Too much. Needs to go back to simpler times and an easier price to swallow each month. It's ridiculous to pay that much a month and have ads. Hope they listen to these negative reviews and fix this quick because I'm just going to stick with Grindr if things don't change.

title: Triquatra
review: I love this app! Its great for meeting guys not only from nearby, but from all over the world! You can add photos to only the person your chatting with, in addition to a pvt album! You can describe yourself as descriptive as you want, there isnt a max setting for amount of words used! Its great for guys that are furry and/or like furry guys!

title: Refresh
review: Needs to have a refresh location feature.  It thinks I am still at work and showing me local men to that location.  Closing the app (Completely) and reopening doesn't resolve the issue.  Also, no clue as how to add a location.  My work has the incorrect name and no way to submit a correction to it that I can see... and last but not least...  The 'Support Link' on this pages takes you to an ad to get this app.  No FAQs, no support forms...

title: A vet good start
review: A very good app for something so new... But a couple of quibbles - the refresh rate is much to frequent and the user should have the ability to set the rate of refresh.  And the profiles I set as favorites don't always show at the top of the list.  Fix those and you will have something really good!

title: Really nice app! Better than the rest.
review: I've used a few different apps and Scruff seems to hit the nail on the head with functionality and ease of use. It does the job much better than other social apps of this type.

title: Thumbs up
review:
Great app , very user friendly 
Love how it connects you with others from around the globe. Keeps you updated on what's going on in your city and other domestic events. Love the feature that allows to see guys from other cities very genius 
Five stars all the way!!!!!!!

title: Great dating app!
review: This is the only gay dating app I ever use anymore. I got tired of Grindr's constant technical issues & crashes. And it seems like no one even uses the other apps out there. I have never had a problem using Scruff, & have met some great guys from around the world to boot! Cheers boys on a great app!

title: Forced five star BS
review: Pop-up window prompted me to give Scruff a five star rating and I went to press the "no thanks "options button but it wouldn't work, and although there was an X in the corner of window, pressing it did nothing, so there was no way to close the screen  finally I pressed the five star rating button just to proceed...something tells me that was by design. Love the app, but that is pathetic!

title: Better than the rest!!! 😊😊😊😊
review: so much better than the other gay apps (not to mention the guys are hotter here too!). you don't need to pay for most if not ALL their features unlike other ones where simple things like "Notification Pop-Ups" involves paying. GET THIS APP!!! 😄😃😄😃😄

title: "Just needs to trim the fat as they say..."
review:
For example... When you go to back Out of a message you should be directed back to the default page; not that persons profile!  
  It just makes for allot of flipping back and forth thru pages that are no longer of importance.
Much Mahalo's

title: Really good application!
review:
I'm very fond of the way the app is laid out. The functionality is great, and I would like to thank the Scruff team for the complementary pro upgrade over the holidays! 

Thank you!!

You guys do a great job.

There are a couple things I wish were different:

Sending a saved photo is slightly cumbersome and if you don't like the photo you select, canceling makes you start the process over completely. If you have a ton of pics, scrolling back to where "that one" is is a PITA!

Can you take us back to where we were in the album instead, to make a different selection?

Thanks guys!

title: Good app. Still feel the same. It's free. It's fun. I've met hot men I would have never met! Thanks!
review: Good app. Have met some decent men through here. Good photo sharing great profile abilities, hot hot men. Very slow for chat purposes. Inaccurate GPS. Slow to update when u change location. BUT...it's FREE! Dudes...what more do ya want from free! Woof feature is a real ice-breaker.

title: Frustrating
review: Many people have encouraged getting using this app instead of it's more inclusive counterpart, Grindr.   However, I have quickly found that this app is in now way iPhone friendly.   There are more glitches than I care to mention, although I will say it is the one app that has consistently forced me to actually restart my iPhone.  I recommend waiting for an updated version.

title: New limitation
review: I loved this app but after the update to new version and new limitation on private album disappointed me plus some issues with sending messages has been added ( have to send a message two or three time to be sent and tried it on LTE and wifi but still won't send sometimes)

title: Love it!
review: Great app. Can find what you're into easily. Lots of hot guys that are a bit more experienced than some of the more twinky hook up sites. As someone who doesn't have the pay upgrade, it would be nice to be able to save and unlock nudes. A cool feeling of acceptance and openness. Reminds of me of a great bathhouse.

title: An alternative to Grindr
review: Feel like the intent of friendship and really getting to know local is there but scratch the surface and it's still largely a hookup app, but does have a lot of good features that get people meeting outside of the bedroom...at least initially. Take it with a grain of salt, it's social media, don't get too bent out of shape if it doesn't turn out like a fairy tail.
developerResponse: {'id': 94680, 'body': "Thanks for your comments! There are so many different ways to get the most out of SCRUFF, and we're glad to hear that you're enjoying it. Thanks for being a valued member of our community. WOOF!", 'modified': '2017-04-05T15:18:54Z'}

title: My favorite app
review: I've made great friends & had hours of fun with the eye candy. Thank you guys for a fantastic experience. Have their been challenges? A few -- but what app hasn't & the issues are addressed immediately. The developers are very community oriented & I like reading their interviews. Great for the bears!

title: Great stuff!
review: Not sure about all these other complainers, but I have always kept up with the latest version and it has never crashed, works just as it is supposed to, and each update has provided nice new features, all for free!  Thanks guys and keep up the good work!

title: Greed Ruins a Great App
review: $9 plus constant popup upsells? Come on, how ridiculous. Charge a reasonable amount for a set of value added features, don't move basic features into paid options, make the paid options designed to make people buy both to restore basic functionality and charge the community 3x as much as the competition. What a great way to treat the community that made this app a success...not! And stacking the reviews with 5* shill ratings? How tacky

title: Great features but
review: I like the app but I loved it better when it just notifies you and it doesn't say what the message is now it says the message and I have to be more cautious over my privacy. It would be better if there was an option to chose if you want your messages private or not

title: The best of apps for meeting gays
review: Good features in the free version and really useful ones if you upgrade. The app rarely crash s for me, and I find its interface more intuitive than some other apps. Searching and filtering is easy. I like the events feature too.

title: Fantastic app!
review: I don't understand why so many reviewers crib about a fee for optional, specialized services for a phone app like Scruff. How many of these guys have picket signs protesting Manhunt's $12/month fee for viewing photos and messaging, for instance? Scruff is a great app. It's great for meeting neighbors and locals, and it's certainly home to a far diverse range of men than the WeHo/Chelsea-infested Grindr. Thanks for developing this. Woof!

title: Limited & clunky
review:
Some basic interface annoyances; can't go straight from messages page to message thread which is really inefficient & counterintuitive.
Need pro account to use search filters, see your full message history, & even see who you've recently seen...
You only get one public picture & you can only see so many guys on the main grid interface... 
Compared to similar apps it's weirdly clunky & limiting...

title: Community Building
review: I have been with this app since launch. I live in a rural state, and this app has given me the chance to make many dear friends across the world, and even across my own state. It has definitely changed my life for the better. Thanks for such a great app.

title: Arab & Meddle East
review:
Thanks for your support to Gays in the Arab World..
We really need apps to support Arabic language to access more users in the Arab World..
Some networks are trying always to make this kind of apps to stop leading spocialy the pictures.. I wish if you can make the connection is more secure using HTTPS insted of the usual HTTP..

Thanks for the great work..

title: Perfect App for Us!
review: Scruff hits the market! Finally, an app for us guys who are scruff and those who are fans. Well designed and easy to use. Wish some of the "Pro" features were included in the basic app, but I like what's there all the same.

title: Love the new version
review: Wish it had more search options and functionalities but I'm sure anymore and they would have issues getting it approved by Apple. Maybe they can have an online base sight to to supplement the app....but the best app out there of its kind!

title: Nope. Not gonna download update
review: Cancelled my profile. I understand the need to make a few bones but you apparently don't have good people helping to make solid decisions regarding the future of your product. U sir just priced yourself out of the market. Guess you aren't aware of the struggling economy and how many have cut back on spending. Banks are starting to get the message, auto manufacturing got the message, home builders got the message. I suspect you will be receiving "the message". It's just business bud, nothing personal. Good luck

title: Photo Sharing - Please Fix
review: Hey guys! Great job. I enjoy the app a lot more than others. My one major compliant is about sending photos though. If I want to directly send a photo in a message I have to click through so many prompts to do so. It should be so much more simple to quickly select and send photos from the iPhone album. Takes wayyyyyyy too long right now.
developerResponse: {'id': 368270, 'body': 'Thank you for sharing your feedback! We will certainly take your suggestion into consideration for future updates, regarding the steps for sending photos. Thanks for being a member of SCRUFF! WOOF!', 'modified': '2017-05-19T12:36:04Z'}

title: iRichLuck21
review:
Scruff is the best social app available. I've tried Jackd and Grindr and both are filled with spam bots and blank profiles. 
Also Scruff has guys that actually want to chat and are patient. On the other sites guys would block me if I refused to send a nude pic. Made some great friends from Scruff

title: Fab app...
review: This app has put us in touch with so many great men around the world. The men are not as bearish as I'd like, and some have too much attitude... Wish there was someway to control that aside from using the block feature lol. But this app works very well -- very few lost or delayed messages compared to other apps. Good job overall!

title: New UI is awful.
review:
Scruff used to be my go to app to kill time. And lately it's not even enjoyable. The new design and amount of restrictions that are now in place, ruin the app.
Everything is locked or a popup for the pro version. Which the pro version is way to expensive. 15 dollars for a single month. Crazy. Maybe they are trying to make money now, because this app (in its current state) will fall out of favor fast.  I have lost interest in Scruff, and am turned off by the greed.

title: A stable platform to chat with. I wish many other apps were as stable
review: It's the go-to app for chat and meeting quality guys. No risk of losing chats since they are all server based which means more flexibility in using more than one device (like iPhone and iPad).

title: Why am I paying for this?
review: I would love to be able to write a review but I can't get the damned app to open since the new iOS update. Doesn't anyone beta test anymore? Why the rush to roll it out if it isn't working properly? Sloppy work this time fellas.

title: Love it!
review: This is a fantastic app! It's super easy to use, easy to meet new people, potential romance, hook ups, and more. You can send messages easily, and it can be discreet as you want it to be. I'm very happy with this app, it has not failed me yet! Plus on top of that, there's something for everybody.

title: Great app, great guys!
review:
I've had a really great experience with Scruff, met some incredibly fun, sexy and open guys from all over. 
Granted, I actually invested in the time to write a detailed profile, rather than just check boxes or nothing at all, and I'm glad. It's been a great filter...

Thanks Scruffalicious! I'm a fan!!!

title: Best app on my phone
review: Most sophisticated of all location based "friend" finding apps out there.  The ability to add lengthy descriptions to your profile is a great way to express your individuality.  The ability to search and sort in so many ways is truly amazing.

title: Can't tell if better than Grindr
review: I think scruff is almost equal to grindr. One pro is that you can see who has viewed you. A big con is that you can't really do much without premium, ie. You can look at your old message history. I hate that. It's almost as annoying as grindr and it's individual device history.

title: Overall a very good app
review: There have been bugs and the like from day one with this app, and unfortunately there are a LOT less bears than there used to be and a LOT more twinks/chasers but the app itself typically runs very smooth and rarely crashes, so overall I'd give this app 4 of 5 stars

title: Amazing app!
review: I already have two guys hitting on me, they live in my area and they are smoking hot!!  Best of all i only joined a few hours ago! Its that fast! Thank you Scruff this app is the best! I only ask that you make it free to brows around to look at more guys, other than that thanks so much for this app!!!!!

title: Best app of its kind🐻
review:
Scruff is THE app for hairy guys and those who appreciate them.  My husband and I have met many new friends thanks to Scruff!
My only gripe is the "messaging pro" and "browsing pro" offerings should be combined into a single "pro" subscription- and at a more attractive price.

title: Overall
review: I would say if your looking for people in areas that your planning on visiting, or know where someone is visiting. It's super cool to be able to find them, that way you gotta an idea of the men there around. Overall great app

title: annoying
review: Hate having to close 2-4 notification screens every time I open the app. Rate on Facebook, rate in app store, event notifications and so on. Just STOP it already. Oh, and now as equally annoying, having to log in with e-mail and password every time u quit the app. NONSENSE! Also, $10 a month for an ad free version with browsing and chat features that should be free is ludicrous. And buying credits on top of that. I just deleted the app. LOL. I am sure many, many others will do the same.

title: Pretty darn good
review:
Look we all know why we're on scruff, however... I have found it over the years more user friendly and way more guys online.
My favourite feature is having the ability to make new friends from out of state and the country . Have made so many friends that way.

title: Does what it claims to do
review:
Upsides: Doesn't crash. It's clear when messages are sent (that check mark appears.) User-friendly. 

Downsides: limited blocks, messages disappear after a certain amount of time, and other things that supposedly are not true if you buy a paid account.

title: Woof!
review: This is "the" app for meeting guys. The men here are more masculine and far less pretentious than the other app. (You know which one I mean.) It also has better functionality. I'm baffled as to why the other app has more users, its time has past!

title: Best gay app out there
review: I gave 5 stars because I think they have done a terrific job building this app. It is so easy to use, is very popular and a great way to meet people in your area or from a distance. I met my best friend on here 3 years ago. I cannot say enough good things about Scruff

title: Best app to make new friends
review:
I tried everything else and always the guys that I chatted with were catfihes or fake profiles.

With scruff I have met and have made new friends. I honestly don't or haven't used the app to look for hook ups. 

There are a lot of friendly guys on scruff and just want to be your friend and that's what I have found so far. 

I give thanks to the developer for the recent updates and even if it cost more I pay for it. It's worth it. 

So if your tired of guys just looking to hook up come on down to scruff and give it a chance.

title: HARASSED!!!
review:
Of course there are guys who don't take rejection well but due to the limited blocking on Scruff, I was harassed by a user called ICUMN4U who claims to be a cowboy billionaire who lives in Washington Heights smh... He went completely bonkers by threatening me, doing his best to put me down AND kept on harassing me so I reported him and deleted my app for the time being.

Don't get me wrong, I love this app, WAAAAAAAYYY better than Grindr but the blocking for us paying users MUST be lifted at least because I'm sure I'm not the only one who was being harassed in the Scruff world.

title: Scruff 2013
review:
Have been a Pro subscriber for a few months now.   Enjoy the laid back attitude of the guys I have met via the app.  Johnny and staff have things together back in NY.  Great job!   I also enjoy the local notifications that appear as well.   Other applications advertising and support staff do not work 1/10 as hard as Scruff staffers.    
Thanks again Johnny.   
Chris 
-San Diego CA

title: Too much fun to miss...
review: This app is very cool. With the options of cruising your immediate area, another city, or random guys from around the world, it's good for eye candy and chatting! I rate it as a "Woof"! The only downside is some things you want to do - like see chat history more than a few messages - require a paid upgrade. Which I paid, of course...lol!

title: WOOF! For Scruff!
review: Definitely one of the best apps to waste my time with. What could anyone ask for but a bunch of scruffy, manly men from all over the world at your finger tips! Made some good friend connections and excited to expand my social circle internationally. Scruff, gets a WOOF! In my book.

title: Mike miner
review: I personally Like this app over grinder. More options is always a plus... And having the ability to search is by far the best tool which separates this app from Grindr. I wish users were allowed to upload more than one picture however...

title: Love it! Best gay dating app.
review: I love the way this app works. I like giving guys woofs. And if there's someone who's a jerk, you can easily block him and never have to deal with him. There are a few features that you have to subscribe to use, but it's still awesome. Buy this app if you wanna connect with other guys around you and all over the world.

title: There are good men out there!
review:
Just started using app again. It is totally different than web sites. 

The people act differently from those including myself. You cruise and find or be found with a difference. I have yet to find or be found by C__
dumps, Ect. Viewing past visitors to your profile and mark if interested in you. That saves time wasted. 
Both of you automatically know there is something in common. 
The daily profile displays also allow you to Mark someone. It will let you know if match.

title: I ❤️ Scruff
review: Exponentially better than Grindr or any of the others (it actually works, better feeling of community, better guys, more features). I don't mind paying for an app that does what it's supposed to. Thousands of people pay for Grindr Xtra and all it does is generate misery.

title: Puts most Men-finders to shame!
review:
The search function is very easy to use.  Photo uploads are easy; messaging works without flaw. Above average performance. 

  I have never experienced a crash with Scruff; just errors when the GPS gets thrown off a few miles.
-------
(June 2013). I stand by prior comments. Among the leading intimate social apps for Gay/Bi men, Scruff is far above average!

title: Better than most gay apps around
review: Great interface, not limited in times you can see profiles, enjoy the 'would you meet' feature as an ice breaker. Personally like being limited in seeing guys that are a long distance away.

title: Well written app.  Very stable
review:
This app does a good job geo- locating others.   
The search options allow for good targeted queries as well.  

In all- I've found the members here are more to my liking as opposed to other similar apps.   ( personal preference -  skinny twink "bois" tend to stay on Grindr-- which is fine by me).

title: Good fun!!
review:
Good apps, good photos, fun times.

Love that they keep developing new features, and keeping it getting better. :)
My one wish was that there was an option for a lifetime 'subscription' for the Pro features, as opposed to just a monthly fee. Otherwise, I'm rarely disappointed.

title: Terrific App
review: Even more than the members and paid members (both at home or when traveling), this is a nicely intuitive app that functions in all desired ways.  All functions are elegantly smooth and easy to use. Download it without hesitation.

title: It's useful
review:
It's good and fulfills it's desired use but sometimes messages are lost and not being able to look at older messages can be annoying. 
Not being able to connect is also an issue some days.

title: Making Scruffy New Connections!
review: Works like a charm locally plus if you're traveling you can check out the men before you leave home.  Traveling to Portland in a few weeks and made some awesome connections already!

title: Additions
review: It would be fun to have a little sidebar similar to "viewers" that kept count of the 10 most viewed and most woofed and most messaged members.  They have something similar on MoJo sites.  I have a great time with the site and look forward to its growth.

title: Doesn't have desired features
review:
The app is easy to load and create an account.  Using it tends to be a different story.  Your email address and password have to re-entered every time you login. There is no save feature for these 2 items. 
Also, there aren't any filters to use when looking for a specific type of guy.  I'll keep the app one more week then I'm moving on to the app called Jack'd.

title: Great improvements
review: Have been a scruff user for several years.  This version is great.  No freezing like the last one.  Easy to use.  Recommend for anyone looking to meet guys from close to home to across the globe on your next holiday.

title: Quality over quantity.
review: The new updates are great. The guys on this app are even better. Perhaps other such apps have more guys on them but the quality of the app itself and the guys online here make it a class of its own.

title: Best app of its kind
review: It far surpasses its competitors in style and functionality.  Yes, it is a little more expensive for the monthly features, but good basic features are included for free too.  The lack of bots compared to the other apps makes it well worth the price!

title: Way better than the others
review: Jack'd wont even load, grindr is all spam and the others no one is on. This is the way to go. Made tons of new friends, went on some great dates and Got laid a ton. This is THE only app worth your time and money. Go Pro. Totally worth it.

title: Update- again forced to write a review or a paid for  app will not open???!!!They force you to rate
review: I like the app a lot until recently. Unless I do this rating BS the app, that I do pay for by the way, will hang on the iPad or my phone or just have this annoying pop up that slows me down and seriously peeves me off and stresses me out. If they pull this crap again I'll go back to being a non paying or not at all.

title: Something more decent!
review: Tried them all definitely worth my time and review. I'll give it 5 star but there's something miss on both Free and Pro membership just can't put into words. Lol. Anyways this far BETTER in my opinion, if you want to see previous chat history need to upgrade to Pro! w00f!

title: Better than Grindr
review: I wish more guys used this app. I like it better than Grindr. I especially like the fact that I can remain discrete by not being forced to show my face in my profile pic. I don't like that some of the best features are only available to the people who pay for the app.

title: I love it
review: Scruff is great, it's got real men, not pretty twink boys who think Lady Gaga is the end all of music. The Woof makes it easier to flirt. It's got the kind of men I like. Not ones who are fashion queens, etc.. real hairy men.  I like meeting guys from all over the world, not just a hook up app, but a friend maker, too! Besides, I admit, Johnny's a cutie too!

title: It's ok, does what it says...but..
review:
...but it would be nice to have an additional filter...make that two in conjunction.

As it turns out, I prefer guys younger than myself.
Some guys like guys older than themselves.

So show me the ranges I want to see. Yes, that one is in there. The "narrow their ages" one. 

Also, I would like to not bother someone that doesn't need to be bothered and I'd like to winnow out those out. Allow me to filter based upon the OTHER users criteria: what age ranges is HE happy with? 

I did pay (and they're pricy) the monthlies for quite a while, but without the second filter, the first filter has no real value.

I'd return to the fold if I could save myself some aggravation.

title: Scruff
review: I have used many applications and websites over the years, and I find Scruff to be the second to worst application I have used for the purpose of meeting guys. It's extremely inconvenient to use, requiring you to have to go back several steps every time you want to get out of a conversation. In addition, trying to find your settings is always an ordeal because it is not intuitive. Unfortunately, I will not be able to recommend this application.

title: Fun all the way around!
review: Upgraded to pro-- so far feel like its worth it. Unlike other apps-- seems to be easier to use-- upload pics, manage profile without delays. Messaging is fast and real time-- no "view from browser" mess.

title: Awesome
review: I have found and made more friends on this site than I have at any other site like scruff. With each update it just keeps getting better. Thanks for making this app for us scruffy guys!!!

title: Exorbitant monthly fees
review:
This used to be the best social networking app but the developers have added a bunch of really expensive monthly fees for full access. I can understand the need to earn money to continue to support and build improvements to the app but the fees are simply too high for the things they've added. 

I will say that the guys on here are really nice, and the community is fun so sign up, but I just don't think the monthly fees are worth it.

title: USED TO BE great app, but...
review: Since the 'upgrade' I've lost ALL my contacts & faves' not to mention adding insult to injury having to PAY to browse AND receive messages!?!? I realize Johnny Scruff needs to pay some bills too but for chrissakes 4.99 for messaging pro AND 3.99 for browsing pro w/ even STILL more limitations.. I foresee many bears & cubs migrating back to the ever tired bear UNfriendly Grind'r (yawn)... Hell, it's apparently cheaper than Scruff w/ MORE FREE FEATURES!! Imagine that, please get w/ the program Johnny & reconsider this inevitable 'kiss of death' to this once great app...

title: Unavailable?
review:
Does anyone know why when I try and download the app it tells me that the item I'm trying to purchase is no longer available?
Did try remove the app all together?

title: Awesome
review: What would happen if Grindr and Foursquare had a baby and made it just for bears? Scruff! I love that it's almost all hot men instead of the hit-or-miss nature of Grindr. I like the interface better too. Now all I need is for more guys in the Twin Cities area to get this app...

title: Excellent way to meet people.
review: This app has allowed me to connect with many people. Near and far. Also it allows me to continue my thoughts on being one to help new people or visiting people in on the community I'm involved with and helped build.

title: Beary-Good
review: This is an awesome application is great has easy interface, great graphics, easy to use tools, and an understandable navigation structure. There are ads for the free version but not for the paid version; but you do not need to buy a subscription to enjoy this app. Highly recommended for anyone who uses Bear411 website.

title: It's Fine
review:
Yes, it's better than Grindr, but that is not saying much. I finally switched to the paid version and it's nice, but I can't say it's worth the price. However, it is nice being able to add even more favorites AND to have access to past conversations!

If you like hairier dudes, I would recommend checking out Growlr. 

As my title says: Scruff is fine.  Plus, it can be fun.

title: The less frequently I use it, the more I like it.
review: Don't get stuck on it for hours a day, you just see the same faces over and over. Give it a rest for a week, come back, and things look and feel fresh :)

title: Battery hog
review: I like the app overall even if they are clearly after users' money more and more with each update. But its background updating and connectivity will majorly such your iPhone's battery dry, esp if you aren't in an area with great coverage. So beware when traveling - you can chat up the locals, but your phone will probably die before you connect.

title: Best Gay Social App
review: Lets face it, the same guys are on all of these apps now and the differentiators are options and interface. Scruff is the better of the competitions in those regards, plus if you want to sample the goods in other markets there are multiple ways to do so that are intuitive and fun.

title: First time user
review: Installed just recently. Frustrated with GREEN dot for online users within the hour. A different color for real time online users would be more interesting. Grindr has it, and if Scruff follows only this feature alike, it would be way ahead as app!

title: Biased company
review: Scruff will let you post a pic, then use crowd-sourcing to enforce their ToS. They don't even review your profile...just block you. Yet they let others willingly violate the ToS and put full frontal nudity and what not on the app. Total violation of Apple policies. Sad that they're biased against some and not everyone. Guess if you got the body to flaunt they're okay with it. Not worth the time, effort or money since they want you to pay a premium just to be able to do basic functions. Sad business model.

title: Great, Fun and Playful app
review: I've been using this App for a good long time now and out of all other apps like this including a large one (namelesr), you can meet and chat from all over. Easy to use and again just fun. Keep it us guys. <3

title: Better than Grindr
review: Been using Scruff for over a year now and I've had great conversations with local and global men. People have walked up to me in bars and have told me that they "know" me from Scruff. Your profile pic is the only content subject to censure. Lots of freedom with your written profile. It's as good as Jack'd but far better than Grindr.

title: Overall Awesome Program
review: I am still enjoying the scruff app, but wish could get rid of a profile i no longer use. Had a problem with my actual phone, and it had to be replaced. I then had to create a new profile

title: Free acct member
review: Way to go guys at Scruff! I want to applaud you on the latest update. I now consider Scruff my favorite app for browsing profiles far superior to Grindr, Jacked & many of the other apps I'm currently paying for. Especially like the option to save shared pics in private photo album. Woof Woof...

title: Great guys!
review: Welcoming online community with low amount of attitiude.  Since everyone else is sharing their wish list, I will say that I wish I could view more local men instead of just a few scroll downs,

title: Best of the bunch
review:
The app is confusing at first, and you can't get too far without buying a subscription, but it has the best tools for fostering connections and keeping them from going stale. 

I've met more guys from this app than any other app.

title: Best app out there
review: The app is reliable, never losing messages without notifying you, and indicating clearly where a message didn't get sent. Awesome support team, and the interface + profile options are the best I have seen, gay app or not.

title: Not as scruffy anymore- white muscle guys need only apply
review: Even as a white guy in decent shape, it's uncomfortable to see the "most woofed at guys" are all white, muscle jocks that look exactly the same...I have used this app off and on for a couple years and the people on it have gotten disturbingly more racist, ageist and dismissive of anyone that isn't ripped and white with a flat brimmed hat. Functionally better than other hook up apps...so it's got that going for it.

title: very ballsy of the developers
review: to install a banner ad system ... that doesn't go away —even when you become a PAID monthly subscriber. Now, you can't get away from all the "community"-relevant ads you're really tired of seeing. I'm getting *really* tired of being told by Scruff's Banner Ads that I really should be on PrEP. If you pay Scruff monthly, they shouldn't force you to see banner ads in the app. That's double-dipping revenue streams, in my view. Give longtime, loyal subscribers a Banner Ad-Free App.

title: Best of the best
review: Love that you can search locally or globally. Love the wink feature. Seems more men provide more detail about who they are and what they are looking for. Very user-friendly and the users seem to be more friendly than on other sites.

title: Good App!
review:
Good, solid app, real fun to use. It's always fun to see what hot guys are nearby when I'm traveling. The hot guys nearby at home are pretty fun too! ;-)

Obviously the "Match" feature is supposed to replace the "guys who want to meet you" search. Still trying to figure out how that works.

title: Solid, useful app
review: Good, easy-to-use interface. Ability to upload private pics to share when needed is a great feature. Found far superior to Grinder (plus guys seem to be better on follow through).

title: I don't even have Scruff Pro...
review: ... But this is probably the most fun gay app to use. The app has local mode and buffet-international style which is really fun if you like talking to hot dudes in other countries and your own. I don't have any clue what check-ins are for but it doesn't bother me much. Woof away!

title: Fees. Fees. Fees.
review: A conversation of mine just got blocked, other than I can guess, for the simple fact that I'm using the free version. Seems really confusing and unnecessary to have to pay for so many different features. They need to totally re-stream this app and figure out a better ad revenue structure. $10+ a month is a bit ridiculous considering there are alt ways of meeting people. Totally lame.

title: Really liking this app
review: Only complaint is the lack of ability to place multiple pictures in like jack'd. I do however like the ability to search better on this app than many of the others.

title: Best of them all!
review: Love that you can take, send, & save pics in the chat. You can save up to 80 favs in the free version. Would love to be able to have more than one pic on a profile, and for recommendations based on favs.

title: All the Bears in one single app!
review: Thank you for creating this app! It is fun and very easy to user-friendly. The messages reading process should be simpler, than having to go through the sender's profile first, but it's ok.

title: Woofable
review: I love Scruff. I've used so many sites and apps for friends, fun and even dates but so far Scruff as connected me to the most open-minded, gorgeous, sincere men all around the world. I use it when I travel or am just exploring a neighborhood. Never go anywhere without a woof ;)
developerResponse: {'id': 503884, 'body': "Thanks for your comments! We're happy to hear that you're enjoying SCRUFF. Members like you make the SCRUFF community as great as it is. WOOF!", 'modified': '2017-06-05T20:19:52Z'}

title: Eh.. Not bad
review: I wish there was an easy way to refresh every now and then other than shutting the ap down and relaunching it.  I don't have the speed problems others seem to report.. I've met some cool guys and even played around, but it could definitely use a few updates and bug fixes..

title: Great App
review: This app has always been the better app out of Grindr and Jack'd in my opinion. Never really had an issue with force closing or and of that nonsense. It's easy to use and has some nice features. Overall I love it and will recommend it

title: Not working with Family Plan bad customer service
review:
Scruff doesn't work to allow two people to have a subscription if they are on the apple family plan. When we emailed them the responded with a cookie cutter response. 

So we discontinued the family plan and it still didn't work.  So we emailed again and got the same stupid response word for word.  That is really not customer service.

title: It's better than the others.
review: I paid for PRO in a moment of weakness after a breakup. The extra features aren't really worth it. Typically the users are more down to earth than other apps though. The people are what keep me coming back. The app itself is just fine.

title: Adequate at best
review: While this app is a step up from Grindr, it has problems and crashes too much, though not as much as Grindr. The paid subscription costs too much, and the new version with the stupid match feature that came out on Valentine's Day is worse, not better. As a paying member, I will not be renewing when my subscription ends.

title: Good stuff
review: I like the push notifications and just about everything. The only annoying thing is that you have to switch over from "nearby" to "messages" to see what someone just sent you. I mean come on, you're probably chatting with someone nearby, right?

title: Best gay social app
review: Scruff is the most stable and feature rich app out of all the gay social apps. My messages do not get lost and rarely does it crash. They also continue to enhance the features - and they actually work - as opposed to some of their weak competitors. Great programmers - well done!

title: Best of its' kind
review: Compared with the many many other gay networking sites out there, Scruff is by far the best. Great, user friendly interface, more room for creating a profile beyond a picture of your headless torso, and a very convenient 'woof' function to say hello :) love it.

title: Rob
review: If you want to limit features to new subscribers, well ok. But, to limit how many pics you can view in someone's private pics when you could view all 10 before, that's just being chicken s--t! Still a fun app!

title: Can't make sense of the user interface
review: It seems to have many more capabilities than its competition; but I don't find them intuitive or useful.  The pop-up help (that shoots off like fireworks) is very annoying.  Based on other reviews, I gather that many of the features are only available if you pay the expensive monthly subscription (which I won't).  Think I'll stop using this app.

title: Decent but expensive
review: I like the app. I think it is ridiculous that you can only see so much of the message without paying and only so many messages. The app is a bit over priced when you can go to Growlr for much cheaper.  I do have to say completely beats Grindr and Adam4Adam

title: Best Gay App
review: Scruff>Jack'd>Grindr.  Absolutely love the new filtering features which allow you to filter by age, ethnicity, relationship status, etc. This app even allows you to search outside your local area, which is a nice feature. Most importantly, this app is stable and not buggy.

title: Arguably the best...
review: I have all the "name" apps of this nature on my iPhone, and this one is the best. Besides the fact that these guys are more my type, there is more detailed information and the push notifications are great. Grindr is for gym bunnies and twinks, the men are here.

title: Beginning to not like it
review:
Twinks around my area started creating profiles middle of last year and since then have grown in numbers in this app. I don't know why they can't leave this app alone. Gone are the days of beefy, chubby bears being the majority. It's still a great app but the content has changed a lot. 

Go away twinks!!!

title: Really good app
review: I like using this app. It has some really good features and it's very user friendly. I definitely recommend to other people wanting to use an app like this. You'll enjoy how easy and fun it is.

title: The place to be a bear
review: Scruff is awesome because there are so many types of guys. It doesn't feel like being an outsider looking in. Everyone is accepted and that's awesome. Guys who would normally shave to look like Twinks are letting their fur out. Just a really awesome app

title: Great App. Woof!
review: I've had this app for five days, and I've chatted with more than a dozen guys. Two from nearby almost every night. It seems like guys are joining like wildfire. I enjoy reading what they say even if we don't connect. Again, great "WOOF" app!

title: This is great!
review:
Scruff has been an excellent social network app, what I like most is their involvement with social issues, and keeping me informed as well educating our community on what's going on, using notifications right above the grid .
Thanks scruff team!!

title: Great so far
review: I haven't used it much, but so far it's fairly easy to use, and the potential for meeting people is enormous.  I have already seen a lot of people in the browser that I have met before, so I know it's working the way it's intended.

title: After I took a load from everyone on grindr I didn't know where to turn
review: Thanks to scruff I'm back to my  4 a day load average.  And the guys on scruff are hot and hairy it's like getting a hot Luda there so exfoliating !!! (Credit to wiliam and hole pic) Get all the bb holes you need a hairy hole is still a hole

title: Poor upgrade
review:
Have not been able to get the app to start all day. 
The extra features are not all that special and should not cost extra (message history)
I would love to use this app again but some serious updates are needed.

title: Great app and support.
review:
I had a problem signing up, but I sent them a message and they fixed it within a day. Anyone else who couldn't sign up, try now. :)

Now that I'm on, seems like a great app. Lots of features even in the free version.

title: Scruff rocks!
review: Best gay app. Period. Great guys. Great features. Great customer service. Friendly atmosphere. I've met quite a few close friends on here. It's nice to have a bear-slanted app that is of such great quality. No more Bear411 crap! Download it now. You won't be disappointed.

title: Likely STUFF
review:
Scruff like most of gay "dating" are simply a big mary-go-round. One's sees the same guys day in and day out. Much  the same as going to the waterhole in hopes of meeting THE ONE. OK the app Is efficient. Unlike it's "rival", Grid*r, which crashes on a regular basis. Scruff hasn't, at least to my knowledge, hasn't crashed once. The guys are good looking? Some are 
 Sweet. Scruff is very god.

title: Mostly good fun
review: Have a pretty frequent rebooting issue, but overall runs pretty smooth. Location Accuracy is sometimes questionable. Biggest thing that needs improvement is a place to store a name or other data...

title: My favorite
review: Seriously this app is awesome for networking or meeting people near you. I love the trip feature and the interested in meeting feature. Those are with the free version. If you do the paid version it's even better!
developerResponse: {'id': 214329, 'body': "Thanks for the kind words! We're glad to hear that you're enjoying SCRUFF. Thanks for being a valued member of our community. WOOF!", 'modified': '2017-04-25T16:57:14Z'}

title: Too expensive, horrible cust. support, all rude men
review: This app is a joke. You can hardly do anything without paying. The customer support is non existent and if all you're looking for are the stuck on themselves muscle crowd jerks then this one is for you. Been called a "fatty" more than once on here and was even told to delete my profile because "fat guys are disgusting" This app and the creators / target audience embody all that's wrong in our community and amplifies it for their own gain.

title: Best app for Gay Men!!
review: Doesn't matter what you are looking for. Hookups, friends, travel advice, man candy, it's all here. And the scruff team is awesome. Very active in our community. If they do an event near you definitely take the time to meet them. You won't regret it.

title: Make is easier to delete conversations
review: is OK, but they need to make it easier to delete conversations. You have to push so many buttons just to clear conversation delete it. There should be a feature that allows you to quickly swipe like other apps allowed to delete

title: Excellent App
review: If you are looking for a gay dating chat app then this is the app for you you are able to pick and choose the guys you like you may also view and share your private photos which no one there gay app has.

title: Friends and fun
review:
Can't tell u the connections I've made through scruff for friends alone has been amazing. From where ever I've lived
And to where I've traveled it's been so so great to meet and make new friends.  The fun part is just an added bonus 😈

title: Great dating app
review: Pretty good app in comparison to its competitors. 0 crashes so far, notifications are an added bonus (even with the free version), and the guys come in a wide variety making the shallow ones few and far between.

title: Great app, very intuitive interface
review: Plus hot guys. And they also still support iOS 6. Even though my iPhone can run iOS 8, I'm waiting until the deep rich beauty returns to iOS to upgrade, or at least an optional iOS 6 theme is available.

title: I want it now damnit!
review: This is definitely not my go to app when I'm horny and want some d""k.   Hardly any guys are ACTUALLY online when they appear on the screen. So many times I've clicked on a guy's profile only to find out he was online 20 min ago.  Not cool when you're wanting it NOW.  that's the only complaint I have for now. Other than that it's just ALRIGHT.

title: Love me some Scruff!
review: Scruff is my favorite of the gay social apps I have. Most importantly, it is the most reliable and works. Love that I can look locally, internationally...anywhere! And I seem to get more attention on Scruff than the others. The men are just friendlier. Keep up the good work Scruff.

title: Very unhappy
review:
I was very happy with SCRUFF in the beginning. However, I recently updated the app and now I can rarely connect to the SCRUFF server. When I do, it will not load anyone who is nearby. When I try to send messages, they wont go through. 

I contacted customer service and they had suggestions for helping me though none if their suggestions worked. They asked for my IP address and that was the end of our correspondence (several weeks ago).

title: Decent app
review:
Moved to a new city, I decided to try social networking more. The site totally works for me. It's as good as you make it yourself. Tell people enough you get what you want. Don't tell them anything, you get what you should expect.
It's easy to use.

title: If you love Bearracuda ad-spam...
review: If you love Bearracuda ad-spam, then this is the app for you.  You'll never not know when a Bearracuda party is happening in yr area. Otherwise, the most exciting thing to happen to me with this app is my Internet stalker found me on it, and I had to write the owners to get him blocked. If you like to send and receive 'woof' notifications from guys who already have partners, this is also the app for you. Not good for much but looking around as far as I can tell.

title: Disappointed
review: I have liked this app though the guys are mostly of the rugged/manly/bear type. Nothing the creators can do about that. But with this latest update they have severely limited what you can have access to from another member. They can't share albums etc. This is a change from before. And it's all to get you to pay $9 a month. I don't have that. It's just stupid to ask for that in my opinion. Screw that. I'm moving on.

title: It's ok
review: There are a bunch of dating apps out there, and this one is just ok. The interface is a bit awkward to navigate. It's concept is good, but it's execution is sub par. They need to take another look at all the other gay dating apps and create a reason I would want to pay for the app. With a few improvement this app has the potential to be amazing. But not quite yet.

title: Better than the G app!!
review: Messages get screwed up the message bubble says I have 2 messages but only 1 shows up but no complaints other than that and thanks for the free message notification.

title: Scruff is NOT to shabby!
review:
This appeared at first to be a version of another social site,( name withheld), but upon inspection and regular referral, it's so way better! Scruff totally scores, as can you when you use this app. Safe and sane practices should always be followed.
Hope to see you in the cue.

title: Bad app
review: This app is crap! Had to delete, lost all my Data and friend connections. It won't re install... Stops halfway thru install... Just sits there. The past 15 hrs it has been telling me to "check my connections". My connections are fine, this p.o.s. is the only app that isn't working. Why don't these guys just say "were having a problem" instead of lying to us and sending us on a wild goose chase trying to fix something that's not broken? Waste of time, wasted app.

title: Pretty good
review: Would like it even more if people wouldn't continue to appear in the thumbnail view after you block them. You only get 50 or so profiles. Would be great if they didn't have to include people I've decided I don't want to interact with.

title: This app stinks.
review: Drains the he'll out of your battery!  Says you are logged off but still sends u messages.  There's no way to turn off the msg feature so that it doesn't show msg content on face. Lastly the distance indicator is faulty. For those reasons I opted out!

title: Almost perfect
review: It's a great app, and I became a paid member a year ago after using it from the beginning.  I just wish that as an app that caters to bigger guys/bears we had a few more flexible ways to find people interested in us.  Adding chubby and chaser might be a start, or maybe a Hot at any size flag?

title: Great App
review: Love this app. Have met a lot of great guys on here; that never would have. I am normally the quiet one till i know someone. Scruff has helped a lot!! Glad i found it. Thanks to all the great new friends I've made because of this app!!

title: Great!!!
review: I like the fact that Scruff is a clear and straightforward group. We all know there are many reasons people use social apps, and Scruff isn't afraid to cover them all. From community involvement and education, to dance parties and dark clubs, Scruff can help you out.

title: Awesome
review: Great app to meet people around the area and the world. It's been lots of fun chatting with guys all over. I work a weird schedule so I ended lots of times chatting with guys on the other side of the planet while at the same time having made good friends locally

title: Best so far
review: Scruff is beautifully designed and easy to use.. And very rarely ever crashes, only thing I would ask is for a frequent phase category see you could send the same phrases without having to type them over and over which grinder has..

title: Yin & yang
review: As with most things there are good and not so good. Great app to meet local guys, meet new friends or do the hook up thing. There are limits for standard members but all things considered it's a great app and I have kept it though deleted others that advertise the same "benefits"

title: Works well but...
review:
I'd subscribe if the app were less expensive.  I don't need or use it enough to spend over $100 a year.  Perhaps 2 levels of membership.. 
Silver which allows viewing of movie clips shared...
Gold which allows archiving and other services that use up server space

title: No problem with Site
review: I have no problem with the site at all. It's the quality of the men that I find lacking. The inability of most to simply reply with a thank you to a compliment received says more about character than any profile written or photo posted.

title: By far the best gay app around!!!!
review: This is by far the best app around the only thing I don't like is that you have to purchase the apps features but I'm not complaining the free app works great! This app beats grinder or any other dating app for sure

title: Awesome (a year ago...).
review:
This app is essentially the same but the "enhancements" are bothersome.
I've had the app since January 2012 and now they've added pop-up guides to help explain things to newbies... But, due to an oversight, this pop-up cycles through every time you open the app. I see more explanations on how to use the app than I see if the actual app.
I actually cannot stand using it right now.
Please fix it ASAP.

title: Yes please
review: This sight rocks my word all day day long my boyfriend and I started a profile together and within one week we had over a thousand guys wanting to be the third in our relationship we are so flattered and many even be looking.... :)

title: So many features
review: The free version has way more features than other similar apps' paid versions. This is definitely one to download and keep.

title: Great app & great guys
review: I love this app because you can change your settings from local to any city in the world.  This is a perfect app for a traveling man.  I've met guys from all over the world.  This is my favorite social app by far!!!

title: This app is now on my "To Delete List."
review: Technically, this app is free. But if you don't want to keep running into brick walls with nag boxes, it's gonna cost you at least $10/month in in-app subscription fees. That's a rather steep price you'll pay to see the same 20 to 30 local guys, day in and day out. Even the global listings are fairly limited. Current version requires log in with full email and password, making this app not worth the trouble - or the money.

title: Best app
review:
This app helps give a social life to people like me who do not have one because of our jobs and it's crazy hours or whatever it may be  

I tried grindr and that app can't even hold a candle to scruff

title: Great app!
review: This app is awesome, I was one  of the first guys to get on scruff, and too see all the updates, and how they listen to feed back, and implement it is great! Looking forward to the paid version, I'll be the first to buy it!!!

title: Recommend 100%
review: I've made a lot of good friends and some very GOOD friends! Thanks, scruff! You're app is great and I really enjoy the features. I definitely recommend this application for meeting new people and also making new playmates.
developerResponse: {'id': 95130, 'body': "Thanks for the feedback! We're glad that you're making connections on SCRUFF. Thanks for being a valued part of our community. WOOF!", 'modified': '2017-04-05T15:57:43Z'}

title: Great design, easy to use,
review: Here is a design that never needs changing.  And I hope it never does.  Can't get any more easier and organized than this.  This is a well designed, fast, robust, easy to use, and easy to learn app.

title: Good app but way overpriced
review: The pay options are VERY overpriced for what you get.  And you are getting further and further restricted to force you into buying a subscription.  I wouldn't pay more than $2/month for a subscription.  The men are hotter on scruff but there's a creeping "grindr-tude" that needs to be checked.

title: Ruined a good thing
review: Why change a good thing when it's actually working??  this new version is completely poorly designed. Did you do any UI functionality testing prior to deploying or do you just deploy and hope for the best? What developer would add red text on a black screen?  that is probably the worst color choice that could have been selected. REALLY bad on the eyes and exceptionally poor decision-making🖍 Get it together and remove the harsh red colors 🔜➰🔚

title: Too busy visually
review:
I hate that, since the update, when I click on ONLINE NOW I also have to hit the green button because it never saves your preferences. An unnecessary step making the users' experience more burdensome, less flowing .

What happened to minimalism?
I feel like this makes my eyes hurt. It looks like a Christmas piñata exploded. Less is more! I wish they'd simply do what they're meant to do, instead of now trying to be travel agents. Apartment rentals? No thanks .

title: Terrible update
review: The focus of this update was clearly to cram in new features and not about the user. The UI and navigation updates are are needlessly confusing. Seriously, remove all of the transitions! Not every new item needs to slide in and bounce! The app is definitely slower and less responsive now. They need to fire their UX/UI designer and start over. Or better yet go back to the old app in the meantime.

title: Still so far behind...
review: It's been months and countless updates and this app still isn't updated for ios8 and iPhone 6/6 plus... Kinda crazy you are still using these old assets from ios6 and yet focusing on adding features like "match" which is just a tinder ripoff. Disappointed, but sadly not surprised. 2 stars for what this app contributes to my social life -- the one department it remains strong in. That's about all.

title: Get rid of global view
review: Worst update yet. No useful new features, lots of idiotic ideas copied from other services, and good features taken away. Either get rid of global view entirely or allow us to hide it. It's nothing but a waste of time. In prior versions, pro members could hide the global grid, but we're stuck with it yet again. "Swipe to Match" was poor design when OKCupid created it. It's even worse design to copy it whole cloth from them.

title: Rate us screen
review: The irritating thing is it wont let you get into the sight without reviewing their sight. All the other buttons wont work you'll hit every other button or the ex..nothing but the rate us button goes right to this review sight.

title: One of the best
review: Definitely draws only certain types of guys..good amount of users always on...free account doesn't limit use nearly as much as other similar ones..reliable and always works..top contender

title: Just ok compared to others
review:
Really don't like an app that takes away functionality just to later offer it as 'pro'. 

If you want us to pay, go above and beyond what others give for free.

title: Awesomeness.
review: Good variety of men  that are local, despite my living in the middle if nowhere. Easy to use app. My complaints are that I can't do what you have to pay for, which is just me being whiney and you can easily get by without.

title: Much better than Grindr
review: Better features overall in the free version than Grindr.  Like the ability to see who has looked at your profile recently, and to search in other areas, not just your current location.

title: Splash screen
review: I'm sorry But why do I care who the founder is or who the model is or who the engineer is when I'm starting up the app every single time I have to see these people's faces. Also the pro version is vastly overpriced I can't believe you're getting my with us. It's just a matter of time before something better comes along and people move something less expensive.

title: Great app
review: I really like the update. Wish they hadn't changed the feature that you could hold on someone's picture while in the message screen and you would get a pop up asking to delete the conversation. It's kinda annoying

title: Great site to meet a guy to date!
review: Lots of cute, friendly guys both near & far who are ready to chat & go out. Some players, & some dudes only looking for hook-ups, but more men who want to date! I joined 3 wks ago, & I've already gone out with 4 guys! 5 stars!

title: Best of the Gay Dating Apps By Far
review: Scruff is the best app to meet gay guys out of all of the apps out there. The majority of the users are kind, down to earth people. I've also found that it is probably one of the most relationship/friendship oriented of the apps available on market! :)

title: Fun, furry and versatile
review: Much more useful and user friendly than Grindr or any other counterparts. Accurate gps, great global option with extensive upgrade options and a nifty user tracking page. Love it!!

title: Has gone downhill
review: I've been using this app since it first came out. This app used to be geared towards bears/bear admirers. It used to be a "gay bear finder" and now it is "meet gay guys worldwide" so it has basically turned into grinder. Growlr is much much better, is geared towards bears, and doesn't charge money to do simple things that you shouldn't be getting charged for. Johnny Scruff has gotten greedy, and has left the bear community behind in his quest for $$$.

title: Good App but need some additional options
review: I think there should be an HIV status option to profiles.  I think awareness is still important and should be an "option" for those who feel comfortable posting their HIV status, negative, positive, not sure or not posting it at all... But there should be a status option for profiles

title: Grindr how I've missed you.
review: The new interface is nice and pretty and it works very well.  A lot of the same features are still accessable.  However you are charging for services that you had in the original versions now and a complicated pricing structure is bad enough, but as soon as I updated I lost ALL of my favorites that I spend two years building.  I'm going back to Grindr.  At least they know not to screw with their customers like this.

title: Solid app for gay travel and meeting guys
review: SCRUFF is the absolute best app for meeting guys. I love the Venture feature, where you can post your travel itinerary and chat with locals even before you arrive. This newest update includes location sharing and animated GIFs in chat! #WOOF

title: Great app- wish pro version wasn't so expensive
review: The app is great, I wish more people were on it. You can only see last 15-20 people you talked to, even it they don't respond. You don't have that issue with the pro version but you have to pay every month

title: It's the greatest
review: Scruff is one of the best gay app for meeting people . You are able to talk to people from out-of-state in-state anywhere around we're all really it's like we're all connected now so thank you guys and keep up the good work yours truly.

title: Major Message Bug!!
review: Messages are not showing up!   I'll find that someone has sent me a message only when I open their profile to send THEM one.  And that's just the people with whom I've already been talking.  Usually a red circle shows up on the person'a profile and you receive a message count notice in your profile.  This isn't happening. It's a major bug for a paid app!!!  It needs to be fixed!!

title: Great app but it's losing it's bear focus
review: Love the app and the functionality, but it's losing it's bear focus.  There are a lot of twinks on here, that should be playing on Grindr or in the McDonald's Playland after they finish their Happy Meals.  Scruff Team: keep it bear oriented and I'll keep on using it, but you're starting to worry me.

title: Great app
review: I wish the deleting of conversations were easier now just clearing the messages it would be cool to be able to select the people and just clear them but over all this app is great

title: Reliable and user friendly app.
review: I love this app. It doesn't crash or delete messages like other platforms, and it is always a step or two ahead in terms of features.

title: Preferred App
review: Way better then the other apps. Push notifications and a private album. It also doesn't crop your pictures. And Pro has so many extra useful features.

title: I'm very thankful for this App.
review: Just want to say that I have met so many great friends all over the world from using scruff. I also love the fact that most of the men on here are genuine and don't mind having a conversation and not just about sex like grindr.

title: Won't "upload profile"
review: Okay, this is the absolute worst app ever. It won't even let me sign up properly. I TRY to add my email address when I sign up, it says "enter your email" then underneath, it says "enter age again to confirm". When I do this, it gives me an error that says "Email Error: Please enter the same value in both fields" so I try to do both, and it says "Invalid email address". It does the same thing with the password. This app should be destroyed.

title: app critique
review: I like the fact you have the option to tell the person that you are possibly interested and not just goofing around its all in fun to most but for some it is the only outlet to the lifestyle choice

title: The standard for others to follow
review: Scruff is just hands-down the best mix of technology, features, reliability, and of course, men. Have tried several others and while those are gone from my list of apps scruff remains.

title: Login with email and PW every time?
review: I liked Scruff before we had to enter our email and password on every login.
