I like to logout when I think I'm done chatting, but if I get another message now I have to enter my email and password again to login?  That's a major inconvenience for me, and I'll probably use Scruff way less or not at all because of it.  Change it back to the way it was before (just hitting a login/logout button, no passwords).

title: Not the best.
review: The new updates messed up the whole app. It was a decent app now it crashes from time to time. And all the cool features aren't free anymore. There are some good ideas and solutions in the new update.. But still needs a lot of update. Maybe upgrade the server might help, since there are more ppl using the app. I know only one thing for sure: it's not how it was used to be at the beginning.

title: Greedy new pricing :(
review: I love Scruff and have used it since the first days it came out. But I have to say, c'mon you guys, what's up with new pricing?!? I'd be happy to pay a bit more for extra features, but charging up to $8.98 A MONTH for both features together is just greedy. And each feature independently isn't worth it either. You've got your ads, guys. If you keep up the money grab, you'll lose a lot more folks.  Guess I'll be using Grindr a lot more instead.

title: Nice looking men, bit functionality is not the best
review: Usually nice eye candy in here.  The interface, particularly regarding retrieval of messages or how the "home" page opens without any ability to control whether the pool of images is local or not, could definitely use some improvements.

title: Good app
review: Would give a 5 but the only problem is the nearby option. I live in a small town and there are only 2 other people around. I would suggest changing it to show the 30 closest people or so. Otherwise great app.

title: Better than the other m4m apps
review: It is way better than the other m4m apps. This one allows you to put more in captions....if only other users put more info in

title: No fix 4 hours?
review:
Have to agree...good but frustrating app. Can't/Won't upload pic from library, only will upload pic you take on spot; refresh slow; self profile doesn't show up when searching nearby. Like ck-in, 'do you like' and 'if so we'll let you know'; great match-up feature!

Work out the bug(s) and you've got a good one!

title: Best of the apps
review: Scruff is simply the best of all the the gay hookup apps. The interface is clear and simple to use, the profiles are generally real, and the men are attractive and usually quite laid back. Excellent if you're in the market for a hairier, more muscular, and slightly bigger guy.

title: One of the best!
review: Scruff is one of the best social app out there for gay men!  Easy to navigate and a great selection of some really scruffy guys to either chat up or hook up. Well done to the Scruff boys for making this so great.  While the free version is good, the paid version is great.

title: Always getting better.
review: Met the creators years ago at a RPDR launch event and they were the sweetest set of individuals, what's sets this apart from the other apps is that it continues to get better and interesting where some have fallen boring. There may be some quirks, but that's what makes being gay fun.

title: Good. Could be better
review: It's better than most dating apps but it could be a little cheaper. $14 a month is twice as much as Netflix and they bring all the content. We bring ourselves and pay double. Lol

title: Better than "Brand G"
review: Awesome app. Still a couple of technical flaws tho which is what keeps me from giving it all 5 stars, however I can see the bugs getting worked out. Hopefully they won't start with all the KINDERGARDEN rules, like other similar apps. So far, leaps and bounds better than "Brand G."

title: Need search ability
review:
Why do annoying and LOUD message notifications happen with MUTE on and notifications off?  
Should be able to unlock photos without Pro.

title: Nice app.
review: Certainly a nice app...am a huge fan of the "would you meet..." feature.  However, there does not seem to be anything that happens when "not my type" is selected...as opposed to "maybe" which prompts a you should say hi note or "definitely" which get's a more emphatic note.  Other than that, I enjoy everything else about it!

title: Greed at its finest.
review:
It's bad enough that the app is no longer free, but to split the basic functions that you're now selling into two ridiculously high-priced groups is just pure greed.  

Yes boys, you can have access to all of the features offered in Messaging Pro and Browsing Pro for just $8.98 PER MONTH. And you still get the banner ads within the app. 

Shame on you Scruff for gouging your community and shame on you for your unabashed greed.

title: Good stuff
review: I love the types of guys on this site. The guys are more masculine and less attitude. My main complaint is that it frequently takes a while to reconnect. While that is going on, it is not possible for me to send messages. However, all in all, I find this site very sexy.

title: What's with the reconnect?
review: Was great mow less good - the "reconnecting" thing is unbearable and the access is too limited unless you pay a lot - what's the point? The only thing good is the users and these problems will drive them away

title: Forget Grindr
review: You can do more with Adam4Adam, but Scruff is by far the easiest & smoothest GPS-based phone app. Love the global component. Get the paid subscription so you can keep a private folder of pics & keep messages archived. I'm through with glitchy Grindr that takes forever to load.

title: Love this app - wished it worked better
review: 50% of the time, when I launch Scruff, it freezes my phone. Nightmare. However, the other 50% is a great app. I love the fact that it's focused on the bear community - better than Grindr in my books. Just wish it worked everytime on my phone.....

title: Working at night
review: I enjoy scruff I work nights, I think it works great I just wish people nearby would actually chat. Instead of being caught checking me out a million times maybe they should say hi...

title: Update is horrible
review: Old version navigated much more simply, and more user friendly. Still better than than some other similar apps, but disappointing update.

title: New just to be new
review: This version is not aligned with the visuals of iOS9. It's cumbersome and annoying. Not user friendly and seems to be trying to be another app, when the previous version was working great. I actually deleted the new app, and restored the previous version. I will not be upgrading to this new 5.0 scruff. I sent in a support request and the gave me some cookie cutter response about "sending my feedback to R&D for future updates," aka tough luck.

title: Scruff
review:
Great app for meeting on the web a diverse group of guys from all over the world. The best way for regular gay men to interact globally without pressure to be physical. 
I also think that this site is a good role model for young gay men to see and meet other gay men who are generally some of the nicest guys on the Web.

title: It works!
review: On all levels. The other apps could learn a lot from Scruff. Few glitches, and it doesn't crash or bleed memory. Sometimes my pushy notifications randomly disappear from my lock screen, but that's my only complaint. Keep it up Scruff!

title: Enjoy it!
review: Got me more into scruffy, but don't like that private album has now been restricted to paid subscriptions. None the less I understand I won't pay.  Love that it was on in Mexico too and have spoken to people in Saudi Arabia. Enjoy it for what it is. May it Grow in success, thank you!

title: You get redirected to app downloads even if you don't click anything
review:
I hope this is a bug and not by intention.
But now you don't even have to click on an ad to get spammed.  The app periodically will direct you to the App store for some stupid app download that appears in banner ads… except now you don't even have to tap on the banner ad. There doesn't even have to be an ad on the page you're viewing. It just shuttles you off.
Crap.

title: More cities more friends.
review: Great app, especially with the global view. I have been able to meet some amazing guys in cities besides my own. I have even been able to visit a few of them. It has been great.

title: Scruffilicious!
review:
I like the ability to write and read extended profiles, search by location and RSVP to events.

I hope future upgrades include Grindr-like features to make it easier to send pics, swipe between profiles and load and view more guys with one click.

title: Worst app ever...
review: This app has everything a guy could dream of in a social networking app save one thing: functionality.  Messages disappear into the ether for no reason at all.  It constantly crashes, often not being able to connect.  Text entry is sluggish.  This app doesn't work.  Disappearing messages is the worst feature.  Horrid miscommunication results because of it.  Never come across an app so terrible on a technical level.  Fix it!

title: Ok app
review: Needs a better layout! Plus needs the ability to open as many of others photos and open yours for others without having to close others access to them.

title: Love this app
review: Scruff is one of the easiest apps to use. Full of fun stuff whether you pay or use the free app. Would definitely recommend this to others who are looking to connect as friends or for some fun in the sheets

title: Awesome! Best of its kind
review: Great interface, reliable service, and fun times provided by these folks. Vastly superior to apps like Grindr. Highly recommend. Push notifications, woofing, and reliability make Scruff the app for me!! 😍😭 There's just not enough of you on there!!

title: Great app better than Grindr
review: If you're tired of Grindr's subpar application, spam and consistent censorship for the silliest reasons, this app is a better choice. Plus it seems to be geared for scruffy, bearish and muscular men and the guys who like them. Grindr was the first but in my opinion Scruff is the best.

title: My main app
review:
I have tried Grindr but don't use it anymore because of the technical inconsistencies and too many bots sending me
Messages. 
I have Growlr but I mainly use that bc bars in my city send Shouts about events. 
Scruff is where I go to meet Men!  Peace.

title: BEST features
review: Of all the apps I've tried, the Scruff crowd seems like the best. I love the variety of features and have never had any issues with spam profiles like some other apps. Free version is adequate for most users.

title: Scruff
review: Yes, I like it. If someone shares their picture album, I don't understand why you have to pay for a membership to see a 4th picture. At least you can send pictures in chat.

title: Better than most
review: I like this app better than the other ones. It actually runs the way it should most if the time. I've meet some really great guys on here. True love in is here still up in the air for me. I would recommend this app to my friends.

title: Disciplinary action?
review: I was reported for being under age when I had a tattoo on my chest and nothing hinting that I was young, and I got my account suspended and my device blocked from being able to create another account. Meanwhile, I have found 4 other profiles using my pictures, which I have reported them and theirs are still up. Justice? Load of bull... I get punished for looking young while they impersonate someone and get away with it.

title: Great site
review: I love this app and site, it beats all the others I have tried by a long shot... my only problem is when I look for people who are near me I also get people from hundreds of miles away... they should limit the search area

title: Great App
review: Great app, you find quality guys on here. Much better than a certain other app with invasive popup ads and hornball twinks looking for a hookup every second. Keep it up Jonny, Eric, and the whole Scruff team.

title: It's good but few stupid functions
review:
Now they making you sign in with email and password every time you signed off. But it does not remember you email so you have to type it again. I guess Scruff want you always signed in so it shows more guys are on all the time.
Another is when you turn your distance off, yet it shows on who viewed you listing.

title: The good the bad and the ugly.
review: I like it and it has a nice design. However, I don't like that you have to pay extra for your messages or browse more. It should be one price for extra features. For what we pay now, I don't think it worth it. I have suggested it to friends and they feel the same. Otherwise it's nice.

title: Used to be excellent
review:
Scruff used to be an excellent alternative to Grindr, but they crippled the basic functionality in order to force their overpriced subscription model.  You can't even scroll back but the last few lines of a current chat!  And the constant nag popups are annoying.

I understand there are server maintenance costs associated with running a service, but charging almost 3x per month as much as Grindr Xtra is just greed... Pure and simple.

title: Doesn't crash.
review: The app works well, I can get messages without having to have the app open (See Grindr) and not pay extra. Doesn't crash at all for me on my 7 Plus.
developerResponse: {'id': 2412, 'body': "Thanks for your comments, xrolo98! We're happy to hear that you're enjoying SCRUFF. Thanks for being a valued member of our community. WOOF!", 'modified': '2017-03-28T00:01:37Z'}

title: Great, and getting better.
review: Would love the ability to create events on mobile and invite other profiles or favorites to events. The insight (pro version) are nice, but there could be more - like an option to suggest people based on insight compatibility

title: Cream of the a-hem Crop
review: SCRUFF is BY FAR the best gay app a available today! I'm on Grindr, Growler, Adam4Adam and SCRUFF is the only one that I willingly pay cash money for (PRO membership)... The interface of messaging is convenient. Additionally, I enjoy the MATCH feature. Recently, I became an Ambassador for my city, even.

title: Love it!
review: There is nothing about this app that I do not like. Sure, it changed a bit since I used it last and you need to pay to get certain privileges, but I think it's totally worth it.

title: Really weak
review: So I've had scruff app (no profile) for a while just checking out the dudes. Today I finally decided I want to make a profile. Ever since 6pm the app has been crashing like crazy I can't even open it for 10 seconds before it crashes. Never had this issue before I made a profile.. And I see a yearly pro account is $100 ..that must be a joke.

title: Profile descrimination
review: If you check this app out you will see many guys in their underwear, nude and covering themselves with their hand, ect. After emailing them they said every now and then a photo slips thru their system but I see this often yet when I try and post a fully clothed picture of myself holding my crotch (nothing X rated about the pic at all just for fun) it is rejected. Stay away from this app...Apple should have it deleted.

title: Trimmed up & in top form
review:
Similar to a scruffy (not the fun way) bearded dirty mountain man who went without mirrors for several years, and then then met-up with "Queer Eye For the Str8 Guy". Freshly showered and trimmed making you want to touch this more!

The updates are the best yet.  Others are emulating scruff now.  They led the way, and are the bar to beat!

title: Gr8 app
review: Even though all kindsa guys use this app nowadays, the fact that it was originally made by and for the bear community is why, I think, guys on Scruff are generally nicer and pleasanter than you'll find on some other similar apps. Grindr who??

title: Always good
review: Can easily find fun here thank you Johnny Scruff. App could be made a little better by moving your local people to the first thing you see instead of the third option.

title: By far the best
review: Scruff is by far the best male dating app out there. If you're looking for real men, who have lives and are actually looking for more than just fun (although fun is great) then get this app!! And the membership is definitely worth it!! SO MUCH BETTER THAN GRINDR

title: Works fine...
review: Not a bad app... although sometimes I get push notifications of messages and then when I go to check them they aren't actually there in my inbox. Weird. Doesn't happen too often though...

title: Best cruising app for masc men
review: Better all around than Grindr or any other app, but the best part is how many muscular, hairy, hot men you will find. Great features like recently used photos, private album, search by location, different views and more.

title: Need to allow more pictures
review: Like the app. Just need to allow users to upload more pictures so you can unlock private ones. A search feature would be nice too.

title: Scruff rocks
review:
Love this app.

Suggested improvements: more accurate GPS location!!!, more ways to customize profile (ie: top/bottom/vers), maybe the ability to add more than one pic). Other than these, it's a great way to meet good guys. Keep up the great work!

title: Great socializing App.
review:
Have met some great men on Scruff. I've chatted as far away as China, and as close as my own block. 
Not into hookups as they say, so I can't speak to that aspect. Though I have been propositioned several times.

title: Woohoo Scruff
review: Met my BF on here and 9 months later still going strong.  Still like to make friends and chat so I like that it's not just a cruise site.  Met some nice guys from all over and made some friendships.

title: Solid but needs some tweaking
review: The newest version of Scruff, while visually pleasing, lacks a sense of ease of use. I'm no developer, but it feels laggy and less fluid. But overall it's still a solid application and I find it especially great for meeting people in different cities.

title: Great interface
review: Easy to use and navigate, with plenty of great looking guys to check out! One of the only social apps that I've actually considered getting a paid membership to!
developerResponse: {'id': 134270, 'body': 'Thank you for the feedback! Members like you make the SCRUFF community as great as it is. If you have any questions about a SCRUFF Pro subscription, check out our support article: https://support.scruff.com/hc/en-us/articles/202623364-SCRUFF-Pro-Features. WOOF!', 'modified': '2017-04-11T19:29:44Z'}

title: AWESOME APP
review: I like the app just wish it had more options for the filter option.  Like sorting by type and distance on the basic app.    I would be more likely to upgrade if I knew it really worked.
developerResponse: {'id': 94753, 'body': 'Thank you for sharing your feedback about our Search + Filters function! We will certainly take your suggestions into consideration for future updates. Thanks for being a member of SCRUFF! WOOF!', 'modified': '2017-04-05T15:25:36Z'}

title: Been with Scruff 5 years
review:
Started paying almost from the start. Can't do much without paying. Met some really nice guys from around the world in
Person and will continue to.

title: This app works
review: This app works! Real men use this app, and the people here are more genuine than on other services. The new features are quite useful, and the interface makes sense. I have met some great guys using this app!

title: Nicely done app for the gay man
review:
Really like this app which delivers what is expected.   Most definitely this is good for hooking up, chatting, or just people watching. 

Always use it when traveling out and about... for obvious reasons.

Has some great features if you're willing to sign over your first born ;-)  Can’t believe that TouchID is a paid option, and that Apple approved it’s feature being charged for — other than they get a 30% of app subscription fees.

Wish there was a mid-tiered pricing level, however, if there were that's probably the only option users would subscribe to.

Would be better if you could opt to have the users who you've designated 'not-my-type' to >not< appear in the browsing grid.

If you're willing to pay the ridiculously high subscription rate, it has a blend of all the best features of other similar apps.

title: Decent
review: The ads ads annoying. And everything requires a paid membership but not bad otherwise.

title: New travel section is horrible
review: This new version had a travel section that looks great but does not function. You can only put in pre-programmed major cities. If you want to update your travel to smaller cities or even capital cities of some countries (there is now Montevideo, Uruguay but there is Buenos Aires, Argentina). Another app I use allows me to put in any travel location.

title: Great interface
review: Love the new interface.  Easy to view pics in messages, easy to use and very intuitive.  The old interface kind of sucked, so I'm glad you upgraded it.

title: It is what it is...
review: Another medium for meeting local/likeminded men whether you're home, out 'n about or traveling. Just like anything else people have their own agenda, but unlike in person you have the option of blocking them if you choose.

title: Great App!!
review: Though the Messaging & Browsing Pro are great options. I think it's a little (a lot actually) much to pay almost $10/month. That's crazy. Other than that, it's not a bad app. Stupid you have to pay to see your conversation history.

title: Strong ap. 4.5 Stars
review: Great features, but a little buggy. Compared to other aps like it, it is superior. BUT I need a way to edit check-in places. Also, badges don't always show up correctly when I have a message.

title: Ok for a free app
review: For a free app, I think it's decent.  There's too many limited features unless you buy the paid version.  This app will ban u if u post a photo that isn't even offensive. This app review wouldn't accept a 2 star rating.

title: Pretty good
review: The monthly fee for the Pro version is a little high and the interface could use larger thumbnail pics, especially the iPad version, but it's a great app to meet new people and see who's in the neighborhood.

title: App is awesome
review: Just please fix it. It says I cannot connect to scruff. I cannot even edit my profile picture without an error happening. Please fix it. I just got serious with someone on this app.

title: Great app to meet men!
review: I use this in each city I've been and have met some nice men. Also cool you can talk to men all over the world.  Spoke to guy from London for months and actually met him when he flew to Houston.  Awesome!  Now looking for LTR, but can't hurt to have fun along the way!

title: Great App.
review: Scruff is a great way to meet guys, regardless of what you're looking for. It's a more diverse crowd than you'll find on other apps, and the guys I've met on Scruff have generally been great. This is one if my favorite apps and a great way to kill time.

title: Scruff #1
review: Great app, reliable, User Interface is straight forward and easy to understand. I can't rate customer service as I've never needed it unlike the other social programs! Scruff Pro is a great app! Thank You Scruff Team! #1

title: Stuck on install
review: The latest update stalls about 10% in and won't reset even after a reboot. Great app when it works. Would be nice to be able to choose profile photos from your private collection instead of always having to go to your phone's photo album.

title: Best men
review:
no question, on this site are men in play and men who are building networks of friends or shared  interests. each man gives their highest and best. honestly it is the only way to compete. 

there are days when I need to hook up and discerning who is game can be delicate.

title: Could be better
review: Someone will soon come up with a better app that does not required I many screen taps and which actually has a larger keyboard   Also sometimes the ap shows you online after you log off.  But at least it is better than grindr

title: Love this app
review: Scruff has to be the best app available! I have net so many great friends in a community of my own! Thank you for having something for me to look forward too!!

title: Fun APP!
review: This is a great app and I've met some really nice guys on here! The graphics are good and it has nice features. However, it seems with every update, there are more and more things to pay for. I know the basic app is free, but Scruff wants u to pay monthly unlike other apps that have a fee but only a one time fee! Seems a little greedy!

title: He's just not that into me cause he can't find me!!!
review: Just not enough guys to meet. Not the fault of the app other than advertising. I'd suggest taking a look at locations outside major metro areas. I live almost 4 hours outside NYC; do the guys here even know about this great site?

title: Only app I have subscription
review:
This is the best app out there to communicate and get in touch with guys across the globe.
Don't normally subscribe for app's if they are also free available. But I like SCRUFF so much that I did got myself a subscription

title: Sneaky and user unfriendly
review: I subscribed a long time to Pro... But half the time my pro benefits were completely ignored -- id get messages likes "you need pro to do that." Then when I upgraded they changed what " Pro" meant and took my money but offered me intentionally Fewer benefits requiring a higher level of pro for more money for the basics.... The No pro app version is embarrassingly user unfriendly and deceptive .... Hate this app and their sleazy business practices

title: This leaves Grindr in the dust
review: Scruff has so many great features, it's a shame so many people still exclusively use Grindr. Although, the people that use scruff are generally nicer/smarter than Grindr users, so maybe it's ok they still use Grindr ;)

title: Best Gay App hands down.
review: Constantly updated, never crashes, and tons of features. Best of all, it has a huge user base. Easily the fastest growing and one of the largest gay app communities. I'm eager to see it over take the current most popular one.

title: Best app so far!
review: Absolutely love the interface and the way the app is set up! Only thing i would like to see is lower subscription costs... But still kicks any other dating/meeting apps out of the park! ;)

title: Push notifications
review: Push notifications used to work way better before. Deleted it and I still do not get notified when new messages come through. Settings are set up accordingly.

title: Getting popular, getting expensive, but still the best
review: This is still the best app for meeting guys of a certain 'style'. The new features continue to make for a better experience. Thanks guys!

title: Pay to see pictures?
review:
Pretty expensive app just to see pictures.   I say boycott and see if the price goes away!!!

When signing into the program I generally see people that were on hours ago.  If the app did not display all the people that were on after an hour or so it would be easier to chat with people now not wait for a response from some that was on 24 hours ago.

title: Keeps getting better
review: Each version has more features and does an even better job than the prior. The app just keeps getting better.

title: Scruff is pretty awesome
review: I like the feeling of Scruff much better than some of the other gay meetup apps and it comes through in the guys that use it. The interface is very usable. I'd be happy to pay a one-time fee for premium service, but not monthly.

title: Great App but it gets lamer by the sec
review: It's becoming one of those pay-if-you-want-to-see-or-use-this-feature apps. Lately, it's been having serious launch issues--the app just crashes around 100 times before it logs in. Late message reception and their subscription rates and plans are a bit wonky. I would pay, but you gotta fix all these issues first.

title: Love the app, but....
review: Bug problems with favorites, but especially with messaging.  Messages not going through and not being received... Or being received days later.  Please fix :)

title: Greedy
review: At the beginning it was a great concept and good choice for cute bears but by the time is passing the developer is taking out options for the menu and he wants us to pay high prices, are you guys serious charging two fees for different things?, plus the prices are ridiculous, grindrX has one fee and that's it, if you want to become a new rich guy, hold your horses and be reasonable, this is a geo location app not the jewel of the crown....

title: Johnny's review
review: Scruff is the BEST gay social networking site! I'm a bit of a bear myself...thin, but furry, and I'd always shaved my entire body, cause I didn't like it, and most of my gay friends were smooth! I found Scruff, and learned to love my hair, so now I'm just a sexi hairy country boi! Thank you Scruff!

title: Not worth the extra costs!
review: The same guys as on Grindr, which is free or cheaper (Grindr X). Jack'd is way more sophisticated, and totally free. Radar (adam4adam) is totally free. Paying extra to see the history of a conversation is the dumbest thing I have ever seen.

title: Great app / service , but lacks navigational comfort.
review: Great, u find what you're looking for, but when it comes to answering mags, deleting them and browsing through profiles, it turns into a touch screen workout. Too many steps to get something done and move to the next.

title: APP doesn't even work half the time...
review: ...messages don't go through, or it tells you the message didn't go through when, in fact, it did.  Server is down more often than it is up.  I realize it's a free app, but for the amount of times I've accidentally clicked the 'strategically placed' advertisements, I think I've made you some dough.  Fix the server issues, PLEASE!

title: Gratefully twink-free app, but buggy!
review: Enjoy it for the most part, but it seriously needs some fine tuning. Couldn't log in at all in past 12 hours, reset phone and now any msgs, faves, woofs from past 20 days are gone! Needs fixing asap! Please don't leave me stuck with tedious and petty grindr!

title: Best out there...but
review: This is probably the best of its breed out there. No spam like some of the other apps. It has great features (although I wish they'd get rid of the Match feature and revert back to what was there before). Subscribing is relatively expensive also...

title: Gold standard
review:
The UI is the gold standard for
M4M social networking. My only wish is that the seamless was of this app could be combined with the broad user base of that other - crash happy,  bot plentiful, message losing - app!  Great job here - keep it up.

title: Great app
review: Better than most of the other apps and worth paying for.  Lots of information on profiles and excellent layout.  New upgrades put it over the top.

title: Downgrade
review:
I previously rated this app 5 stars but had to downgrade it due to all the splash ads that seem to appear every time I open it. You can only clear them from the message screen. 

I find this very irritating considering I pay for a premium membership to avoid ads. If this continues, I won't be renewing my premium membership. I'll use the free version.

title: Massive Improvements
review: Really great work paying attention to the needs of its users; great flow, and the new filters are amazingly helpful in locating a match. I love seeing the "most woofed" -- total eye candy. The best app of its kind out there.

title: Absolutely over done HORRIBLE UPDATE
review:
This is absolutely a perfect example of packing way too many unnecessary features into something that was very simple and efficient. 

What was once a single tap to execute has now become multiple taps, swipes don't work like they should searches don't save them produced in correct value.

There are sort of options that are absolutely ridiculous and unnecessary.

Wait to screw up a perfectly good application Scruff creative team. Hello Grindr.

title: Really bad redesign
review: This new version is ALL about Scruff wanting to get guys to upgrade to the paid version. Every change is for the worse. Don't upgrade if you can avoid it. Ugh.

title: Good app for general purposes
review: Don't use the app much but out of the other available gay apps, this seems to be one of the most interesting much. Doesn't hardly crash, better looking dudes on here, and it's good for whatever I want to use it for. Overall, pretty rad.

title: Site is addictive
review: I enjoy the membership, because it allows you to see an unlimited number of guys, and see all their nudes. I love it!  Am I the only one that's inspired to travel more because of this ap?

title: Unhappy
review:
So not only do they charge but they make it almost impossible to discontinue the automatic renewal. Then in reading what you sign up for you are tracked, can't get a refund, must go through apple to cancel the automatic renewal, and just an overall trash job of being accountable

Fyi account is still active bc I can't cancel so hopefully this post gets someone's attention. 

I do not recommend this app to anyone ever at all.

title: Yeah...
review: Sure I've gotten laid from it many times but the design of it can be kinda confusing and there's a few technical issues they could work out. But really, if you're someone interested in this app, I HIGHLY doubt reviews are going to mean much lol

title: Love the features!
review: Great, friendly guys and a really easy to use, full featured app. I love the unusual features like "insights" which show you if the person is likely to respond to you, based on your profile

title: Better then Grindr
review: This app allows u to pick a city to meet other guys! Premium features are great just wish I had swipe feature. Overall great app and doesn't freeze or crash like other apps.

title: Scruff - it's not an amazing App when the server is unstable and constantly going down . Rem
review: It's an amazing app. It still needs a lot of work. I'm really frustrated that my messages are not coming through !!! Grrrrrrrrrrrrrrrrr. The push notifications aren't in real time. Two and three hours later I get a message. Why am I paying for this app when it's not working the way its supposed too.  And it loads very slowly. Fix it please PLEASE!!!!

title: Great Update & New Features !!
review: Love the check-in feature & nice to see global & nearby studs!! Dislike that I would have to pay for extra features! All in All = Totally Worth It ! Love the Notes Option Now !!

title: Great app!
review: I've met some great guys on scruff and even made some lifelong friends. Fewer glitches and more reliable than any other app of its kind. Looking forward to the next update which allows video!

title: Now must pay for albums
review: New version has some nice new features (the unread message badge that appears on the profile is great, and the new woofs indicator), but now you have to go Pro to see all of someone's album. Less functionality after upgrading: not very customer friendly.

title: Great APP
review: I really like this app! I've had more dates using scruff than any other app. I've made some nice friends too! It works well , has never crashed on me. I like how scruff has a comrade of followers  with local events to boost.

title: Pass the time
review: Consistent app that is good for passing time. The majority of guys seem to think its strictly a "hook-up" app but there are those of us who use it to try and meet and get to know people. Show some respect for different peoples's needs mates.  It's a big world out there and not everyone is interested in becoming you next conquest

title: Needs a few improvements
review: "Would you meet?" Feature needs to be more obvious and have an alert that pops up when someone says maybe or definitely. Also ability to load more profiles grouped by distance, and refresh new attendees by distance.

title: 100% better then crappy Grindr
review: I have to say I like that it mostly only shows me guys online and not people that logged off 2 days ago ( ala Grindr) and I don't have the issues like I do with crappy Grindr app.

title: New update
review:
Thanks scruff your new update asked for a password which i haven't had to use for the entire year i have been on scruff. Now i am locked out and cant access it at all. Thanks for the screw job. There is no longer even info for contacting them if you can't log i
 So am holdind a useless ap that i pay for but cannot access. I will be calling my  bank and stopping my pay
Ent to the crooks who run this site!

title: Recommended app
review: This is one of the better apps, to get. The only thing I don't particularly care for us that 'woofs' are visible before 'views.' My trivial/minor detail. But none the less recommended!

title: Less buggy than other apps
review: To be honest, of all the gay social apps, this one is the least buggy and a lot better in format than any of the others.

title: Where the guys are
review: I love Scruff because this is where I find the men I want to meet, and we wouldn't all be on this platform if it weren't effective and nicely designed. I urge the devs to keep working to make it ever better.

title: Expensive for little...
review: I'm loyal, however... Price went up, quality of navigating became more complicated and requested "tools" are still not added. The restriction for non-paying browsers are not inviting and the money charged for the unnecessary features is too steep: missing out on attracting a large audience out there...

title: TERRIBLE LOOKING UPDATE
review: Why is it app developers have to totally redesign something that was already attractive and worked?? There was nothing wrong with the old layout of Scruff. It was an orderly and easy-to-use interface that set Scruff apart from other apps. Now it looks like all the other garbage apps... YES to improvements but NO to completely changing the layout and appearance.

title: Best app For gay
review: Scruff is the only app so far Absolutely worthy to spend money for. It always work perfectly and it's the easiest app to share pics location and you have space enough to write something about you. Scruff is the only app I use to dating.

title: Great app
review: Super fun app but really needs to update to 6 and 6plus compatibly. Could use a refresh to the UI or updates and would love to see larger profile pics on the grid.  I have paid for over a year and will keep using this app I just would hope the updates come soon.  Thank you.

title: Forced Review
review:
Reviews should be optional, not forced. This the first app of its kind I've tried so I don't have anything to compare it to.
It would be nice if it only showed individuals from my preference categories so people don't have to weed through profiles of individuals who aren't going to be interested in you due to race, age or preferences.

title: Disappointed
review:
Reading most of the reviews I'm sorry to say
that this app has seen its day. Very disappointing from most and apparently they really don't care from the looks of it

title: Greed has overcome service.
review: I've used Scruff for a few years now. I would have gave it a 5-star rating until it's makers became so dadgum shamelessly greedy by hacking away at basic services like saving a picture that someone sent to you unless you pay the ridiculously high price of $100+ a year for their elitist level version. That's insane… shame on you Scruff. You could sell many more at a more reasonable price.

title: No other gay app....
review: Will ever beat Scruff. I've met some great guys, and two that I've become close friends with several hundred miles away. When we met in person, it was like I've known them my entire life! Great app 😃

title: Amazing!
review: Best app for gay hookups and bf material. I have other apps but this one is the one that works the best. Easy to use, fast load of the profiles, pro version has more features and controls but is not expensive

title: Give & Take
review: Great app overall, but too many options only available to subscription members.  One thing being able to turn off mail notifications over night.

title: Scruff
review: Decent base functionality.  Better as a social app than grindr, and the clientele seems to believe in showing faces, at least somewhat, which is a plus.  Subscription option is much too expensive to be interesting.

title: Favorite hookup app
review: Of all the iPhone gay hookup apps this is my favorite with multiple pictures and advanced filters that Grindr doesn't have.  Wish it had the saved phrases feature of Grindr though

title: They get paid well you get ____!
review: Great app for having a great time with some very wonderful people. I recommend this for everyone enjoys themselves and other people who also want to enjoy themselves.

title: Meeting in 2012
review: A good app, which should produce more in- person meets than it does. Whether that is just the nature of hooking up, dating, or making friends on social media in 2012 is a problem among gays in general, or in some way encouraged by the app's features is still a mystery to me.

title: Great Features and Reliability.
review: Doesn't shut down like the other apps. Has better photo options and better cropping and sizing. Love the private album feature.

title: Good Times
review:
It's never going to stop amazing me how many things we have in common with people all around the world.

The app crashes from time to time, but it's hardly anything to worry about.

review:
More space to describe yourself; to give more details about who you are, what you're looking for, etc. 

Also, seems to attract a better caliber of men. I definitely use this app more than Grindr.

title: It does what I need it to do.
review: The free version works fine for me, and compared to other social networking apps, there is a lot more profile space, which I like.

title: Woooof !!!
review:
Super App !   Really Great.  Fine Friend Finder.  
However, could be better. 
Saved conversation thread is too short, like 10 lines !?!   And goggling thru the photos should be easier. Should zip through ( like Grindr has ). 
But, a Fun app all and all.  Hours of Fun !   Bears Otters n Cubs. Oh Yeah.

title: Awesome app! 
review:
I've used all those other apps for gay social networking.... This one is by far the best... It's more about who I am and what I'm looking for on a potential partner!!!!
 Great job  johnny scruff!!! Keep up the great job....
Tnx again,
 Gagigroop 

title: Not quite half bad 

The principal behind Scruff is great. Manly bud next door are just my type. Great way to find men that are actually approachable if you're not 25 and hairless!
Just wish they could fix the lack of a fully functioning push function. Having to constantly cheek in to see if I have a message is maddening.

title: Cheesy in a Good Way
review: Yea, so you can "woof" at guys either in your area or around the world; start up chats. Only complaint I have is that you can't see more than one photo of someone unless they "unlock" their photos to you personally. Otherwise, great app.

title: Best of its kind!
review: I've tried almost every free gay dating app available and this one is awesome. It's easy to use and finding interested hotties is so easy. I can't believe it hasn't earned more stars overall. What's wrong with everybody?

title: Not angry... SAD!
review: I wish I would have read the reviews and warnings about the upgrade. Now, I've lost ALL if the awesome guys I had saved in my favorites that I've enjoyed chatting with from all over the world. Even with the ridiculous pricing, you'd have thought they'd at least find a way for guys to keep in contact with their favorites. I feel that this is an epic fail! And I'm sad that I don't know if I'll find my friends again. :-(

title: Enjoyable
review: I enjoy this app very much.  Seems to attract down to earth guys and have met some goods ones on here.  It's slow to refresh( that gets old) but other than that it's fun.  Go Scruff Go!

title: I love Scruff!
review:
This app is great when you travel!
People are so friendly and it's so user friendly!
I have made so many new friends and him been able to keep in touch with them, on SCRUFF!

title: Needs Improvement
review: Decent app—I'm glad so many people use it—but until they update it for the iPhone 6/6+ I can only give it 3 stars—it's been over a year since the new resolutions have been available. Once that change is made I'd gladly subscribe—till then it's a 3 star app that I'll use for free.

title: Better than most
review: Appreciate the free view of those who have viewed your profile. I wish when opening the ap the home screen would be local instead of world view.

title: Easy to use
review: Much better than grindr. Better options more guys and easier interface that actually works.

title: Broken & Dated
review: After downloading the most recent updates, including that half-assed blatant ripoff of Tindr (what a revolutionary idea, guys), the app no longer opens on my ipad. I've excused the hideously outdated UI and clunky UX, but it's hard to ignore the fact that the app won't open. Also, the premium service is laughable. I shouldn't have to pay an absurd amount just to make this app enjoyable. Such a greedy practice that isn't remotely consumer-friendly.

title: Disappointing Update
review:
The latest version with Scruff Match isn't ready for prime time. First, there has been functionality deleted and moved. There is no longer a "Wants to meet you" option on the Global grid. The "Would you like to meet" buttons no longer have 3 options. 

Finally, crashes are now regular occurrences. It just simply fails the most critical function of operating!

title: Much better...
review:
...than Grindr.

If Scruff can keep from crashing every 10 minutes and doesn't lose your messages, why can't others?

title: Better communities = better experience
review:
Social apps are only as good as the people using them. 

Scruff has a community that tries to maintain cohesion. More over, the mechanism that shows how often someone responds.

title: Hot stuff
review: Definitely the best place to meet guys of all ages, types, preferences for casual friendly contact. (I can't address how it handles looking fir an LTR.) Very easy to connect and to leave it be if you like. Good access to photo files.

Love this APP! And all the hot scruffy guys in it. Needed a change after twinks invaded Grindr. Have made a ton of new friends and had my share of "love" encounters. Not mention Johnny Scruff and his team are a sexy bunch! Gladly love to support them and what they do for our community!

title: What is wrong with this thing?
review: I just got this app. It'd be wonderful if it worked properly. About every 30 seconds it will automatically open the App Store and go directly to Candy Crush. This happens no matter what I'm doing on it. After about three minutes it gets really annoying! Because of this it's kind of unusable.

title: All kinds of Scruffy Hairy Sexy Goodness
review: Title says it all. I love coming on here and meeting new people, chatting with old friends, and drooling over the guys in Most Woofed.  The updates helped tremendously. My goal is to be on the most woofed. Lets see where I am in a year.

title: hit and miss
review: it is a good concept, but they used updates to cripple features, in a shameful attempt to supplement their advertising revenues w/ overpriced subscriptions. managing the the overwhelming amount of people trying to converse with you is a bit challenging too. there is no way to make some higher or lower priority, and you can often lose a chat unless you use one of your limited favorites to save a person... they should offer better features at a reasonable price if they want subscribers. like verified personhood and better chat management features.

title: Great app
review: This app is much better than any of the others out there, grindr, zoosk, whatever app you have, get rid of it and stick to this one. It gets better and better with every update.

title: Bad Pricing
review: Perry St, perhaps you're trying to pay for your dev costs for 4.0, but let's not pass on that cost to us. I agree with a previous poster who outlined that since the increase has gone up by 44%, it's just too much. The price we were paying per month before was reasonable for an app. Let's keep that in mind - there isn't a web based UI that we can also use, it's merely an app. It is unreasonable to charge this much.

title: Better than grinder!
review: Way better than grinder! Grinder holds messages for a week then they show up all at once! Love the global tab and being able to plug n an address for search.

title: Great app
review: Enjoy the guys on here and the functionality. Wish message history was longer on the free app.  Also wish there was a way to save some info about favorites. (name number etc)

title: So much better
review: Beat my head on the wall with Grindr a couple of times and then found Scruff. Much nicer interface, easy to use, reliable.

review:
app is good--MUCH better than grindr. plus guys seem more real on here. 

cons: getting to a message is convoluted, and feel like there's no notification when there's mutual interest noted. 

otherwise this app is great and functional.

title: It's ok
review: It was a good app before the update, but now you stuck with the same guys within your area it's like each phone has a certain group all the time. My friend and I compare the near by searches, we are standing next to each other and he has a totally different set of guys. So what's the point in paying the extra money. It's cheaper and more exciting driving to another city to find guys.

title: Free
review: Def should be free. Friend bought it, not worth getting the pro... Basically the same thing. You just see more. But if u reload everything - you get more too? Either be free or just not be free anymore. Overall I like it. Lol

title: Love the theme
review: It just needs more bears. The app let's you see who's looked at your profile and allows you to check out other cities.

title: Love it except...
review:
Stop refreshing so much. I want, desire, need, to peruse the men on my own time. Is that not hitting your servers kind of hard, unnecessarily?

It does crash a bit but I'm using it a lot. 

The check in doesn't work all the time, but that's an extra on top of all of the fine men.

title: Best gay social networking app out there
review: This software engineers of this app take their time to make sure that you are happy with your experience. So much better than just browsing through a catalogue of headless torsos.

title: It's free. But if I paid for the upgrade I would be upset.
review: The platform is really confusing and the new home screen I care nothing about. Maybe I use scruff for different reasons.  Lots of headless gays out there too. Overall I use it for entertainment and to find local gays when I travel. They know where to go and where to stay away from.

title: Best App
review: Love this app. I'm not promiscuous, I'm just very friendly. It allows me to be extra friendly and meet other super friendly guys. And we can sometimes get a group of friends going on. Thanks Scruff.

title: Blah
review: Scruff gets two stars.  One for the fact that it has a high uptime history and the other for the name. Other than those two things the app is lackluster, doesn't do anything useful without purchasing the pro version, is poorly laid out, they added advertisements sent to your mail and the monochromatic black and white color scheme is boring.

title: Needs a few things but great app!
review: Pro is far too expensive. Start charging three or four bucks a month, I'll sign up. If bear is an option, otter should be too!

title: Best gay social app on the market!
review:
Hands down. The functionality, features, and paid content (not to mention the quality of guys!) makes this app second to none.

-the huntsman

title: mostly good
review: The app is mostly good, except for the annoying "tips" popups. think this is new after the recent upgrade. keep coming even if you have them turned off in settings. otherwise works well, many nice guys, much better than the meat market grindr

title: Nice features and friendly men
review: Scruff is pretty easy to use, has great features compared to similar apps, and interestingly, most of the guys who use it to connect with others are generally friendlier.

title: Ruff
review: Ummm, mine is loading 70% of the time, always having to restart my phone to get something to work. They are always consistent in their ability to badger people to rate them. There.

title: Too expensive
review: Beware of charging to much. Some one will come in behind you and take all of us with them to their new site. Reminds me of the bar that starts charging a cover.  They don't last !!!  Sale merchandise to make money. And I noticed all the bad reviews are taking off the list.     Scruff equals. Enougff.    I have noticed Growlr taking off.  Alot more guys starting to go their.

title: Supreme Geolocating 'Networking' App
review: Platform allows enough info for good background, voice and convo/flirting. Users are scruffalicious, kind, and real. Woof function a blessing for acknowledging hotness around the world. Just wish there was a 'Partnered' blocker.

title: Good
review: I like this app hot manly men with intelligence..... well... From my experience. I would recommend it. And the only reason ppl say it's better than grindr is because your not cute enough to be on grindr. Boom.

title: "woof"
review: Much better than Grindr. I love the "woof" feature which is a good way to break the ice. Love chatting with people all over the world. Have made some cool new friends I can't wait to visit soon.

title: Album share
review: I like the most recent update, however occasionally hit "share album" by mistake on the screen.. There should be a second screen pops up that says "are you sure?".

title: Amazing :)
review: Finding love, lust, a fling or your next bang has never been easier. How about a "stay away psycho" button? Also it would be nice to have a one time charge rather than monthly charge .

title: Better than grindr
review: More bear types - and bear admirers - and with less attitude than grindr. Can search other cities by name or zip and it's tolerant of IM's coming in without interrupting typing your Scruff message.

title: Great site!
review: I really enjoy the insights on this app. Helps you know a little more about a guy before contacting him.  The sight is visually appealing and easy to navigate. Would recommend it to all men looking for some fun.

title: A great way to meet people in a new city
review: Love Scruff. Been a member less than a year. Pro membership is totally worth the investment. I'd highly recommend this app to anyone moving or visiting a new city wanting to meet other gay men!

title: Battery drainer
review:
Since the app got the new look, I have cut back my time using it as the battery of my iPhone is drained excessively fast. 
Additionally, the new automatic filters by time makes harder to browse searching for a specific user. Those filters should be optional in one of the settings of the app.
Very frustrated about the battery consumption. 😳😪😓

title: Great app
review: ..just wish that the thumbnail preview of guys wouldn't need to change if I'm browsing offline and decide to then change my status. It's so annoying losing someone just because I wasn't online at the time. Grrrr!

title: Love this app!
review: very hot guys...but I liked the maybe feature and the ability to see a grid of all guys interested in me.  Would love to have those back!  Otherwise, the app is great.

title: Upgrade and Lose!
review: If you can pay, great! As a free member, I lose features every time I upgrade. I previously have really enjoyed the app. It has been a great one. Scruff seems to take more free features away with each upgrade . If unable to pay for the great features of the app, then forget it.

title: Woof!
review: Few glitches, but they are usually fixed with the next update. Just wish some of the features you are asked to pay for were basic.

title: Worlds better the Grindr
review: This app is more user friendly and not as restricted. More pics, better chat lay out. I like the match option. Better profile set up.

title: Bands Make Me Dance!
review: The Investors at Scruff are rolling, at the expense of the products; as all users are used, we are the commodity. The greed machine is cranking; i.e. no more free pics to save in direct messages. There is plenty of chit-chat, and little to no action. Dudes need to put their money where their fingers go to type out. There are a few diamonds, yet mostly just coal. Coal includes plenty of cheaters, open relationships, and headless torsos. Gas mask not included in this tile war of Angry Birds. Good luck!

title: Totally awesome
review:
I found the app to be very interesting. 
The people are great and it's opened up many channels of communication. 
You don't need to hook up to make the acquaintances of some if the most beautiful people in the world thanks to SCRUFF!!!

title: Woof!
review: For me now is scruff is more convenient than any other gay app.! But lately I'm always getting a location error message which it's bothering me and I hope you guys fix it soon. Good job 👍

title: Scruff App
review: Excellent app, newest release, has all the issue I had found with previous versions corrected haven't found any issues with this latest release. Great job guys.

title: Unique and Accurate
review: I have found this dating profile to be more detailed, faster and precise - over Grindr and many others.  Check it out

title: I think scruff is gone
review: Can't open the app and their website no longer comes up for a server status.  Too bad because I liked scruff.  Not many twinks.

title: They just lost it....
review:
This app forgot what it was all about to make a little extra money... 
I remember when it started it was a heaven for the real bear community and it's admirers now it's full of self centered muscle craving junkies that are completely disrespectful to the people that were there to support the app take off the ground....

May Johny scruff and scruff's creators be happy with what ever it is they squeezed out o the site... I'm taking my business elsewhere ... Have fun guys

title: Trying to log on is frustrating
review: Don't get me wrong, it's still a great app for meeting and chatting. However it takes multiple attempts to just sign in to the thing. Growlr and Grindr only need one attempt to log on. This app takes anywhere from 5 to 28 tries. I know, I tallied them one evening. So until I can log on to this app on my first try I'm giving it 1 star. Because if you can't get on how will you ever get off?

title: "Inexperienced marketers and greed sink App"
review:
The new app is very flashy. Lots of buttons and dizzying backdrop of the logo.  Functionality is not new, just moved around. 

Cost-based features exist on similar apps for $3-$4 monthly, NOT $9 !!!

Less functionality. Pricing is completely out of line.  Similar web-based apps don't even charge this much.  Users can pay for credits but can't use them. Don't take money for options you can't deliver. 

Documentation is non-existent. 

This version was developed in a vacuum. For such a major release, user input should have been solicited.  Egos have obviously gotten in the way and the developers have lost sight of the consumer. This is terrible. 

A great app is spiraling into the toilet.

title: Great app
review: I downloaded scruff forever ago and then just never got on. Got back on a few months ago and discovered how good of an app it is. Great way to meet people and decide what you want to do from there. Very friendly people on the app.

title: Where's all the scruff

review: I have gotten to most hook-ups with this app than any other app! This is the only app where I would actually PAY for memebership etc.

title: Social media fun, spam bad
review:
I have always loved learning about other cultures and how people live their everyday lives. Hornet’s Feed section, until recently, has been a way to get a glimpse of this especially in Asia, Russia, and South America.  That part is wonderful.   The last 3 months or so I get 3 or 4 stings a day from OBVIOUS fakes generated by Hornet.  I guess they think we are stupid. Over 3500 follows on a profile that was created today?  

Posting in my feed about this results in the post disappearing.  Replying to this profile with the question results in the message disappearing... 

Image search on google usually finds the profile pictures belong to someone on Instagram or similar.. 

Hornet has gone bad and the way they are doing it is SO OBVIOUS that I question why.  What do they stand to gain, unless the app itself is malicious?  I’m sad because browsing the Feed section has become my morning cup of tea activity, but I am seeing a sharp drop in activity there so by by hornet.

title: FAKE PROFILES
review: A nice idea though I don’t see the need to categorize the chats as they are. The main problem are the fakes; at best they waste time, but at worst they’ll scam you out of money and potentially your identity. I don’t know if that’s really possible, but I’m sure lots of folks enable location tags on pics and I know one’s email is linked to many apps, including bank apps. Even if that isn’t a problem, Hornet needs to do more. If I, a user, can find where the same photo has been used in three profiles, then surely a tech company can do the same- and I’ve reported quite a few profiles. I have a photo storage app that automatically identifies and collates pictures of people; why does Hornet do that? I’ve been chatted up by no fewer than FIFTEEN fake scammers in one week. Hornet does offer nice advice on instant protestations of love and “too good to be true” issues, and boy do these fakes deliver there. Military, on a mission but coming home soon, maybe a dog or two... strange though, that a guy supposedly born and raised in the states can’t type in English. It’s more than just grammatically poor, it’s absolutely incomprehensible. Hornet needs to find a way to weed these out somehow. I’ll be deleting my account soon, but I’ve started having fun messing with the fakers’ minds a bit. If all I can find are fakes, I don’t need it.

title: Spammy app
review: Lot of fake profiles on these “LGBTQ+” social networking apps. I just recently uncovered a profile on this app using my friend’s photos. It was definitely not my friend and he confirmed it. Of course the fake user was making political discourse... I really think these “LGBTQ+” social apps might be an attempt to make identity politics out to be more popular than it truly is. I used to be more progressive minded, as were a number of my friends, but when you see most real LGBTQ+ people in person are nothing like on these “LGBTQ+” social networks (whom the media doesn’t seem to publicize as much as they do the “elites”), you realize there’s something off about the ebb and flow of these internet social networks. But then this is just for cyberloafer people without real jobs that moreso waste their time online. This is where the propaganda for identity politics flows. In my own experience, I think the discrete political movement to try to propagate our LGBTQ+ community are falling apart, which is good. Their little elite failure groups only have the Internet. All the rest of us are live in person and not buying it. If this wasn’t true, then these app developers would fix the spam problem, but obviously they could care less, and We the LGBTQ+ People are aware of all the fake internet posers.

title: Scammer Site/Don’t Download/Don’t Join This Sote
review: I’ve been on this site for a few years.  But all of sudden in the past two months pretty much everyone who is approaching me are scammers.  It starts with photos from attractive 20somethings, and leads to asking you to go Google Hangouts so chat is taken off this site. So far it is always someone from Africa/Togo to be clear, impersonating someone in the US Military.  Several times it has led to asking me to send them a phone as theirs isn’t working well, but they seem to be communicating fine from their phone, to claims they are in Afghanistan and have an ulcer from the food on Base and are looking for help funding their off-Base restraint bill.   In all cases it was easy to see the unsophisticated deception as the person on the other end isn’t really talking proper English.  Their texts are often off grammar, miss basic Americanisms that anyone would easily type. One of these was Bradley Davidson another today was Kokey Wagner....I’ve blocked them but for what I can see this site is 100% fake people and as they aren’t monitoring this may be helping scammers to take advantage of you.

title: Among the Worst Gay “Social” Apps
review:
Seriously ranks among the worst gay “social” apps ... only download this if you want your in-box to be constantly hit with messages from bots advertising other websites and apps ... oh, and the paid advertising messages too.

Tragic and horrible and a waste of time - the developers clearly have no filters in place to detect fake / spam accounts and asking users to police accounts for them is a joke ... after flagging 25 profiles and deleting / blocking spam messages, now I’m barraged with messages from the “moderator” thanking me for reporting and that they’ve identified the problem and fixing it.

Too late! This morning’s latest onslaught of spam messages - deleting my profile and uninstalling! Wish I could give less than 1 star - DON’T WASTE YOUR TIME WITH HORNET ... guess I’ll stick with the original, old school Grind’r

title: Sadly loaded with scam artists
review: Used to be awesome for meeting people nearby, but sadly now loaded with scam artists from a few foreign countries, who have no idea how conspicuous they are. Still good for eye candy. Not giving up on other types of candy, either, but all the "joined yesterday and now messaging you from 7 thousand miles away to tell you how badly I want an LTR" guys are a bit too much. They are the ones with commercial modeling promotional pictures from twenty years ago, who think posing in front of luxury items makes them seem somehow more legitimate.

title: Spam bots galore
review: Lately the only messages I’ve been getting are from people somewhere past 7,000 miles away that want me to “find them” on another site. Or they are in the military in Africa but will be home soon. Or offering to put a decal on my car for $400 a week with a fake cashiers check. Or wanting to exchange sex for money. Anyone I’ve messaged does not respond, and the ones that have need money or a place to stay. This used to be a decent app. Now not so much. I’m about to delete this app because of the spam. Just like 99% is spam. And it seems to be more that I report it. Oh that’s it the developer is being paid to allow the spamming and the reported profiles are tagged with who reported it and they get the most spam. I get it now! Shady shady af

title: Best LGBT dating app I’ve used.
review:
Hornet is an awesome app. It by far leads in features, ease of use and safety.

When a user signs-up, they get to set up their profile with multiple photos and a cool feature where you can have up to 4 private photos that you can enable/disable within the messages. I also love the consent of the hornet badge. 

This app reminds me of if Instagram and Grindr had a baby and named it hornet. It combines location based profiles with versions filters similar to grindr but also has the ability to search usernames, hashtags, as well as create posts and follow users. 

I also love that hornet is constantly working to create a great community where users get rewarded a hornet badge when they are authentic. This is a great concept to help removing bots and and bad people. 

Thanks hornet ! 🏳️‍🌈 💚 💛 💜  🖤 🤍
